description_html:
The Senior Software Engineer / Developer will work alongside the Principal Software Engineer and lead a hands-on role in designing, developing, and integrating Generative AI and Machine Learning solutions into the Infor MES product. This role focuses on bringing rich AI features directly into the hands of daily users, supporting both shopfloor factory workers, supervisors and executives. You will be utilizing your existing .NET skillset, combined with AI technologies in Infor OS to build this expanded feature set.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Collaborate closely with the AI Team Lead and cross-functional teams to build AI/ML-enabled features within the Infor MES SaaS platform.
  • Develop scalable, secure, and maintainable software solutions primarily using .NET technologies.
  • Develop new Gen AI enabled features for the Infor MES product
  • Built out a rich API library with MCP support
  • Take advantage of the Infor OS stack, combined with LangChain to bring agentic AI into the MES Platform
  • Participate in design and code reviews to ensure software quality and adherence to best practices.
  • Assist in documenting architecture, development processes, and operational procedures related to AI/ML integrations.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize AI/ML-powered software components in the cloud environment.
  • Support Agile development processes and actively contribute to sprint planning, retrospectives, and team collaboration.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Proven professional software development experience with strong .NET (C#) expertise.
  • Practical understanding of AI and Machine Learning with experiencing building AI first features within an enterprise application.
  • Experience with MCP, LangChain and creating AI agents.
  • Experience developing cloud-based SaaS applications, preferably on AWS or similar platforms.
  • Familiarity with RESTful API design and microservices architecture.
  • Solid understanding of database technologies and data integration principles.
  • Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.
  • Good communication and teamwork abilities to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field, or equivalent experience.
  • Experience with Infor OS technologies including APIs, workflow automation, event-driven architecture, and identity management.
  • Prior exposure to Generative AI tools and frameworks, even if not deeply technical in AI model development.
  • Familiarity with multi-tenant SaaS environments and cloud security best practices.
  • Proven experience of building AI features within enterprise software
  • Background in MES, industrial software, or manufacturing domain is a plus.

description_html:
As a Principal Engineer, you will lead a high-impact team focused on advancing Infor MES by leveraging Infor OS technologies to design, develop, and deliver cutting-edge Generative AI and Machine Learning solutions. Your leadership and deep technical expertise will be critical to driving innovation within the MES product line by embedding intelligent automation, predictive analytics, and generative AI capabilities that enhance operational efficiency and customer value. You will be a key contributor to the strategic roadmap, collaborating with product management, engineering, data science, and cloud teams to build scalable, secure, and performant AI-driven features.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Lead, mentor, and grow a team of engineers focused on AI/ML development within the Infor MES solution.
  • Architect and deliver scalable Generative AI and Machine Learning solutions leveraging Infor OS platform services and APIs.
  • Drive the design and integration of AI/ML models into MES workflows, ensuring seamless customer experiences and operational reliability.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams — Product Management, Software Engineering, Cloud Infrastructure, and Security — to align AI initiatives with business goals.
  • Evaluate emerging AI/ML technologies and frameworks to continuously innovate and improve solution capabilities.
  • Lead code and design reviews, establish engineering standards, and promote a culture of technical excellence and knowledge sharing.
  • Partner with the Infor OS platform teams to leverage existing services (identity, event processing, workflow, analytics) to accelerate AI solution delivery.
  • Represent the AI/ML engineering function in technical leadership forums and contribute to company-wide innovation strategies.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Proven professional experience in software engineering, with significant experience in .NET development.
  • Strong understanding of Machine Learning and Generative AI concepts, with practical experience using AI/ML tools and frameworks in application development.
  • Familiarity with MCP, AI agents, and similar orchestration/control plane technologies used in AI-driven SaaS solutions.
  • Experience integrating AI/ML capabilities into enterprise SaaS products, preferably in cloud environments such as AWS.
  • Solid knowledge of REST APIs, microservices, and scalable SaaS architectures.
  • Proficiency in software development best practices, including CI/CD, automated testing, and code reviews.
  • Excellent leadership, mentoring, and communication skills to drive team success and stakeholder alignment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • Practical exposure to Generative AI tools (e.g., OpenAI APIs, Hugging Face interfaces, LangChain, or similar agent frameworks).
  • Background in MES or industrial software domains is a plus.
  • Understanding of multi-tenant SaaS environments and security best practices.
  • AWS certifications or equivalent cloud expertise.
  • Experience with Agile development methodologies and DevSecOps practices.

description_html:
As a Principal Engineer in the MES Cloud team at Infor, you will lead the architecture, design, and implementation of the transition of Infor MES from an existing on-premises software solution to a robust, scalable, multi-tenant cloud SaaS offering on AWS. You will be responsible for driving technical strategy, ensuring zero downtime deployments, implementing scalable cloud-native patterns, and enabling comprehensive logging and monitoring. Your deep experience with .NET and AWS cloud technologies will be critical to delivering a high-quality SaaS product that meets customer expectations for availability, performance, and security.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Lead the architectural design and implementation of the multi-tenant cloud SaaS platform for Infor MES on AWS.
  • Develop and enforce best practices for cloud migration from on-premises, including modernization of legacy components.
  • Design and implement zero downtime deployment strategies, including blue-green deployments, canary releases, and feature toggles.
  • Architect logging, monitoring, and alerting frameworks for proactive incident response and operational visibility.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product management, QA, DevOps, and security to align cloud strategies.
  • Drive scalability and performance tuning through cloud-native services such as auto-scaling, load balancing, and container orchestration.
  • Mentor engineering teams on cloud technologies, SaaS architecture, and DevOps practices.
  • Evaluate and adopt new AWS services and technologies to continuously improve platform capabilities.
  • Ensure compliance with security, data privacy, and regulatory requirements in cloud environments.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Proven software engineering experience with deep expertise in .NET Core/Framework.
  • Proven experience architecting and migrating enterprise software to AWS or equivalent cloud platforms.
  • Hands-on experience with AWS services: EC2, ECS/EKS, Lambda, RDS, CloudWatch, CloudFormation, IAM, etc.
  • Demonstrated ability to design and implement zero downtime deployment pipelines and CI/CD automation.
  • Strong knowledge of microservices, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and multi-tenant SaaS architecture.
  • Solid understanding of distributed systems, scalability, high availability, and fault tolerance.
  • Experience with logging and monitoring tools such as ELK Stack, Splunk, Datadog, or AWS CloudWatch.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills with a proven track record leading technical teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience with serverless architectures and event-driven design on AWS.
  • Knowledge of security best practices and compliance standards for cloud SaaS products.
  • Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and DevOps culture.
  • Experience working with manufacturing or MES software domains.
  • Prior experience working in a multi-tenant SaaS environment with subscription-based licensing models.
  • AWS Certified Solutions Architect or Developer certifications.

description_html:
We are looking for a highly motivated and tech-savvy Accounts Payable (AP) Specialist to join our dynamic finance team. If you have a background in administration, a strong interest in technology, and a passion for process improvement, this role is for you. Experience with tools such as Python, Alteryx, Power BI, or other analytical platforms is a plus and will allow you to enhance business insights.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Verify and upload vendor invoices, supporting the GBS AP processing team in resolving queries by liaising with vendors and local Infor entities.
  • Prepare, review, and process payment batches accurately and on time.
  • Respond to vendor inquiries regarding payment status.
  • Reconcile vendor statements and resolve discrepancies.
  • Assist with month-end closing procedures.
  • Support internal and external audits as needed.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams within Finance.
  • Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for business improvement.
  • Develop, maintain, and automate financial models and reports using available technology.
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable insights.

Required Qualifications:

  • Some experience in Accounts Payable or a similar role, with a strong focus on technology and automation.
  • Skills in Power BI for building interactive dashboards and reports.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with great attention to detail.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

What We Offer:

  • Opportunity to work at the intersection of finance and technology.
  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Career growth and professional development opportunities.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Exposure to advanced financial tools and automation technologies.

description_html:
Are you passionate about enterprise software and complex business solutions?
Do you thrive in strategic sales roles where you help organizations drive digital transformation?


Infor is looking for a driven and experienced Account Director to strengthen our presence in Sweden.
In this role, you will lead strategic license sales of Infor’s ERP solutions to new enterprise customers across industries, with a particular appreciation for candidates who bring experience from the manufacturing sector or who have worked extensively with manufacturing customers.


Whether your background is in ERP, or in MES and/or PLM sales with strong ERP exposure, we want to hear from you.


What you will do

  • Drive strategic license sales of Infor’s enterprise ERP solutions to new customers in the enterprise segment
  • Identify, qualify, and develop new business opportunities across multiple industries
  • Own and manage the entire sales cycle, from prospecting and value positioning to negotiation and closing
  • Build strong relationships with senior decision makers and act as a trusted advisor to customers navigating digital transformation
  • Understand customers’ business and operational challenges and position solutions that support efficiency, scalability, and growth
  • Collaborate closely with pre-sales, consulting, and delivery teams to ensure strong customer outcomes
  • Contribute to a high-performing, collaborative sales team by sharing insights, ideas, and best practices

Who you are

  • Proven experience in enterprise software sales, preferably ERP
  • Experience from the manufacturing industry, or a strong track record of selling enterprise solutions to manufacturing customers
  • Background in ERP sales, or alternatively MES and/or PLM with a solid understanding of ERP-driven business processes
  • Strategic, structured, and comfortable engaging with C-level and senior stakeholders
  • A self-driven, results-oriented professional who enjoys building new customer relationships
  • Familiar with the Swedish enterprise market and confident navigating complex, long sales cycles
  • A true team player who thrives in a collaborative, knowledge-sharing environment
  • Fluent in Swedish - speaking and writing (mandatory)

Why join Infor?

  • Join a global software company with deep expertise in enterprise and industry-specific solutions
  • Work with a market-leading ERP portfolio and a strong value proposition
  • Be part of a collaborative and experienced team with a strong sales culture
  • Competitive compensation package with performance-based incentives
  • Long-term career growth opportunities within a dynamic and innovative organization

description_html:
The Account Manager, Hospitality will be driving sales for the food service and entertainment group within the hospitality group at Infor.  Typical customers would include food service management customers, venue management customers, and convention center customers. You will establish resellers if appropriate while growing bookings for the business unit.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Working with prospective clients to understand their business objectives and create appropriate solution to meet their business needs.
  • Articulate the Infor value proposition and successfully communicate the competitive advantages, resources and processes to client and prospects.
  • Developing compelling value propositions based on ROI cost/benefit analysis.
  • Developing customer account strategies and tactical go-to-market plans while establishing, documenting, and maintaining follow-up procedures for all assigned account.
  • Working with the Account Managers to divide and conquer pipeline development, net new, upsell, and no customer left behind account strategies.
  • Maintaining and achieving consistent quarterly quota.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience working in or for the hospitality industry.
  • Experience selling point-of-sale hardware and point-of-sale software.
  • Experience selling venues and sales and event management software.
  • Experience establishing reseller network for hospitality-based hardware product suite.
  • Experience managing multiple sales cycles.
  • Experience developing business relationships with extended team members to drive sales.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Hospitality Point-of-Sale, Kiosk, Tablet experience. 
  • Sales and Event Management Experience
  • Experience working with stakeholders to include: Sales team, Consulting, Customer Success Group, Customer Support Group, Development, Marketing and Sales Management.
  • Willingness to Travel. (Min. of 40%)

Location:  Remote Based Role US (Dallas, TX; Greater Atlanta area)

description_html:
Infor is a leading provider of innovative enterprise solutions, specializing in Infor ERP systems. We are dedicated to empowering businesses with cutting-edge technology to optimize their operations and achieve strategic goals. As part of our expansion, we are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Infor ERP Sales Account Manager to join our team.


A Day in the Life Typically Includes

1. Achieve Sales Targets:

  • Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to meet and exceed sales targets for Infor ERP solutions.
  • Identify new business opportunities and generate leads through proactive prospecting and networking.

2. Direct and Co-Selling:

  • Manage both direct sales to customers and collaborate with strategic partners to maximize revenue opportunities.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with partners to drive joint sales initiatives.

3. Territory and Account Ownership:

  • Take ownership of a designated territory, developing a deep understanding of the market and customer needs.
  • Manage and nurture existing customer accounts, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention.

4. Full Account Management:

  • Provide end-to-end account management, from initial contact through to successful implementation and ongoing support.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for customers, addressing inquiries and ensuring a seamless customer experience.

5. Product Knowledge:

  • Stay current on industry trends and product developments related to Infor ERP solutions.
  • Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of the Infor ERP product suite and its value propositions.

6. Collaboration:

  • Work closely with internal teams, including pre-sales, implementation, and support, to ensure customer success and satisfaction.
  • Collaborate with marketing teams to develop and implement effective sales campaigns.


Basic Qualifications:

  • Proven track record of successful sales in the ERP software industry, with experience in Infor ERP preferred.
  • Familiarity with sales processes and methodologies, especially in a direct and partner-driven sales environment.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong customer relationships.
  • Strong negotiation and closing skills, with a focus on achieving and exceeding sales targets.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
  • Knowledge of Oracle, SAP, Microsoft ERP systems is a plus.
  • Experience of selling SaaS based ERP Solutions (min 3 years)
  • Fluency in English language
  • Experience of leading opportunities to closure in the US$150-500K bracket
  • Education and Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree in business, sales, or related field preferred but not essential.
  • Proven experience in enterprise software sales, with a focus on ERP solutions

Job Location: Germany or Austria - home or office based 
  • Generate healthy pipeline through cold-calling according to MEDDPICC, reaching out to CXOs building long-term relationships based on value-selling into net new accounts in the Retail & Distribution, Building Materials, Rental & Services industries.
  • Collaborate with Demand Generation peers to prepare, launch and follow-up on campaigns such as industry events, webinars, global shared center initiatives etc.
  • You will have a BDR assigned to you to help with prospecting on targeting accounts. Alignment and educational support is expected. This should drive 30-50% of your pipeline.
  • Build yourself up as an industry expert to help generate marketing content.
  • Build a network of advisory consultants to secure inbound leads.
  • Lead complete sales cycles teaming up resources from Solution Consulting, Value Engineering, Consulting, Industry Strategy, Sales Leadership and many more. Sales cycles are around 9-12 months or longer.
  • Your main focus areas will be Enterprise Resource Planning, Product Lifecycle Management and Supply Chain Planning. Potentially Warehouse Management and Manufacturing Execution Systems.
  • Spearhead commercial and legal SaaS and Service contract negotiations in line with forecast accuracy and linearity.
  • Build a continuous knowledge base of industry and account insights as well as market changes and potential business opportunities.
  • 30-50% of your time might be dedicated to travel depending of the time of the year.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Lead a best-in-class structured sales process leveraging all value adding capabilities across the international organization.
  • 3-5 years of net new sales experience in the Retail (ideally wood, glas, cement, parquet and any other construction materials), Rental and Services (ideally construction equipment) industries and understand their challenges to be able to do value selling.
  • Detail oriented, making sure obtain the highest quality of deliverables from the deal team.
  • Hands on mentality, self-motivated to set and achieve short term goals following a long-term vision.
  • Team player, wanting to share knowledge to close GAPs within the broader team.
  • Business understanding and analytical capabilities.
  • Self-secure to do handle C-Level cold calls and talk to a senior audience.
  • Business English and fluent (native speaker level) German to lead an international team of experts.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bonus points for tech affinity being able to manage a set of prospecting tools like SFDC, Outreach, MAP, Clari and others. Infor is a data driven company.
  • An established network with consulting/SI companies is a big plus.

description_html:
As a valued member of our Technology & Innovation Sales team, the Senior Account Executive will inspire and empower organizations by sharing the transformative potential of Infor’s digital business platform. You will engage with both existing customers and new industry partners to champion all aspects of our platform, including AI/ML Augmented Intelligence, Generative AI, Agentic, Enterprise Automation, Process Mining, Enterprise Integration, and Data Management.

We’re looking for someone passionate about weaving compelling industry stories around innovative technologies—always through the lens of meaningful customer outcomes and the real economic benefits of digital transformation.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Nurture strong, trust-based connections with regional Infor sales teams and customers by understanding their unique challenges and goals.
  • Partner with marketing and business development to design thoughtful marketing plans tailored to your industry accounts.
  • Listen carefully to uncover prospects’ business needs and align those with smart, innovative business platform solutions.
  • Prepare and deliver engaging C-suite presentations that focus on transformational outcomes and the client’s vision.
  • Inspire clients to rethink their business with innovation strategies grounded in clear ROI and cost-benefit insights.
  • Keep your industry knowledge sharp by participating in user groups and monitoring competitive offerings.
  • Collaborate seamlessly with Sales, Pre-sales, and Solution Consulting to ensure smooth and client-centered solutions.
  • Guide pricing and agreements toward mutually beneficial outcomes to successfully close deals.
  • Keep account information and activities up to date in internal systems and communicate forecasted revenue clearly with your sales leadership.

Basic Qualifications:

  • A passion for thriving in dynamic, start-up or incubated environments.
  • A solid understanding of AI/ML, Generative AI, Hyper Automation, Enterprise Integration, and Data Management.
  • The ability to translate complex technology into tangible business value and process improvements.
  • Familiarity with business operations such as supply chain management, inventory optimization, and sales forecasting.
  • A track record of success in a multi-product, collaborative team selling environment.
  • Creativity paired with strong attention to detail.
  • A proactive mindset with a natural sense of urgency.
  • Confidence and grace in building and nurturing executive-level relationships.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • A history of meeting or exceeding annual sales quotas of $1M+.
  • Comfort managing multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously.
  • A hunter’s spirit for identifying and pursuing new opportunities.
  • Up to 50% travel to connect with clients and teams.
  • Industry: Cross-vertical, with opportunity to explore diverse sectors.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Deep competitive and industry knowledge.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
  • Proven experience in solution selling.

description_html:
Infor is a fast-growing global technology leader dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that empower our clients to achieve their strategic goals. We’re seeking an entrepreneurial, driven, and emotionally intelligent Enterprise Sales Account Executive to join our dynamic team in The Benelux.


Key Responsibilities

  • Entrepreneurial Leadership: Proactively identify, qualify, and pursue new business opportunities within target enterprise accounts. Take ownership of the sales process with a founder’s mindset—driving pipeline growth and innovative go-to-market strategies.
  • Strategic Advisory: Serve as a trusted advisor to C-level and senior decision-makers, developing tailored value propositions aligned with client business objectives and industry trends. Guide customers through complex decision processes with consultative expertise.
  • Industry Expertise: Leverage deep, up-to-date knowledge of the F&B landscape, competitive dynamics, and emerging trends to position Infor as a thought leader and solution partner.
  • Orchestrator: Coordinate cross-functional internal teams—including Marketing, Business Development, Pre-Sales, Solution Consulting, Delivery, Professional Services and our Partner Community —to deliver compelling proposals, proofs of concept, and implementation plans. Ensure seamless client experiences from initial engagement through deal closure and onboarding.
  • Relationship Builder: Cultivate and nurture long-term, collaborative partnerships founded on trust, transparency, and mutual success. Demonstrate high emotional intelligence in stakeholder management and conflict resolution.
  • Contribution-Motivated: Consistently exceed individual and team goals. Share knowledge and best practices to elevate team and organizational performance.
  • Sales Excellence: Manage the full sales cycle from prospecting to contract negotiation and closure, maintaining robust and accurate forecasts and regularly reporting on pipeline status and results.


Key Qualifications

  • Proven success in enterprise B2B sales (SaaS, tech, or relevant industry preferred).
  • Demonstrated entrepreneurial approach to sourcing and developing new business.
  • Track record of building relationships at C-level and managing complex, consultative sales cycles.
  • Strong history in enterprise business application complex selling, especially in Food & Beverage
  • Ability to adapt and work effectively within a rapidly changing business / technology environment
  • Strong sense of growth mindset and resilience, to plan and execute effectively as Infor breaks new frontiers
  • Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and able to navigate ambiguity and change


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Must be organized and detail-oriented, as well as being an excellent communicator, collaborator, and networker/connector, bringing people together, driving actions to a successful conclusion.
  • Excellent conflict management skills, with a proven ability to gain trust with all stakeholders, successfully influencing senior decision makers.

Technology & Innovation Sales Team – International (EMEA/APJ)

About the Role:
As a valued member of our Technology & Innovation Sales team, you will inspire and empower organizations by sharing the transformative potential of Infor’s digital business platform. You will engage with both existing customers and new industry partners to champion all aspects of our platform, including AI/ML Augmented Intelligence, Generative AI, Agentic, Enterprise Automation, Process Mining, Enterprise Integration, and Data Management.

We’re looking for someone passionate about weaving compelling industry stories around innovative technologies—always through the lens of meaningful customer outcomes and the real economic benefits of digital transformation.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes

  • Build Meaningful Relationships: Nurture strong, trust-based connections with regional Infor sales teams and customers by understanding their unique challenges and goals.
  • Collaborate Creatively: Partner with marketing and business development to design thoughtful marketing plans tailored to your industry accounts.
  • Discover and Solve: Listen carefully to uncover prospects’ business needs and align those with smart, innovative business platform solutions.
  • Lead with Confidence: Prepare and deliver engaging C-suite presentations that focus on transformational outcomes and the client’s vision.
  • Encourage Fresh Perspectives: Inspire clients to rethink their business with innovation strategies grounded in clear ROI and cost-benefit insights.
  • Stay Informed and Ahead: Keep your industry knowledge sharp by participating in user groups and monitoring competitive offerings.
  • Work Together Across Teams: Collaborate seamlessly with Sales, Pre-sales, and Solution Consulting to ensure smooth and client-centered solutions.
  • Negotiate with Integrity: Guide pricing and agreements toward mutually beneficial outcomes to successfully close deals.
  • Stay Organized: Keep account information and activities up to date in internal systems and communicate forecasted revenue clearly with your sales leadership.

What You Will Need: 

Basic Qualifications

  • A passion for thriving in dynamic, start-up or incubated environments.
  • A solid understanding of AI/ML, Generative AI, Hyper Automation, Enterprise Integration, and Data Management.
  • The ability to translate complex technology into tangible business value and process improvements.
  • Familiarity with business operations such as supply chain management, inventory optimization, and sales forecasting.
  • A track record of success in a multi-product, collaborative team selling environment.
  • Creativity paired with strong attention to detail.
  • A proactive mindset with a natural sense of urgency.
  • Confidence and grace in building and nurturing executive-level relationships.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • A history of meeting or exceeding annual sales quotas of $1M+.
  • Comfort managing multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously.
  • A hunter’s spirit for identifying and pursuing new opportunities.

What Will Put You Ahead? Preferred Qualifications

  • Deep competitive and industry knowledge.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
  • Proven experience in solution selling.

description_html:
We are seeking someone who is interested in pursuing a career in finance with strong desire to be involved in system applications and emerging technologies. This role will focus on delivering internal efficiencies through technology, optimizing financial systems, and enabling the adoption of new technologies including AI and automation tools whilst working within an accounting team focused on US GAAP accounting and supporting local reporting across the EMEA region. The accounting team is organized into several different workstreams, each stream has an area of focus and will have various responsibilities. 


Key Responsibilities: 
  • Work with the team to evaluate, recommend, and integrate new financial technologies to improve process efficiencies and accuracy. 
  • Develop and maintain automated tools to support day-to-day operations. 
  • Help train and mentor accounting staff on system applications and technology usage. 
  • Stay updated on the latest trends and best practices in accounting technology. 
  • Some responsibility for accounting entries that will vary depending on the workstream, examples include:          - Payroll and employee benefits accounting
    - Prepayments and accruals
    - Fixed Asset accounting
    - Lease capitalization accounting
    - Analytical review of allocated workstream area
    - Balance Sheet reconciliations
    - Work with statutory accounting teams to ensure filings are completed and compliance obligations met.

Key Competencies:
  • Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and drive for process improvement  
  • Planning, Prioritising and Organisation of Workload 
  • Problem Solving Skills 
  • Work on own initiative, high level of motivation 
  • Collaborative team player with a proactive approach to learning and personal development  
  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written)

Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
  • Good knowledge of spreadsheet applications 
  • Possess a positive attitude to challenges 
  • Being adaptable to change, sometimes at short notice
  • Ability to learn new software or technologies quickly and independently 
  • Exposure to data manipulation and automation tools such as Power Apps, Alteryx, or other ETL platforms is highly desirable - Knowledge of Python, SQL, or similar scripting languages to analyze and automate financial data processes is highly desirable 
  • Ability to interact with a range of colleagues up to and including senior management level 
  • The ability to work on your own initiative and as part of a team. 
  • Previous experience in working a finance organisation, ideally in an SSC environment is beneficial but not essential. 
  • Knowledge of a European foreign language is beneficial but not essential

description_html:
The Partner Account Manager (PAM) is aligned to specific partners and accountable for the partner relationship and for planning and executing across all relevant business models and the entire partner lifecycle.  The PAM will drive engagement with managed partners and Infor field sales for business planning, execution and governance. This role manages the partner go-to-market strategy, to select, enable, and empower key partners to drive success through business planning and demand generation. The PAM will own the full partner sales cycle including partner alignment through to opportunity execution and partner growth.


A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Maintain an active partner engagement, ensuring they are enabled to nurture and develop customer relationships, driving growth and maximizing revenue.
  • Develop joint business plans, go-to-market strategies and lead generation opportunities with partners. 
  • Leverage the Infor Partner Network (IPN) program to help the partner expand in markets and industries where they are comparatively advantaged.
  • Guide partners through structured learning journeys, ensuring they obtain comprehensive training and achieve necessary certifications.
  • Drive cross-functional collaboration across Sales, Marketing, and Enablement to support partner success and enhance competitive win rates while executing the joint business plan across relevant business models.
  • Engage in hosting regular Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR's) with Partners and appropriate Infor stakeholders driving productivity and performance insights to optimize growth strategies.  

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in developing Ecosystem, Industry and micro vertical sales relationships.
  • Experience developing and executing partner led strategies, driving growth and profitability.
  • Experience building engagement programs and marketing support for strategic Partners.
  • Experience building effective executive relationships, nurturing and developing mutually beneficial partnerships and outcomes.
  • Travel requirements:  50%

Preferred Qualifications:

·       SaaS/Cloud/ERP sales experience in a partner/channel ecosystem.

·       Partner account manager experience. 

Location:  Hybrid - 3 days in office (Dallas, TX; Alpharetta or Atlanta, GA)

We are seeking an experienced Application Support Operations Manager to lead their assigned team of support analysts and optimize our support operations. The role is responsible for effectively guiding team members and ensuring they have the required technical and product knowledge to address customer issues. The role will contribute to shaping the organizational culture, fostering collaboration within the team and cross-functionally with key stakeholders, while proactively identifying and addressing obstacles to enhance both team performance and customer experience. The Customer Support Manager drives team development, performance management and mentoring, fostering engagement and motivation, promoting collaboration and addressing conflicts constructively to help team members grow and achieve their career goals.

Key Responsibilities:

Leadership and team management:
  • Lead, motivate, and coach a team of support analysts.
  • Set clear expectations, conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and develop team members and help them achieve their career goals
  • Foster a positive and collaborative team environment, encouraging high engagement and motivation, celebrating achievements, recognizing contributions, and creating opportunities for team members to feel valued and connected to the broader goals
  • Invest in the growth of the team members, getting them the required training, knowledge and enablement.
  • Help shape the culture of the support function, ensuring alignment with broader organizational goals.

Process improvement, technical and product knowledge:
  • Maintain and evolve a solid understanding of the technical and product contexts to effectively guide and support the team.
  • Ensure teams have the required technical and product knowledge to effectively address customer needs.
  • Identify, analyze, and implement support process improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Develop and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) and workflows.
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and identify areas for improvement.

Team and customer experiences
  • Collaborate across the Support function and with product development, Cloud Operations and other key counterparts to proactively identify problems, assess systemic issues and clear obstacles, ensuring that the support team is equipped to address customer issues effectively.
  • Monitor customer feedback and drive areas for improvement in the customer experience.
  • Implement strategies to enhance support team effectiveness and improve customer satisfaction and retention.

Reporting and analysis:
  • Generate regular reports on support operations performance and key metrics.
  • Analyze data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement, taking a proactive approach to identifying issues.
  • Present findings and recommendations to senior management.

Plan management:
  • Develop and manage the support operations plan for assigned team
  • Monitor expenses and ensure that the plan is adhered to.

Required Qualifications:

  • Proved experience in customer support or operations management.
  • Proven leadership and team management skills.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Proven leadership in implementing new tools like AI, process improving through implementing automation.
  • Proven knowledge experience with Cloud based solution and hands-on solving technical issues.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.P

description_html:
As a software lead, you will play a critical role in defining and driving the architectural vision of our RPA product. You will ensure technical excellence, mentor engineering teams, and collaborate across departments to deliver innovative automation solutions. This is a unique opportunity to influence the future of RPA technology and make a significant impact on the industry.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Define and lead the architectural design and development of the RPA product, ensuring solutions are scalable, maintainable, and aligned with organizational strategic goals. Provide technical leadership and mentor team members on architectural best practices.
  • Analyze and resolve complex technical challenges, including performance bottlenecks, scalability issues, and integration challenges, to ensure high system reliability and performance.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, including product managers, QA, and engineering teams, to define system requirements, prioritize technical objectives, and design cohesive solutions. Provide architectural insights during sprint planning and agile processes.
  • Establish and enforce coding standards, best practices, and guidelines across the engineering team, conducting code reviews with a focus on architecture, maintainability, and future scalability.
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for system architecture, design decisions, and implementation details, ensuring knowledge transfer and facilitating team collaboration.
  • Architect and oversee robust testing strategies, including automated unit, integration, and regression tests, to ensure adherence to quality standards and efficient system validation.
  • Research and integrate emerging technologies, particularly advancements in RPA and automation, to continually enhance the product’s capabilities and technical stack. Drive innovation and implement best practices within the team.
  • Serve as a technical mentor and advisor to engineering teams, fostering professional growth and ensuring alignment with the overall architectural vision.
  • Ensure that the RPA product adheres to security and compliance standards by incorporating secure design principles, conducting regular security reviews, and implementing necessary safeguards to protect data integrity, confidentiality, and availability.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

·     Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

·     8+ years of professional experience in software development.

Required Skills:

  • Expertise in object-oriented programming languages such as Java, C#, or similar, with a strong understanding of design patterns and principles.
  • Deep familiarity with software development best practices, version control systems (e.g., Git), and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) workflows.
  • Proven experience deploying and managing infrastructure on cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, including knowledge of containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
  • Strong proficiency in architecting, building, and optimizing RESTful APIs and microservices, with familiarity in tools like Swagger/OpenAPI and Postman for design and testing
  • Comprehensive knowledge of SQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, SQLServer) with expertise in designing scalable and reliable data models, including creating detailed Entity-Relationship Diagrams (ERDs) and optimizing database schemas for performance and maintainability.
  • Demonstrated experience in building and maintaining robust CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Jenkins or GitLab CI.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead teams in identifying and resolving complex software and infrastructure issues using advanced troubleshooting techniques and tools.
  • Exceptional communication and leadership skills, with the ability to guide and collaborate with cross-functional teams, bridging technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a focus on documenting technical designs, code, and system processes clearly and concisely.
  • Comfortable and experienced in agile development environments, demonstrating adaptability to evolving requirements and timelines while maintaining high productivity and focus on deliverables.
  • Familiarity with security best practices in software development, such as OWASP guidelines, secure coding principles, and implementing authentication/authorization frameworks (e.g., OAuth, SAML, JWT).
  • Experience with microservices architecture, message brokers (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka), and event-driven design.
  • Extensive experience in performance optimization and scalability, with a focus on designing high-performance systems and utilizing profiling tools and techniques to optimize both code and infrastructure for maximum efficiency.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with serverless architecture, including deploying and managing serverless applications using platforms such as AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, or Google Cloud Functions, to build scalable, cost-effective solutions.
  • Experience with RPA tools or frameworks (e.g., UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism) is a plus.
  • Experience with Generative AI technologies, including working with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face, and integrating AI/ML models into software applications.
Hands-on experience with data analytics or logging tools like ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) or Splunk for monitoring and troubleshooting application performance

description_html:
Our Business Development organization generates a pipeline of qualified opportunities for the Field Sales team by connecting with Infor customers and prospects through a multi-channel prospecting methodology. In a global innovative, competitive, and collaborative culture, the Business Development Team Lead fosters an environment where people feel in control of their own success. Working through market proven KPIs, technology stack and guidelines for success, the Business Development Team Lead provides ongoing coaching on how to lead in with a personalized and relevant approach to ensure a best-in-class seller & buyer experience.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Lead a team of individual contributors by coaching and leveraging data driven insights
  • Own Go-To-Market execution through inbound lead qualification and outbound prospecting
  • Hands on coaching and shadowing on advanced prospecting methodology, including multi-channel, prospecting sequence, account mapping & inbound lead management
  • Utilizing the marketing vehicles and tactics that contribute to build a pipeline that moves
  • Key contributor in elevating best practices at a global level – leading cross regional initiatives as well as Business Development Representative (BDR) led programs
  • Key stakeholder in the BDR/Sales/Marketing alignment – own consistent communication & reporting cadence
  • Advanced use of the prospecting technology stack. Comfortable in leveraging prospecting data as leading indicators of the Rep performance and effectiveness

Basic Qualifications:
  • Experience working in sales
  • Knowledge of the dynamics of enterprise sales across different lines of business and geographies
  • Experience working across virtual and diverse teams to tackle specific business problems and offer solutions
  • Knowledge of the role of business development in the buying and selling journey
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Sales leadership experience
  • Outbound lead generation experience
  • Experience within the software or technology industry

description_html:
Infor is seeking an Associate Product Support Analyst to provide dedicated technical and operational support for Department of Defense (DoD) customers utilizing Infor’s Hospitality Management Solution (HMS). This role serves as a key liaison between Infor Support and DoD partners, ensuring seamless communication, timely issue resolution, and exceptional customer experience across military base implementations. The ideal candidate combines strong problem-solving skills, technical proficiency, and a customer-first mindset to deliver reliable, high-quality remote support that upholds Infor’s commitment to service excellence.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Serve as a support liaison between the Infor Support business unit and the customers for both functional and technical support for the Hospitality product lines.
  • Provide courteous customer service in an accurate and timely manner in accordance with existing procedures.
  • Provide application support by responding to incidents, interpreting queries and problems, examining data, error logs, and utilizing all available support material and tools to successfully resolve the problem.
  • Resolve customer questions or problems over the telephone or via the chat tool focusing on product functionality, operating environments and system configuration/setup.
  • Proactively keep customers informed of how and when problems are resolved with a focus on retention and reference ability.
  • Develop and maintain effective customer communications by managing the customers’ expectations through use of negotiation, persuasion, diplomacy, and clear communication in the English language, ensuring customer satisfaction and customer retention.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Experience working in customer service or support.
  • Experience identifying and evaluating possible solutions for product related questions.
  • Experience with operating environments.
  • Ability to work 2nd or 3rd shift.
  • Ability to work weekends and holidays.
  • US Citizenship is required due to US Government contract requirements. 

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Hospitality industry experience with check in/out, accounting, and/or reporting.
  • Experience using SQL.
  • Experience with technical support of cloud applications.
  • Technology Help Desk experience a plus.
  • Experience with remote desktop viewing through tools such as Webex or SecureLink.
  • Experience using a CRM such as ServiceNow to log work cases.
  • Knowledge of various software applications used for testing, troubleshooting, call logging, etc.
US Remote (Alpharetta, GA)

description_html:
The Industry Solution Architect plays a key role in Infor by providing both sales support and delivery leadership throughout the entire customer engagement lifecycle, leveraging deep industry expertise.

Overview:

Infor is seeking an experienced Industry Solution Architect in the Automotive Industry to join our team in Japan and drive customer success through innovative solutions. This role focuses on designing and implementing industry-specific cloud solutions that align with business objectives and deliver measurable value.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead workshops to understand customer business requirements and adopt industry best practice processes that address key challenges, utilizing Infor's Time to Value approach for rapid and efficient value realization.
  • Act as a trusted advisor, engaging with C-level executives to demonstrate the strategic value and competitive advantage of Infor’s solutions and prescriptive approach.
  • Architect and oversee the delivery of end-to-end process solutions, ensuring alignment with customer goals and adherence to industry standards.
  • Guide customers in adopting cloud innovations, new technology and achieving their transformation objectives with faster implementation and greater value, leveraging pre-built content and minimizing customizations.

Qualifications:

  • Extensive Track Record in Automotive Industry: Deep industry experience and the ability to engage in meaningful, high-level discussions with C-level stakeholders.
  • Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders at all organizational levels.
  • Collaborative Mindset: Strong problem-solving, analytical, and teamwork capabilities, with the ability to work effectively across diverse teams.
  • Solution Architecture Expertise: Demonstrated success in designing and implementing ERP solutions within Automotive. (preferred)

Why Infor?

  • Career Development: Benefit from global training and certification programs and opportunities for career growth.
  • Innovative Environment: Work in a culture that fosters creativity and values collaboration.
  • Customer Impact: Play a critical role in helping our customers achieve their business transformations.

If you are passionate about driving digital transformation in the Automotive Industry, we’d love to hear from you.

description_html:
The Principal Consultant is responsible for leading Analytics implementation projects, providing expertise in the design, configuration, and deployment . This role involves working closely with clients to understand their business processes, gathering requirements, and ensuring the effective implementation of Industry Analytics solutions. The Principal Consultant will lead teams, manage complex project timelines, and ensure that project deliverables align with client objectives. 

Experience – 8+ Years.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Develop and support Data Analytics
  • Gather and document technical requirements
  • Continuously researching current, and emerging technologies, and coming up with innovations
  • Exhibit excellent verbal and written communications skills while working in a collaborative team environment.
  • Deliver results efficiently, prioritize activities, and manage time effectively.
  • Engage and participate actively in Discovery workshops.
  • Delegate tasks to the team and review their progress.
  • Leading and taking ownership of the deliverables
  • Contribute to Additional Business Generation.
 

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • Experience working on Birst or any reporting tools (e.g. Business Objects, IBM Cognos, MicroStrategy, Qlik Sense, Power BI, etc.).
  • Experience working on Data warehousing.
  • Expertise with data warehousing concepts, data analytics, terminology, and architecture.
  • Experience with programming e.g.Python.
  • Strong understanding of data analysis, data modelling, and ETL tools.
  • Excellent SQL skills and a good understanding of database technologies.
  • Familiarity with the Agile SCRUM process.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • High degree of self-motivation and the ability to organize and prioritize multiple tasks.
  • Ability to translate user requirements into functional or product requirements and be able to document them effectively.
  • Quick learner with excellent analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent team player, able to work with virtual and global cross-functional teams.
  • Hands-on expertise in training the team and developing best practices and tools.
  • Ability to prepare project plans and provide accurate estimates.
  • Knowledge of Data Fabric, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and the AWS platform from an enterprise solution perspective.
  • Familiarity with Infor Products such as M3, LN and ERP, as well as Infor OS, is a bonus.

description_html:
QA Engineer

Location: Hyderabad, India

About the Role

We are looking for a skilled QA Engineer to join the AIris engineering team. AIris is Infor’s GenAI-powered centralized knowledge hub designed to integrate, understand, and surface insights from diverse content sources. This role requires strong test automation skills, deep attention to quality, and the ability to work closely with business stakeholders to translate requirements into testable solutions.

You will work closely under the guidance of a team leader and collaborate across cross-functional engineering groups within Infor’s GenAI and Infor OS ecosystems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain automated tests using Selenium and related frameworks.
  • Perform functional, regression, integration, and end-to-end testing for web and/or backend applications.
  • Create and maintain test plans, test cases, test scripts, and test documentation.
  • Collaborate closely with product owners, developers, and cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality releases.
  • Identify, document, and track defects through resolution using standard defect management tools.
  • Contribute to business analysis activities, including gathering functional requirements, documenting use cases, and supporting user acceptance testing.

Required Qualifications

  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a QA Engineer or similar role.
  • Hands-on experience with QA test automation using Selenium (mandatory).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability and willingness to take on a dual role as Business Analyst when needed.
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or a related discipline.

Preferred Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Experience with API automation.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Exposure to performance or security testing tools.

Business Development is the start of an incredible career journey in sales and is an integral part of the continued success and growth of Infor. Our Business Development Representatives are responsible for generating leads for our field sales teams. Along with building new business for Infor, BDR’s also have the opportunity to nurture our existing customer base to drive additional revenue. BDR’s will get additional insight into our sales cycle, forecasting tools, and sales methodologies.

As a BDR, the candidate will generate qualified leads for our sales organization through social selling, e-mailing, and calling prospects and customers. The candidate will consistently deliver our value proposition while gaining sales experience in a fun and collaborative environment. In this role you the candidate use cutting edge marketing automation tools to prospect and nurture your sales leads.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
• Tight alignment with the field sales organization in developing account plans and value proposition for our prospective customers
• Net new business opportunity and pipeline generation through multi-channel prospecting
• Multi-channel prospecting involves identification of the buyer and engagement predominately through the phone but also via email and social media
• Focus on opportunity quality of those passed to the sales team
• Continuous feedback loop to Sales and Marketing on market intelligence gathered every day from our buyers
• Reporting on campaign performance and account-based prospecting
• Meet monthly and quarterly goals established for sales accepted opportunities and pipeline value
• Be part of the evolution of our global organization from day 1 and learn to navigate
• Prospecting into Japan territory

• Experience with prospecting methodologies preferred
• Ability to grasp concepts quickly, drive to succeed, and target/results drive

As a Business Development Representative at Infor, you will be on the front lines of our sales engine. You will drive new business opportunities by identifying, contacting, and qualifying potential customers for Infor’s cloud-based solutions across targeted verticals.   • Experience in a sales, business development, or customer-facing role.

  • Experience conducting business level conversations with senior stakeholders.
  • Be organized, having attention to detail.
  • Be curious and have a desire to grow in a SaaS sales career.
  • Experience creating strong written content.
  • Experience conducting business level conversations with senior stakeholders.

Along with building new business for Infor, BDR’s also have the opportunity to nurture our existing customer base to drive additional revenue. BDR’s will get additional insight into our sales cycle, forecasting tools, and sales methodologies.

As a BDR, the candidate will generate qualified leads for our sales organization through social selling, e-mailing, and calling prospects and customers. The candidate will consistently deliver our value proposition while gaining sales experience in a fun and collaborative environment. In this role you the candidate use cutting edge marketing automation tools to prospect and nurture your sales leads.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Tight alignment with the field sales organization in developing account plans and value proposition for our prospective customers
  • Net new business opportunity and pipeline generation through multi-channel prospecting
  • Multi-channel prospecting involves identification of the buyer and engagement predominately through the phone but also via email and social media
  • Focus on opportunity quality of those passed to the sales team
  • Continuous feedback loop to Sales and Marketing on market intelligence gathered every day from our buyers
  • Reporting on campaign performance and account-based prospecting
  • Meet monthly and quarterly goals established for sales accepted opportunities and pipeline value
  • Be part of the evolution of our global organization from day 1 and learn to navigate
  • Prospecting into Japan territory
Basic Qualifications 
  • Minimum 2 year of experiences in Business Development/Inside Sales in a B2B environment prospecting into Japan territory
  • Patience and excellent communication skills
  • A team player with the ability to build strong peer and interpersonal relationships
  • Upbeat, dynamic communicator. Flexible “can do” attitude
  • Proficient PC Skills in Microsoft Office, exposure to CRM and sales prospecting tools a bonus
  • Experience with prospecting methodologies preferred
  • Ability to grasp concepts quickly, drive to succeed, and target/results drive

description_html:
Business Development is the start of an incredible career journey in sales and is an integral part of the continued success and growth of Infor. You will play a key role in driving new business for our sales organization. At Infor, we provide the best sales training ground, that enables you to enhance your skills and accelerate your career trajectory.

  • Owning & driving a specific industry/region to drive discovery of net-new opportunities.
  • Advanced prospecting within your target industry/region by reaching out to companies who have displayed demographic or behavioral buying signals
  • Identification and multi-channel engagement with our buyers through the phone, email, and social media.
  • Working alongside our intelligent tech stack to drive success (Salesforce, Outreach, ZoomInfo and many others)
  • Build a sustainable pipeline focusing on quality. Quantity is nothing without quality!
  • Generate highly qualified opportunities with the propensity to close
  • Building strong alignment with the different stakeholders within Infor, specifically in sales & marketing.
  • Lead on innovation and demonstrate creative destruction to turn your ideas into initiatives that will benefit the global organization.

What will you get?

·       A best-in class and structured onboarding program and daily support from a mentor who will ensure you ramp-up successfully.

·       Strong company investment in different career paths that fit your skills and help you reach your full potential

·       Grow in a global & multi-cultural work environment where the strength of the team is each individual member, and the strength of each member is the team

·       Acquire industry leading prospecting skills with the most modern prospecting tech stack (Sales engagement platform, conversation Intelligence, intent technology, and more)

·       Become an industry cloud expert and practice in having business, outcome focused conversations

·       Learn how to think like an entrepreneur to drive growth and success

·       Participation in digital or face to face sales engagement.

What does the ideal Infor BDR look like?

·       Native/Bilingual in German and in English.

·       Good interpersonal, negotiation and persuasive skills

·       Strong organizational skills

·       Competitive, collaborative and innovative

·       Energetic team player

·       Basic understanding of technology tools


Benefits

🌿 Live well 
 Enjoy a modern, sustainable workspace designed for balance, comfort, collaboration and inspiration. 

  • On-site gym and changing rooms 

  • Terrace with panoramic city views 

  • Relaxation & downtime rooms (ping-pong, game area) 

  • Lactation room, and delivery lockers 

  • Bike & car parking 

  • Easy access by metro, tram, train, or bike 

  • Private medical insurance & meal vouchers 

  • 35-hour weeks in August, no salary reduction 

  • Volunteer time off (8 h/year) 

  • Employee Assistance Program (Lyra) 

🚀 Grow strong 

  • Growth and mobility path 

  • Learn, stretch, and evolve through feedback 

  • Culture of autonomy, purpose, and personal growth 

🤝 Connect deeply 

  • Located in the heart of 22@ (Sant Marti), near Glòries 

  • Monthly team events – sports, social, charity 

  • Inclusive culture celebrating openness and shared success 

💻 Work smart 

  • Hybrid model (From January:  3 days office / 2 days home)  

  • Work from abroad – up to 30 days per year 

  • Competitive compensation  

  • Referral program. 

  • Support of relocation          

And many more as part of the flexible remuneration plan....

As a BDR, the candidate will generate qualified leads for our sales organization through social selling, e-mailing, and calling prospects and customers. The candidate will consistently deliver our value proposition while gaining sales experience in a fun and collaborative environment. In this role you the candidate use cutting edge marketing automation tools to prospect and nurture your sales leads.

•            Tight alignment with the field sales organization in developing account plans and value proposition for our prospective customers

•            Net new business opportunity and pipeline generation through multi-channel prospecting

•            Multi-channel prospecting involves identification of the buyer and engagement predominately through the phone but also via email and social media

•            Focus on opportunity quality of those passed to the sales team

•            Continuous feedback loop to Sales and Marketing on market intelligence gathered every day from our buyers

•            Meet monthly and quarterly goals established for sales accepted opportunities and pipeline value

•            Be part of the evolution of our global organization from day 1 and learn to navigate

•            Minimum 2 year of experiences in Business Development/Inside Sales in a B2B environment

•            Patience and excellent communication skills

•            A team player with the ability to build strong peer and interpersonal relationships

•            Upbeat, dynamic communicator. Flexible “can do” attitude

All employment decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and business needs.

As a Business Development Representative at Infor, you will be on the front lines of our sales engine. You will drive new business opportunities by identifying, contacting, and qualifying potential customers for Infor’s cloud-based solutions across targeted verticals. This role is ideal for a high-energy, self-motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about technology and innovation.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:
  • Strategically engage prospects through phone, email, and social channels to generate new qualified sales leads.
  • Research target accounts and key stakeholders within industry-specific segments.
  • Educate prospects on Infor’s differentiated value propositions and product capabilities.
  • Collaborate with field sales, marketing, and solution consultants to align outreach with campaign and pipeline objectives.
  • Maintain accurate activity tracking and lead management using CRM (Salesforce).
  • Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly targets for qualified meetings, opportunities, and pipeline contribution.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Experience in a sales, business development, or customer-facing role.
  • Experience creating strong written content.
  • Experience conducting business level conversations with senior stakeholders.
  • Fluent English and Arabic language.
  • Be organized, having attention to detail.
  • Be curious and have a desire to grow in a SaaS sales career.

description_html:
As a Services Business Development Representative (BDR), you’ll help customers get more value from their solutions by connecting them with the right service offerings from cloud modernization and adoption to optimization and best-practice enablement. You’ll generate qualified opportunities through smart outreach, discovery, and simple value-based messaging, partnering closely with Services Sales and account teams to drive pipeline and customer outcomes.

 

Why Join Us

  • Launch your sales career with coaching, structure, and real growth paths
  • Work in a global environment with modern tools and strong teamwork
  • Learn consultative selling focused on customer outcomes—not just volume

 

What You’ll Do

  • Identify and engage target accounts (existing customers and selected prospects) using structured outreach via email, phone, and social.
  • Run discovery conversations to understand business needs, challenges, stakeholders, and timelines.
  • Position service offerings that help customers modernize, adopt innovation, and improve outcomes (value/ROI-focused messaging).
  • Build qualified pipeline for Services Sales and relevant overlays.
  • Coordinate warm handoffs with clear context (customer need, impact hypothesis, next steps).
  • Maintain accurate activity and pipeline tracking in CRM and follow a defined territory/coverage plan.
  • Use customer signals and insights (adoption, support trends, usage patterns where available) to prioritize accounts and personalize outreach.

 

What Success Looks Like

  • Consistent pipeline generation and high-quality opportunity qualification
  • Strong qualification  and opportunity progression through clear next steps
  • Excellent territory execution and prioritization
  • Credible and relevant messaging that bring value to our customers.


Basic Qualifications

  • Swedish (native/fluent) and English (professional)
  • Good interpersonal, negotiation and persuasive skills
  • Strong communication skills and comfort speaking with customers
  • Organized, proactive, and resilient, comfortable with outreach and targets
  • Interest in building a long-term career in B2B sales and customer value


Preferred Qualifications

  • First experience (internship/part-time) in sales, customer-facing roles, or B2B environments
  • Familiarity with CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce) and customer platforms (a plus)
  • Interest in cloud, digital transformation, services, and value-based selling


Benefits

  • Clear and motivating progression path to develop and grow
  • Flexibility to work between home and office (Hybrid: office + 2 days/week WFH)
  • Competitive and attainable compensation structure with extra incentives. Salary will be discussed on first interview.
  • Office situated in Barcelona (Saint Marti next to Glories)
  • Ticket restaurant – explore Barcelona´s best local cuisines.
  • Private medical insurance
  • Monthly team events: Sport club, social club and charity events.
  • And More…

description_html:
The Channel Account Manager will foster relationships with our top SMB distribution channel partners, their customers, and prospects, as well as building relationships with new partners.  This will include creating and implementing sales growth strategies designed to increase profitability, closing difficult and strategic sales, accurately forecasting, and moderating discussions between our marketing team and the channel partners to continuously build pipeline.  They will also be responsible for assessing the challenges and growth areas of partnerships and gain partner mindshare to improve performance.


A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Leveraging channel management best practices by collaborating with peers in cross-functional teams within Infor.
  • Assisting in the development of the regional and national marketing strategy and campaigns that supports channel partner revenue goals.
  • Managing sales and management activities within assigned channels including planning, budgeting, project management, execution and success metrics.  
  • Responsible for driving and growing revenue performance.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in marketing, operations, business development, sales, customer success or management consulting.
  • Experience with developing business through the partner ecosystem.
  • Experience sharing a value proposition along with partner ROI at C-Suite level.
  • Experience in the SMB market for both prospects and partners.
  • Experience selling enterprise software.
  • Experience working in a quota driven role. 
  • Ability to travel up to 50%
  • Legal Authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience as a business consultant in ERP or SaaS software environment.
  • Experience with business analytics/business acumen to partnerships.
  • Experience across industries. (i.e. Wholesale Distribution, Industrial, Electrical and Plumbing, HVAC, etc.)
  • Bachelors Degree or Masters Degree in Business or related field.
  • Experience managing a large pipeline of customers and prospects through multiple partners.

Location:  US Remote (Dallas, TX; Atlanta, GA)

description_html:
The Infor Global Professional Services (GPS) Organization enables our customers to rapidly recognize the value of Infor Solutions in a responsible, timely and cost effective fashion by providing our customers consulting, implementation, development and managed services. To strengthen the GPS Sales in Japan, we are looking for a motivated, creative and enthusiastic (Senior) Client Partner.

Reporting to VP of GPS, the (Senior) Client Partner is primarily responsible for selling of consulting, implementation, development and managed services for ERP systems.  The (Senior) Client Partner will work with the License Team, Services Managers and Delivery Teams to sell the services to Infor customers and prospects. This role will be focus on the Discrete manufacturing industry (particularly Automotive)

Your Responsibilities Include

  • Build up (and maintain) a long term relationship with the customers through the positioning of Infor as a solution provider and understanding of the customer business requirements
  • Engage with the license new business teams to propose and present cost effective services solutions in line with the license opportunity and which supports the bid strategy
  • Develop an account strategy to identify and develop opportunities by analyzing customers business requirements especially as it relates to how Infor’s services can unlock that business value
  • Develop and execute a Sales Strategy to drive the identified opportunities to closure so that individual targets are met or exceeded
  • Develop and execute marketing campaigns to drive pipeline and revenue generation.
  • Acts as the “director” and “motivator” of the Sales Team e.g. Legal, Pre-Sales, Delivery Management and other disciplines which are assigned to a certain opportunity.

Ensure that an effective and winning proposal is being put forward, in an efficient and cost effective manner

  • Comply with all company processes and tools used to record and track opportunities and orders and report progress.
  • Manage opportunities for new business and installed base in line with Infor’s standard documentation and procedures

Knowledge and Skills, You Bring to the Organization

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • 5+ years of successful relevant services sales, ideally ERP in the manufacturing industry
  • Demonstrated history of selling complex solutions
  • Know-how of Cloud solutions
  • Ability to work on own or as part of a team to achieve services sales targets
  • Ability to manage forecast / pipeline and reflect a true position with date driven deadlines
  • Preferable proven business relationship skills
  • Analytic and strategic strong in thinking, execution and messaging
  •   Excellent communication, presentation, organizational and planning skills
  • Strong negotiation and closing skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to work as a team member and customer liaison
  • Proven ability to manage a sales campaign and close deals alongside license campaigns or as a standalone services campaign
  • Demonstrable ability to map out a close plan that incorporates all involved resources and contracts with a clear understanding of the customer sign off process and procedures
  • Confidence and ability to interface professionally with a wide spectrum of customers including C-level executives
  • Creative ability to run own campaigns in coordination with call efforts
  • Fluent in Japanese and business level in English language is essential

Location: France – Home or Office Based
Languages: Fluent in French and English. Spanish or Italian would be a plus. 


In line with Infor continuous growth strategy, we are looking for an experienced Services/Consulting Sales professional for the role of Senior Client Partner with focus on new customers. Senior Client Partner is responsible for sales of Infor service offering: consulting, implementation projects, development, customer training, managed services, etc. across the Southern Europe region.

As a Senior Client Partner, you will be responsible for achieving assigned services sales quotas and goals for customers located in France. You will develop business, respond to RFPs, and develop proposals for presentation to customers, ensuring services offer positioning.

A primary focus of the role will be on identifying, qualifying and managing complex deals to successful closes (including solution design, delivery capabilities, risk assessment, etc.). You will be managing client relations with key decision makers: CxO Level (CFO, CIO, COO, CEO), IT department, purchasing department, business stakeholders to sell the services to Infor customers and prospects.


A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

Prospecting

  • Identify prospective clients and new-business opportunities through lead generation, cold calling, trade-shows, and by working closely with license sales team to maximize Infor’s revenue in the assigned territory.
  • Support sales representatives on all opportunities for full sales lifecycle including coordination of RFP responses, oral presentations, contract negotiation for services elements and preparation of proposals / work orders.
