description_html:
We are seeking a Client Service Specialist to provide quality customer support to our new and existing customer base at Infor Nexus within the Global Services organization.  It is a visible position that requires a substantive level of proactive problem solving and technical skillset. For our Support Hiring strategy, we are moving the US position to Mexico hub.  Due to the complexity of our product, we need to hire a CSS with a technical profile to support more efficiently our customers.

 

A Day In The Life Typically Includes:

·       Interact with customers and manage inquiries via phone, e-mail, and our CRM support tool.

·       Respond to customer queries by utilizing product knowledge and or resource tools to research, follow-up, ensure appropriate escalation if applicable and document resolution details.

·       Assist customers with completing transactions on the Infor Nexus platform, while understanding their specific requirements

·       Communicate with partners and various departments within our organization to ensure an integrated approach to managing our customers’ relationships.

·       Administer customer training on various functions.

·       Document support procedures and solutions for common issues

·       Assist with training team members.


Basic Qualifications:

·       Customer Service and/or Operations experience supporting a software application.

·       Customer management skills.

·       Verbal and written communication both in English and Spanish.

·      Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) experience.

·       Experience working independently and in a team environment, which requires listening to group members, sharing knowledge and assuming responsibility to ensure success in any efforts.



Qualifications:

  • Experience working with supply chain management software and/or logistics management software.
  • Experience with Freight Forwarders, Logistics Service Providers and Carriers
  • Experience with International Trade, Incoterms
  • Familiarity with EDI or technical mapping.

•   Experience working in a client service, account management, or a similar client-facing role.



Location:  Hybrid - 3 days in office, 2 days working from home

description_html:
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Cloud Consultant, Associate to join our team. This role is responsible for monitoring system health, managing backups and restores, handling tickets, and coordinating with customers and vendors to ensure smooth and efficient IT operations.

A Day in the Life typically includes:

  • Perform system health checks and validate backup success (BRMS).
  • Handle restoration requests and troubleshoot related issues.
  • Monitor Wintel restarts, disk space issues, RDP access problems, and server availability.
  • Configure and manage Halcyon alerts and monitoring rules.
  • Analyze and address ERP application alerts (e.g., environment down, job failures, subsystem or login issues).
  • Investigate and resolve ASP performance spikes across AS400 servers.
  • Work closely with the hosting partner for customer-related escalations.
  • Gain full understanding and ownership of Halcyon monitoring setup and administration.
  • Maintain and create documentation, including standard operating procedures, flow charts, and templates.
  • Manage ServiceNow activities: ticket creation, bulk updates, change requests, and new customer/infra additions.
  • Develop L1 documentation for recurring operational activities.
  • Support printer and job scheduling management (BRMS, ROBOT, AJS, Native Scheduler, IBM i OS, HTTP Admin Console).

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience working with computer systems, networking, and operating systems.
  • Experience working with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • English written and verbal communication skills.
  • This role requires working some weekend shifts. 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with IBM i OS, Work Management, BRMS, ROBOT, and Halcyon tools.
  • Experience or coursework involving monitoring tools and ticketing systems (ServiceNow).
  • Experience iwth backup and disaster recovery processes.
  • Recent graduate in Computer Science or related field.

What We Offer:

  • Comprehensive training and mentorship.
  • Exposure to enterprise-level IT operations and infrastructure.
  • Collaborative and growth-oriented work environment.
Location:  Hybrid - ability to work 3 days in office

description_html:
The Service Operations Managers team comprises 70 multilingual members with ITIL expertise and professional experience located worldwide to support Infor's business across various time zones.
As part of your responsibilities, you will be managing and administering the Infor Managed Services (IMS) agreements. You will need to adhere to the company policies and procedures, Project Management guidelines (Agile/Prince), and best practices of Service Delivery, such as ITIL v4 to ensure the successful execution of the agreements. The number of customers in your portfolio will vary depending on the size and complexity of the contract, which is referred to as governance type. In some cases, you may need to travel and visit customers on-site as per the contract obligations.
As a customer service representative for Infor, you will be responsible for directly addressing customer inquiries and ensuring that any issues reported are resolved smoothly. This requires close collaboration between the various IMS stakeholders, including Operations, Resource Management, Financial Services, Technical and Functional Support. Additionally, the Service Operations Manager and Customer Experience Manager (who is also responsible for the contract) must have an excellent partnership to achieve high service standards and provide mutual benefits for both Infor and its customers.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Act as a liaison between the customer and the Project Team to ensure that all contractual matters are efficiently and promptly addressed and coordinated
  • Respond to complex inquiries using problem-solving skills to find the best business solution
  • Contract administration, review, and management to ensure compliance with terms and conditions
  • Prepare and maintain current operational document libraries, operate reporting tools, and prepare reports for customers and Infor
  • When managing any of the key ITIL processes such as Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management, etc., operate effectively and with minimal supervision as required

What You Will Need:
  • Excellent skills in English, including both oral and written proficiency
  • A thorough understanding and practical experience of corporate business practices, as well as strong analytical skills or specialized knowledge in a particular field. Additionally, a firm grasp of the fundamental principles of contract management
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills, client-oriented and self-motivated individual with a strong drive for personal development
  • Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines while ensuring the delivery of high-quality services
  • Ability to comprehend and adhere to directives from direct supervisor and interact effectively with all levels of management

What Will Put You Ahead?
  • Bonus points will be awarded to individuals who possess Project Management/ITIL Foundation v4 certification or have knowledge related to these areas
  • Having experience as a Service Operations Manager or Service Delivery Manager is considered an advantage
  • Having prior experience in Account Management and/or Consulting Management is considered desirable
  • Familiarity with Logistics, Sales, and Finance Business Processes

As part of your responsibilities, you will be managing and administering the Infor Managed Services (IMS) agreements. You will need to adhere to the company policies and procedures, Project Management guidelines (Agile/Prince), and best practices of Service Delivery, such as ITIL v4 to ensure the successful execution of the agreements. The number of customers in your portfolio will vary depending on the size and complexity of the contract, which is referred to as governance type. In some cases, you may need to travel and visit customers on-site as per the contract obligations.

This requires close collaboration between the various IMS stakeholders, including Operations, Resource Management, Financial Services, Technical and Functional Support. Additionally, the Service Operations Manager and Customer Experience Manager (who is also responsible for the contract) must have an excellent partnership to achieve high service standards and provide mutual benefits for both Infor and its customers.

  • Respond to complex inquiries using problem-solving skills to find the best business solution
  • Contract administration, review, and management to ensure compliance with terms and conditions
  • Prepare and maintain current operational document libraries, operate reporting tools, and prepare reports for customers and Infor
  • When managing any of the key ITIL processes such as Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management, etc., operate effectively and with minimal supervision as required

  • A thorough understanding and practical experience of corporate business practices, as well as strong analytical skills or specialized knowledge in a particular field. Additionally, a firm grasp of the fundamental principles of contract management

  • Familiarity with Logistics, Sales, and Finance Business Processes

description_html:
SUMMARY:   


We are seeking highly motivated and detail-oriented Cloud Architect, with 15+ years of experience developing scalable products as well as experience working on enhancements and ongoing maintenance work. Here is an opportunity to be part of developing new products for the next generation of business applications in the Cloud.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

·       Masters of Science in Computer Science or equivalent

·       15+ years of experience developing scalable products as well as experience working on enhancement and ongoing feature and maintenance work.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

·       Design, create, and monitor daily software build and deployment pipelines ensuring reliability and consistency.

·       Collaborate with developers, data scientists, and cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality software and AI-enabled solutions are delivered on time.

·       Drive continuous integration, continuous delivery, and continuous deployment (CI/CD) across cloud environments.

·       Define and set DevOps and MLOps processes for development, testing, release, and production support.

·       Enhance and extend CI/CD automation to improve deployment speed, reliability, and scalability for both traditional and AI-driven applications.

·       Lead the integration of AI and ML models into existing systems, ensuring seamless deployment, monitoring, and version control.

·       Work with data teams to operationalize machine learning models using AWS SageMaker, Bedrock, or containerized inference services.

·       Design and implement AI-powered automation for performance optimization, anomaly detection, and predictive maintenance.

·       Provide AI-driven solutions to existing business processes to improve decision-making, efficiency, and customer experience.

·       Mentor and guide other development team members on AI integration best practices within DevOps workflows.

·       Conduct technical reviews and architecture assessments, ensuring adherence to SDLC, security, and AI governance standards.

·       Ensure that unit, integration, and system tests (including AI model validation) are automated per QA requirements.

·       Design automation architecture for cloud delivery in AWS, integrating AI and data pipelines where applicable.

·       Implement cybersecurity measures and continuously perform vulnerability assessments for cloud and AI workloads.

·       Monitor and optimize system performance, model inference speed, and scalability to meet business and technical goals.

·       Continuously evaluate new AI tools, frameworks, and cloud services for innovation opportunities.

·       Stay current with emerging AI/ML technologies and DevOps trends to recommend improvements.

·       Open to taking on additional projects and responsibilities, especially those involving digital transformation and AI innovation.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

·       Proficient in Maven, Jenkins, SVN, and Git for build automation and version control.

·       Strong experience in AWS Cloud platform, including CloudFormation and serverless architecture concepts.

·       Expertise in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, AWS CDK, and CloudFormation.

·       Experience working with 4-tier architectures in cloud-based deployments.

·       Familiarity with software packaging tools (.exe, .deb, .rpm, Docker).

·       Experience with relational databases such as MS SQL and Aurora PostgreSQL.

·       Strong Linux and Windows administration skills, with hands-on system configuration and automation experience.

·       Skilled in CI/CD pipelines using GitLab and Jenkins with automated test and deployment workflows.

·       Proficiency in scripting languages (Bash, PowerShell, Python) for automation and AI integration tasks.

·       Solid understanding of Docker construction, deployment, execution, and maintenance.

·       Experience with containerization and orchestration (ECS, Fargate, Kubernetes).

·       Familiarity with AI/ML cloud services such as AWS SageMaker, Bedrock, or Lambda for model deployment and scaling.

·       Experience implementing MLOps pipelines for model training, testing, deployment, and monitoring.

·       Knowledge of data pipelines, APIs, and microservices used for AI-driven solutions.

·       Expertise in AWS CloudWatch and related monitoring services, including AI model and data pipeline observability.

·       Strong infrastructure management experience (networks, servers, operating systems, databases).

·       Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience working in agile, fast-paced, and result-oriented environments.

PREFERRED SKILLS:

·       Flexibility to assist across functions (e.g., QA, Operations, Data Science).

·       AWS DevOps Engineer Professional Certification or equivalent.

·       Experience with monitoring and logging tools (CloudWatch, Grafana, Prometheus, SumoLogic).

·       Familiarity with AI observability tools (SageMaker Model Monitor, MLflow, or Vertex AI Model Monitoring).

·       Understanding of machine learning lifecycle management (MLOps) and model retraining strategies.

·       Experience deploying AI APIs or inference services using Docker, Lambda, or ECS.

·       Knowledge of cloud cost optimization and GPU resource management for AI workloads.

·       Excellent documentation, presentation, and mentoring skills for AI and DevOps architecture.

description_html:
The Cloud System Engineer Associate is responsible for delivering Cloud Operations services, including maintaining applications and technical environments, troubleshooting issues, applying configuration changes and patches, and managing data copies. This role supports high-availability, mission-critical systems and collaborates with cross-functional teams to ensure service excellence.

A Day in the life Typically Includes:

* Operate in a 24x5x365 support environment, ensuring system uptime and reliability.
* Execute scheduled tasks and operational procedures within defined service and quality standards.
* Collaborate with internal teams to resolve incidents, fulfill service requests, and support project delivery.
* Participate in training programs and assist in onboarding and mentoring new team members.
* Manage daily operational tasks following established processes and documentation standards.
* Perform additional duties as assigned by leadership.

Basic Qualifications:
* Experience in system administration or cloud operations.
* Experience with Windows/Linux system administration.
* Experience in cloud computing platforms, particularly Amazon Web Services (AWS).
* English communication skills—verbal and written.
* Experience documenting technical changes and automation efforts.
* Experience supporting ERP systems and workflow engine applications.

Preferred Qualifications:
* Experience with Infor applications.
* AWS certification (e.g., AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner or Associate-level).
* Scripting skills in Python, PowerShell, or similar languages; familiarity with AWS SDKs.
* Knowledge of IIS/Tomcat, Active Directory, databases, and operating systems.
* Experience in a customer service or client-facing technical support role.

Why join us:
* Opportunity to work with cutting-edge cloud technologies.
* Collaborative and growth-oriented work environment.
* Continuous learning and certification support.
* Exposure to enterprise-level systems and global operations.

description_html:
As a Consultant for the Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), you'll be part of a dynamic, customer-facing team who partner with customers to deliver projects that streamline operations and deliver tangible results.

Your day-to-day will involve configuring MES, collaborating with clients, building and implementing innovative technical solutions and advocating for the success of our customers. As part of this role, you’ll sharpen both industry and technical expertise to successfully deliver major business transformation for our MES clients across the region.

 

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Work within a project delivery team on MES implementation projects, with core responsibilities including software installation, solution configuration, integration work, verification, and testing.
  • Ensure timely and accurate completion of timesheets, acting with integrity to facilitate correct billing for customers.
  • Collaborate with the Solution Architect, acting as a Principled Entrepreneur, to enhance the experience for both our internal team and customers.
  • Work effectively within a small project delivery team, collaborating successfully to ensure projects are delivered on time and in-budget.
  • Engage professionally in customer interactions, providing knowledgeable responses and building customer confidence in our expertise, demonstrating Respect.
  • Ensure smooth execution of 'Go Lives' to maintain and enhance customer relationships, a reflection of Principled Entrepreneurship.

Required Skills:

  • Educated to degree level in computing, business information systems, manufacturing engineering, manufacturing technology or a related subject.
  • Have some exposure to manufacturing environment such as experience as an IT apprentice or hands-on work within a factory setting—combined with a balanced mix of technical and functional skills.
  • Experience with configuring software, shop floor processes, and translating customer requirements into system configurations.
  • Experience coding, particularly in C#, along with a basic understanding of SQL and database concepts.
  • Ability to travel 10-20% of the time.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with the delivery of IT software projects.
  • Experience within manufacturing industries, either within IT or operations.

Job location: Dallas, TX.

description_html:
As an Implementation Consultant, you will have a wide range of responsibilities focused on providing functional solutions and Best Practices to meet the needs of our clients. You will be a part of a team of professionals that play a key role in implementing solutions and delivering results. Skilled at providing in-depth analysis, the ability to provide resolution to client requirements and fulfilling any product gaps using additional custom development/integration of required systems. Expected to mentor and guide others in all aspects of an implementation lifecycle with specific emphasis on systems analysis, functional design, and testing. 


Key Education, Skills and Experience required:  

 

  • Graduate or post-graduate with 5-8 yrs of experience in IT/Consulting/Implementation services with 3-5 years of implementation experience. 
  • Knowledge/ exposure to business processes and best practices in Human Capital or Workforce management solutions.
  • Experience in at least one end to end implementation project including requirement gathering, business analysis, designing the system, system configuration, integration, testing.
  • Experience in one or more of the following Infor WFM modules:  Timekeeping, attendance management, multi-view scheduler, labor forecasting and schedule optimization, budgeting and mobility 
  • Ability to configure timekeeping module with complex pay rules and policies, attendance management configuration, Payroll process, in and out knowledge in basic scheduling is required 
  • Experience in implementing labor forecasting and schedule optimization module with related interfaces is required. Ability to implement complex long term scheduling requirements and Staff / budget management is required. Experience in Multi-view scheduler is required.
  • Knowledge in implementation of mobility, ETM or other mobile features is required. 
  • Infor WFM certification is and is an advantage 
  • Experience in creating Infor WFM design solution blueprint, functional specification documents and test scripts is required. Implementation process knowledge using agile methodology is an add on. 
  • Skilled in analyzing and documenting business requirements and corresponding solution specifications. 
  • Good Understanding of, and experience with, application architectures (client/server, web, database), onprem and cloud deployment platforms, relational data modeling / object-oriented design, usability concepts, integrations and reporting aspects of software. Experience writing database queries in SQL and working on databases. 
  • Excellent interpersonal, collaboration, analytical and problem-solving skills  
  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written) and Presentation skills 
  • Able to work with minimal direction and supervision.  
  • Ability to work in teams and interact across all levels 
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and work pressure

description_html:
Role Summary

As an MES Consultant, you'll be part of a dynamic, customer-facing team who partner with customers to deliver projects that streamline operations and deliver tangible results.

Your day-to-day will involve configuring MES, collaborating with clients, building and implementing innovative technical solutions and advocating for the success of our customers. As part of this role, you’ll sharpen both industry and technical expertise to successfully deliver major business transformation for our MES clients across the region.

 

A typical day in the life involves working within a project delivery team on MES implementation projects, with core responsibilities including:

  • Software installation
  • Solution configuration
  • Integration work
  • Verification and testing

 

Qualifications

Core qualifications:

  • Educated to degree level in computing, business information systems, manufacturing engineering, manufacturing technology or a related subject
  • Experience with programming in C# and SQL languages
  • Ability to freely travel abroad
  • Fluent in English
  • Flexibility in working hours as needed

 

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with the delivery of IT software projects
  • Experience within manufacturing industries, either within IT or operations
  • Additional spoken languages - French German or Spanish

 

Responsibilities

Project Task Implementation

  • Perform tasks in the context of MES implementation projects, such as software installation, solution configuration and integration work, solution verification and testing, deployment of solution packages to customer environments.
  • Maintain and regularly update a task list, embodying Infor's core values, to provide transparency on project status and priorities for both the customer and our internal team.
  • Ensure timely and accurate completion of timesheets, acting with integrity to facilitate correct billing for customers.

 

Process Improvement

  • Collaborate with the Solution Architect, acting as a Principled Entrepreneur, to enhance the experience for both our internal team and customers.

 

Team Engagement

  • Work effectively within a small project delivery team, collaborating successfully to ensure projects are delivered on-time and in-budget.
  • Provide support to other team members as needed.
  • Utilise other team members to gain knowledge to help perform assigned tasks.

 

Customer Engagement

  • Engage professionally in customer interactions, providing knowledgeable responses and building customer confidence in our expertise, demonstrating Respect.
  • Ensure smooth execution of 'Go Lives' to maintain and enhance customer relationships, a reflection of Principled Entrepreneurship™.

description_html:
Associate Consultant (The Early Talent Program)

Would you like to work on implementing future digital solutions?

As an Associate Consultant, you will gain knowledge about our Cloud solutions, implementation methodology, consulting skills, and industry business practices. Throughout the program, you will learn how to create and implement digital solutions to address our customers' needs. This is a full-time position, starting within the Early Talent Program. No prior technical background or ERP experience is required.


Your daily tasks as an Associate Consultant will include:

  • Implementing ERP solutions
  • Analyzing business processes
  • Interacting with customers
  • Designing business solutions
  • Preparing and participating in workshops for our customers
  • Learning new business implementation methods
  • Supporting customer training
  • Assisting in go-lives

 

ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) refers to the integrated management of core business processes, often in real-time and facilitated by software and technology. ERP is typically a suite of integrated applications that organizations use to collect, store, manage, and interpret data across various business activities.

 

About The Early Talent Program

The program lasts 12 months and includes both academy training and hands-on project work to accelerate your consulting career. Early in the program, you will help customers leverage our world-class Cloud solutions in industries such as Distribution, Food & Beverage, Automotive, and Manufacturing. This experience will provide a solid foundation in managing innovative local and global Infor projects from both IT and business perspectives.

 

The Early Talent Program includes:

  • Project work
  • Product training
  • Mentorship
  • Soft skills training
  • Customer consulting
  • Business travel


This program is set in an international environment, where you will interact with instructors and other Early Talents from across EMEA. In addition to training in business processes, applications, and industry solutions, you will also receive an introduction to Infor, our values, and our ways of working.

All elements of the program are designed to help you learn, innovate, improve, and transform into a skilled consultant.

 

You're a great fit if you:

  • Have a genuine interest in business processes and IT
  • Are willing to travel and hold a valid driver’s license
  • Have a "can-do" attitude
  • Are eager to grow and learn
  • Enjoy interacting with people
  • Have knowledge in the industry of Food and Beverages

description_html:
Standort: Deutschland – im Homeoffice oder einem unserer Büros

 

Das erwartet Dich im Early Talent Program:

 

Wir bilden Dich zur Spezialistin oder Spezialisten für die Implementierung einer Infor Softwarelösung aus! In den ersten 6 Monaten erlernst du an unserer internationalen Akademie im Austausch mit Kolleginnen und Kollegen aus ganz Europa die Grundlagen des Consultings, die Projektmethodik und unsere Softwarelösungen Infor LN oder Infor M3 kennen. Darüber hinaus bekommst du die Chance in erste Projekte einzutauchen und dich mit der Unterstützung deines persönlichen Mentors zu beweisen.

Nach absolvierter Zertifizierung zum Associate Consultant wirst du im zweiten Halbjahr vertieft an Projekten arbeiten, wertvolle Erfahrungen sammeln und weitere Schulungen erhalten. Nach einem Jahr bist du optimal vorbereitet, um vollumfänglich als Associate Consultant unsere Kunden bei der Implementierung unserer Softwarelösungen zu unterstützen.

 

Was Du mitbringen solltest:

  • Einen Hochschulabschluss oder Berufserfahrung im technischen oder betriebswirtschaftlichen Bereich.
  • Interesse für IT- und Geschäftsprozesse (Supply Chain Management, Produktion, Finanzen).
  • Erste praktische Berufserfahrung (Vollzeit, Werkstudentische Arbeit, Praktika).
  • Flexibilität und Reisebereitschaft.
  • Fähigkeit selbstständig und im Team zu arbeiten.
  • Hervorragende schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch.
  • Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse in den gängigen Microsoft Office Programmen.
 

Warum du deine Karriere bei Infor starten solltest:

Als global agierendes Unternehmen und einer der führenden Anbieter von Cloud-ERP Softwarelösungen ist Infor mit über 17.000 Mitarbeitern ein strategischer Technologiepartner für mehr als 60.000 Kunden weltweit. Wir bieten komplette CloudSuites für spezifische Branchen an, um für unsere Kunden einen maximalen Mehrwert durch die Bereitstellung einer gesamtheitlichen Lösung zu liefern. Außerdem hast Du dadurch die Möglichkeit, in deinem Interessensfeld, Automotive (LN), Industrial Manufacturing (LN), Distribution (M3) oder Food & Beverage (M3) zu arbeiten.

 

Bei Infor legen wir sehr großen Wert auf die Work-Life Balance der Mitarbeiter, weshalb wir einen „Work from anywhere“-Ansatz innerhalb Deutschlands verfolgen, was in Kombination mit einem Vertrauensarbeitszeitmodell große Freiheiten ermöglicht.

description_html:
The Associate Consultant is responsible for supporting the implementation, configuration, and training of Infor’s Smart Series POS (Point of Sale) solutions for clients. This role plays a key part in ensuring successful system rollouts by collaborating with internal teams and clients to deliver services on time and within scope. The Associate Consultant will provide both remote and onsite support as needed, assist with project documentation, and contribute to maintaining high client satisfaction during and after deployment.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Coordinate and lead implementation meetings for POS software installations, both remotely and onsite, ensuring all stakeholders are aligned and prepared.
  • Provide end-user training and onboarding for software products, adapting delivery to meet audience needs and leveraging adult learning principles.
  • Troubleshoot software issues via phone or in person, resolving problems within scope or escalating appropriately to internal support teams.
  • Coordinate or assist with the deployment of new software applications and version upgrades, ensuring minimal disruption to client operations.
  • Participate in training needs assessments and contribute to the development of standardized training processes and materials.
  • Create and maintain clear documentation for both custom and packaged applications to support ongoing knowledge transfer and operational consistency.
  • Deliver training sessions to diverse client groups, tailoring content and delivery to ensure engagement and retention.
  • Travel approximately 75–80% across the U.S. to support client installations, training, and go-live activities.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Experience with POS systems, particularly in the hospitality or quick-service restaurant (QSR) industry.
  • Experience comprehending technically complex system configurations and communicating technical specifications to non-technical individuals.
  • Ability to travel up to 75–80% across the U.S.
  • Experience in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience troubleshooting and resolving software issues, both remotely and onsite.
  • Experience supporting software rollouts, field installations, or go-live support.
  • Familiarity with basic networking concepts (e.g., IP addressing, routers, connectivity troubleshooting).
  • Experience conducting remote or onsite end-user training sessions.
  • Experience reading and interpreting technical documentation such as site surveys, network diagrams, or system architecture.
  • Bilingual or multilingual proficiency is a plus (e.g., Spanish).

We anticipate paying between $51,500 - $86,000 per year. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. In addition, Infor provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).

Basic Qualifications:

•Minimum 12 years of experience in enterprise software solutions, preferably with Infor products

•Experience in intelligent automation, Agentic AI, RPA, and AI/ML will be an advantage

•Industry experience in at least one of the following industries: Healthcare, Distribution, Industrial Manufacturing and/or Food and Beverage.

•Deep understanding of ERP / enterprise applications, business processes and automation.

•Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

•Proven track record of successfully leading and delivering large-scale complex projects.

•Ability to engage with customers and understand their requirements

•Ability to work collaboratively across teams and manage multiple priorities.

•Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field

Essential Duties

•Understand customer requirements and provide technical expertise during the sales process.

•Conduct workshops and discovery sessions to support the innovation adoption / digital transformation agenda by successfully identifying use cases

•Develop and present solution proposals, including architecture diagrams, implementation plans, and cost estimates.

•Participate in customer meetings and presentations to articulate the value and benefits of proposed solutions.

•Lead the design and architecture of comprehensive solutions that meet customer needs and align with industry best practices.

description_html:
Senior Consultant
Join our Strategy Consulting Team as a Senior Consultant, partnering with international clients across the UK, Europe, and Asia to deliver lasting change through smart revenue management. You’ll leverage your consulting and consumer goods experience to provide thought leadership and solve complex strategic issues. This role is pivotal in driving client success through pricing and promotion strategy, analytics, and change management.
You’ll be part of a dynamic team, working in a fast-paced environment with opportunities for travel and professional growth. Your work will directly contribute to our clients’ business transformation and Infor’s mission to deliver industry-leading solutions.

  • Familiarity with FMCG market dynamics.

  • Creative problem-solving skills and a “can do” attitude.

description_html:
As a Data Consultant, you will build solutions for data migration and mastering, which involve analyzing, cleaning, transforming, and loading data to ensure it is accurately migrated and mastered for Infor CloudSuites using the optimum solutions available within the Infor Datamesh platform, along with additional Infor products and tools.

You will be responsible for developing data migration strategies, building comprehensive data pipelines, and defining data mapping logics, solutions, and strategies from source to target based on business requirements. Additionally, you will provide end-to-end access, storage, and data transfer strategies throughout the migration process. This role requires collaboration with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality data solutions that meet business needs.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

·       Build and develop data migration and mastering solutions using the Infor Datamesh platform to meet business requirements.

·       Create source-to-target mappings to facilitate seamless data migration.

·       Analyze source data, and clean, transform, and master data from multiple sources in alignment with business requirements.

·       Build and monitor data pipelines, ensuring data quality and accuracy.

·       Collaborate with cross-departmental teams to improve data migration and mastering processes.

·       Develop and implement data validation and cleansing processes to ensure data integrity.

·       Optimize data migration workflows to enhance efficiency and reduce downtime.

·       Document data migration processes and solutions.

·       Provide support to stakeholders on data migration processes. List essential duties  

 

Basic Qualifications: 

·       6+ years of experience in data migration and mastering.

·       Expertise in SQL, with knowledge of multiple data storage systems, DBMS, cloud storage solutions.

·       Experience with data analysis tools and large datasets.

·       Strong ability to analyze data and provide insights for business improvements.

·       Familiarity with Agile methodologies.

·       Proficient in developing data migration and mastering solutions.

·       Strong understanding of data migration, mastering, governance principles and best practices.

·       Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

·       Effective communication skills to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:

·       Knowledge of data migration and mastering processes within enterprise environments.

·       Familiarity with Infor ERP CloudSuites.

·       Proficiency in Python Scripting.

description_html:
The Senior ERP Consultant is responsible for leading and executing ERP implementation projects, with a focus on system design, configuration, and deployment. This role works closely with clients to understand their business needs, gather requirements, and deliver ERP solutions that align with organizational objectives. The consultant collaborates with both client and internal teams to ensure successful project outcomes, mentors junior consultants, and ensures all deliverables are completed on time and within scope.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes

  • Conduct business process walkthroughs to identify all client process and data requirements for project scope definition.
  • Advise clients on manufacturing planning, scheduling, production, quality, and traceability processes within the food and beverage industry.
  • Design solutions that align client business needs with standard M3 Food and Beverage CloudSuite application capabilities and our Process Catalogue.
  • Analyse complex situations or data involving multiple variable factors to resolve issues.
  • Configure and customize M3 modules such as production planning, quality control, batch management, catch weight, and lot traceability.
  • Provide expert guidance on regulatory compliance and industry-specific standards.
  • Act as a subject matter expert and mentor to support Project Managers, technical resources, and project team members.
  • Participate in pre-sales activities, including solution demonstrations and proposal development.
  • Attend product functionality briefings and training sessions.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and M3 product enhancements to advise clients on future improvements.
  • Willingness to travel as required by client engagements. 

Basic Qualifications 

  • Extensive customer-facing ERP consulting experience.
  • Broad knowledge of business process changes, with proven experience in Food & Beverage production and planning.
  • Strong background of project / implementation experience with Infor CloudSuite ERP or similar ERP software.
  • Experience in one or more industry segments: Food & Beverage, Distribution, or Manufacturing.
  • Knowledge of industry compliance requirements (e.g., traceability, lot management, shelf life).
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.



Preferred Qualifications 

  • Experience with ERP integration tools and platforms (e.g., cloud-based ERP suites, middleware, EDI).
  • Familiarity with Cloud Infrastructure or SaaS applications.
  • Knowledge of change management practices during ERP implementations.
  • Understanding of project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall).
  • Relevant ERP certifications or related credentials.
  • Experience of implementing Infor’s CloudSuite, but also other ERP systems are meritorious e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft, Jeeves, IFS, Visma or similar systems.

description_html:
This role will help identify existing business processes that need to be addressed through the Infor WMS implementation cycle. The functional consultant will use the information provided by the client along with their own industry knowledge and specialization to judge the best solution for the client.
The consultant is responsible for providing a consultative approach to the successful and timely implementation of WMS software solutions for Infor’s customers. The primary responsibility of the consultant, in this case, is to ensure that the integration/implementation process runs smoothly from start to finish. The consultant's goal is to ensure that all identified factors are considered during implementation. The consultant will also have to identify the possible gaps in the processes and the risks inherent in the implementation of the system.

A Day In The Life Typically Includes: 
  • Implementation of software in line with best practices. Collaborating with the customer in a prescriptive manner to produce the required solution and achieve the desired outcomes. Applying functional / product knowledge in combination with industry expertise to deliver exceptional outcomes for our customers.
  • Responsible for the WMS project lifecycle. Responsibilities include but are not limited to configuring, developing, maintaining and supporting the WMS systems. The WMS Specialist will provide general maintenance and system updates on WMS software. Analyze problems to ensure their availability to users.
  • Have a sense of urgency, a passion for customer success, a thirst for innovation, a focus on results and a sense of community.
  • Perform consultancy and configuration of all core "add-on" Infor products onsite and remotely. Exhibiting proficiency with software and software configuration.
  • Provide analysis and recommendations to clients on project phases, milestones, and overall progress.
  • Works independently on large and/or complex functional/technical projects.
  • Assists Sales Team with response to RFPs.
  • Development of standard demonstrations and supporting materials on various global demonstration environments.
  • Understand customer’s needs & demonstrate the real impact of the project in terms of achieving customer benefit / outcomes.


Basic Qualifications: 
  • Experience implementing WMS and/or ERP solutions with customers. 
  • Experience working in international environments and with global customers.
  • Full proficiency in English.
  • WMS and Logistic high expertise with experience interacting with senior level clients/management, including presentation of complex concepts, negotiating and resolving issues.
  • Integrations design experience, functional and technical interfaces documentation, API SOAP and REST.
  • Experience analyzing potential improvements in the WMS implementation process and bring/create more efficient activities/solutions.  
  • Availability to travel.

Preferred Qualifications: 
  • Infor WMS Solution experience.
  • Portuguese language skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree in logistics or IT or Industrial Engineer.

description_html:
Sluit je aan bij ons dynamische en groeiende consultingteam als Infor LN Finance Consultant (Senior). In deze rol leid je implementaties van begin tot eind, help je klanten hun financiële processen te optimaliseren en speel je een belangrijke rol in het stimuleren van digitale transformatie. Je werkt samen met multidisciplinaire teams, begeleidt klanten door complexe bedrijfsprocessen en coacht junior consultants – en levert tegelijkertijd hoogwaardige oplossingen die impact hebben.

 

Een typische werkdag omvat:

  • Het leiden van end-to-end financiële implementaties van Infor LN voor klantprojecten op locatie in Nederland.
  • Het geven van gedetailleerde workshops over bedrijfsprocessen.
  • Het ontwerpen, configureren en valideren van de bedrijfsstructuur (bedrijven, financiële instellingen, magazijnen, locaties en relaties) ter ondersteuning van financiële integratie en rapportage.
  • Het configureren en optimaliseren van belangrijke financiële modules, waaronder:
Grootboek (GL)
Crediteurenadministratie (AP)
Debiteurenadministratie (AR)
Vaste activa (FA)
Cash management (CM)
  • Kostenboekhouding en financiële reconciliatie
  • Het correct configureren van landspecifieke lokalisaties (bijv. btw, Intrastat, elektronische facturering, wettelijke rapportage, belastingen en export van auditbestanden). 
  • Het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van functionele ontwerpdocumenten, configuratiewerkboeken en testscenario's. 
  • Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams om een naadloze integratie tussen de modules Financiën, Inkoop, Projecten en Productie te garanderen. Het leiden van systeemtesten, UAT en training van eindgebruikers om de acceptatie en naleving van de oplossing te waarborgen. 
  • Het ondersteunen van datamigratie, de overgang naar een nieuwe omgeving en de livegang om een soepele overgang en accurate financiële rapportage te garanderen. 
  • Het bieden van ondersteuning na de implementatie, waarbij lokalisatie- en compliancegerelateerde problemen worden aangepakt. 
  • Het begeleiden van junior consultants en het bijdragen aan interne kennisdeling binnen de Professional Services-organisatie. • Bereid zijn om indien nodig te reizen naar klantlocaties in Nederland en andere regio's.
 

Basisvereisten:

  • 8-10 jaar ervaring in ERP Finance-consultancy, met minimaal 5 volledige Infor LN-implementaties.
  • Sterke expertise in Infor LN Financials en de opzet van de bedrijfsstructuur (meerdere bedrijven, meerdere locaties, financiële bedrijfsmapping en intercompany-relaties).
  • Praktische ervaring met landspecifieke lokalisatie, inclusief belasting, wettelijke rapportage, Intrastat en btw-configuratie voor Nederland en andere Europese regio's
  • Grondige kennis van boekhoudnormen en financiële
  • Ervaring met meerdere valuta, intercompany-boekhouding en consolidatiestructuren.
  • Bekendheid met integratiepunten tussen LN-modules (Inkoop, Projecten, Productie)
  • Ervaring met Infor ION, IDM en Birst is een pré. • Uitstekende communicatieve, analytische en klantgerichte vaardi gheren.
  • Vermogen om op locatie bij klanten te werken en effectief met meerdere stakeholders om te gaan.
  • Bereidheid om te reizen voor projecten in verschillende regio's.
  • Vloeiende beheersing van het Nederlands en Engels is vereist. Kennis van andere talen is een pluspunt.
 

Gewenste kwalificaties:

Sterke kennis van Infor LN op financieel gebied.



Join our dynamic and growing consulting team as an Infor LN Finance Consultant (Senior). In this role, you’ll lead full-cycle implementations, help clients optimize their financial operations, and play a key part in driving digital transformation. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams, guide clients through complex business processes, and mentor junior consultants — all while delivering high-quality solutions that make an impact.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Leading end-to-end Finance implementations of Infor LN for onsite customer engagements in the Netherlands.

  • Conducting detailed business process workshops.

  • Designing, configuring, and validating Enterprise Structure setup (Companies, Financial Companies, Warehouses, Sites, and Relationships) to support financial integration and reporting.

  • Configuring and optimizing key Financial Modules, including:

    • General Ledger (GL)

    • Accounts Payable (AP)

    • Accounts Receivable (AR)

    • Fixed Assets (FA)

    • Cash Management (CM)

    • Cost Accounting and Financial Reconciliation

  • Ensuring proper configuration of country-specific localizations (e.g., VAT, Intrastat, Electronic Invoicing, Statutory Reporting, Taxation, and Audit File exports).

  • Developing and maintaining functional design documents, configuration workbooks, and test scenarios.

  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration across Finance, Procurement, Projects, and Manufacturing modules.

  • Leading system testing, UAT, and end-user training to ensure solution adoption and compliance.

  • Supporting data migration, cutover, and go-live phases to ensure smooth transitions and accurate financial reporting.

  • Providing post-implementation support, addressing localization and compliance-related issues.

  • Mentoring junior consultants and contributing to internal knowledge sharing within the Professional Services organization.

  • Being open and willing to travel across customer sites within the Netherlands and other regions when required.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 8–10 years of ERP Finance consulting experience, with at least 5 full-cycle Infor LN implementations.

  • Strong expertise in Infor LN Financials and Enterprise Structure setup (multi-company, multi-site, financial company mapping, and intercompany relationships).

  • Hands-on experience with country-specific localization, including taxation, statutory reporting, Intrastat, and VAT configuration for the Netherlands and other European regions.

  • In-depth understanding of accounting standards and financial process flows.

  • Experience with multi-currency, intercompany accounting, and consolidation structures.

  • Familiarity with integration points across LN modules (Procurement, Projects, Manufacturing).

The Senior ERP Consultant is responsible for overseeing and executing key aspects of ERP implementation projects, focusing on the design, configuration, and deployment of ERP systems. This role works directly with clients to understand their business needs, gather requirements, and configure ERP solutions that align with their objectives. The Senior Consultant collaborates with both client and internal teams to ensure successful project execution while mentoring junior consultants and ensuring project deliverables are met within scope and timeline.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Lead ERP implementation projects, ensuring they stay on schedule and within budget
  • Gather and analyze business requirements, translating them into functional specifications and configuring ERP solutions to meet client needs
  • Conduct system testing, including developing and executing test plans for ERP systems
  • Provide expertise on best practices and industry standards during implementation
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align project goals with client expectations
  • Mentor junior consultants, guiding them on project tasks and supporting their development
  • Maintain client relationships by providing expert advice and support throughout the implementation lifecycle

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in ERP system configuration, integration, and testing
  • Experience leading ERP implementation projects and managing client relationships
  • Experience working with business processes in ERP modules such as finance, supply chain, HR, and manufacturing
  • Experience gathering business requirements, designing solutions, and managing project deliverables
  • Experience supporting multiple projects concurrently

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with ERP integration tools and platforms (e.g., cloud-based ERP suites, middleware, or EDI platforms)
  • Experience with Cloud Infrastructure or Cloud Applications (SaaS)
  • Experience in change management during ERP implementations
  • Experience with project management methodologies such as Agile or Waterfall
  • Certification in ERP solutions or related fields

Infor is seeking a Warehouse Management System (WMS) Functional Consultant to join the consulting practice and support project implementations of Infor’s Supply Chain Execution (SCE) Warehouse Management Solution (WMS). This position reports to the Senior Director of the Consulting Practice and contributes to delivering configured warehouse management solutions for customer operations.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:
  • Serve as a functional consultant on assigned WMS implementation projects.
  • Provide application and business process expertise in warehouse operations.
  • Analyze customer business requirements and objectives; design and document business processes that align with Infor’s WMS capabilities.
  • Configure and model “to-be” processes within the Infor WMS application.
  • Apply Infor’s implementation methodology and utilize available tools to support efficient solution deployment.
  • Prepare weekly project status reports for Infor and customer project management.
  • Collaborate with Infor project managers and cross-functional team members to meet project deliverables.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Software implementation experience with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) or warehouse applications.
  • Knowledge of warehouse operations including receiving, putaway, order selection, replenishment, inventory control, and shipping.
  • Experience in process analysis, design, and documentation.
  • Experience with operational report design and definition.
  • Experience in translating business needs into system configurations or process improvements within an ERP environment.
  • Willingness to travel throughout North America (US and Canada) 50% or more.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience with Infor WMS (WM 4000, WM9, or SCE).
  • Warehouse management experience in 3rd-party logistics, manufacturing, consumer packaged goods (CPG), or retail environments.

Remote (Dallas, TX or Alpharetta, GA)

The Corporate Operations Director will work closely with the SaaS Adoption Experience Leader to coordinate and manage the overall SaaS Adoption Program, driving clarity, alignment, and execution excellence across teams. This role is ideal for someone with strong program management skills and a collaborative mindset. This person bridges the gap between high-level vision and operational execution, ensuring program objectives are translated into actionable plans, and those plans are executed. Deep expertise within SaaS environments and customer engagement and / or product management practices is essential. Success in this role requires comfort navigating ambiguity and a fast pace of change, maintaining focus, structure, and composure while adapting to evolving business needs.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Drive clarity on vision, priorities, and outcomes ensuring alignment to SaaS adoption goals.
  • Support the SaaS Adoption Experience Leader in planning, organizing, and tracking program activities across multiple workstreams, including product intelligence, scaled adoption, value measurement, etc.
  • Develop and maintain program documentation, including project plans, roadmaps, and deliverables to ensure successful execution of adoption program.
  • Design, orchestrate, and facilitate cross-functional collaboration and communication among teams such as Product, Customer Success, Enablement, and Analytics.
  • Coordinate program teams and build collaborative relationships with key stakeholders, including execuImplement and monitor program controls to ensure reliability, scalability, and quality of SaaS adoption initiatives.
  • Support knowledge sharing and team coordination to strengthen execution discipline and collaboration across teams, and especially to ensure alignment, dependencies, and risks across other corporate priorities.
 

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in program & project management, program governance focused on SaaS customer engagement and solution adoption.
  • Experience communicating, presenting, and influencing; able to engage and align stakeholders, including senior leaders, without direct supervisory authority.
  • Experience developing and interpreting enterprise SaaS business models, customer value drivers, and how cross-functional teams collaborate to deliver business outcomes
  • Experience in project management and change management methodologies and tools (ClickUp, Microsoft Suite, etc.).
  • Experience coordinating cross-functional teams and managing stakeholder relationships.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.
  • Travel <25%

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience supporting customer-facing programs or initiatives.
  • Experience working with customer success methodologies and user adoption strategies.
  • Experience with digital automation, analytics, or enterprise software environments.
  • Experience with product management, SaaS operations, or technical program management.
  • Familiarity with Infor’s operating model.
Location:  Atlanta, GA or Dallas, TX (Hybrid - in office 3 days/week)

description_html:
The Customer Support Operations Manager will lead their assigned team of support analysts and drive operational excellence in delivering customer support. This role ensures the team is equipped with the technical and product knowledge needed to effectively resolve customer issues, particularly for clients using ERP systems, cloud solutions, and public sector supply chain platforms. The manager will collaborate cross-functionally to remove blockers, improve processes, and contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and customer-centric service. In addition to team performance and development, this role requires alignment with compliance standards for supporting US Government Cloud customers, and therefore requires US residency or green card status. The ideal candidate is operationally focused, results-driven, and motivated to build high-performing teams that improve the customer experience.


A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Set clear goals and expectations for a support team, conduct regular 1:1s, and provide coaching based on team KPIs and performance outcomes
  • Coordinate training, enablement, and knowledge sharing to ensure technical and product readiness across ERP, Cloud, and public sector domains
  • Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Cloud Operations to remove obstacles, manage escalations, and resolve systemic issues impacting customer success
  • Analyze team and customer support metrics to identify trends, inefficiencies, and opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Maintain and improve SOPs, escalation workflows, and documentation to support consistent and scalable support delivery
  • Review customer feedback, case data, and escalation themes to improve service quality, customer satisfaction, and retention
  • Create and deliver reports, insights, and recommendations to leadership on support performance, customer trends, and process enhancement initiatives


Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience managing customer support or support operations teams
  • Experience using customer support tools and systems
  • Experience working with technical products, such as ERP or cloud-based platforms
  • Experience analyzing data to assess performance or identify process improvement opportunities
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams, including product and engineering
  • US citizen, resident or green card holder required for Government Cloud support

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience aligning support operations with business or customer success goals
  • Experience applying project management frameworks or methodologies
  • Experience using analytics or reporting tools to inform decisions
  • Experience supporting cloud-based systems or ERP platforms
  • Knowledge of public sector or healthcare supply chain operations
  • Experience working in a global organization
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience

Infor is hiring a Data Engineer to join our Cloud Operations Machine Learning (COML) team. This position will play a pivotal role in deploying models and analyses into production on AWS, building and maintaining ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipelines, and optimizing SQL queries for performance. The Data Engineer will lead projects and initiatives, write and debug analytical code, translate business problems into mathematical models, monitor and maintain production systems, and ensure the analytical integrity of deployed solutions. Infor’s customers rely on our cloud infrastructure for critical business operations—from payroll processing to customer communications. Any disruption can significantly impact their business. The COML team leverages vast operational data to develop and deploy AI/ML solutions that improve system performance, uptime, and ultimately, customer satisfaction and retention.

 

A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

  • Build and deploy scalable data pipelines and ML models in AWS.
  • Review and debug analytical code to ensure production stability.
  • Optimize SQL queries for performance across large datasets.
  • Maintain and monitor deployed models and ETL workflows.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business needs into data solutions.
  • Align with team goals and track progress on initiatives.
  • Coordinate cross-functionally to meet project timelines.
  • Define data requirements and design efficient queries.
  • Support data needs of scientists and business partners. 

Basic Qualifications:

As a Data Consultant, you will build solutions for data migration and mastering, which involve analyzing, cleaning, transforming, and loading data to ensure it is accurately migrated and mastered for Infor CloudSuites using the optimum solutions available within the Infor Datamesh platform, along with additional Infor products and tools. You will be responsible for developing data migration strategies, building comprehensive data pipelines, and defining data mapping logics, solutions, and strategies from source to target based on business requirements. Additionally, you will provide end-to-end access, storage, and data transfer strategies throughout the migration process. This role requires collaboration with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality data solutions that meet business needs. 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Build and develop data migration and mastering solutions using the Infor Datamesh platform to meet business requirements. 
  • Create source-to-target mappings to facilitate seamless data migration. 
  • Analyze source data, and clean, transform, and master data from multiple sources in alignment with business requirements. 
  • Build and monitor data pipelines, ensuring data quality and accuracy. 
  • Collaborate with cross-departmental teams to improve data migration and mastering processes. 
  • Develop and implement data validation and cleansing processes to ensure data integrity. 
  • Optimize data migration workflows to enhance efficiency and reduce downtime. 
  • Document data migration processes and solutions. 
  • Provide support to stakeholders on data migration processes. 

Qualifications: 

  • 4-5 years of experience in data migration and mastering. 
  • Expertise in SQL, with knowledge of multiple data storage systems, DBMS, and cloud storage solutions. 
  • Experience with data analysis tools and large datasets. 
  • Strong ability to analyze data and provide insights for business improvements. 
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies. 
  • Proficient in developing data migration and mastering solutions. 
  • Strong understanding of data migration, mastering, governance principles, and best practices. 
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. 
  • Effective communication skills to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders. 

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Knowledge of data migration and mastering processes within enterprise environments. 
  • Familiarity with Infor ERP CloudSuites. 
  • Proficiency in Python scripting.

description_html:
The Infor Decision Analytics and Science (IDEAS) team is responsible for setting the AI/ML strategy at Infor. Our industry-specific Augmented Intelligence (AI) solutions suite in Asset, Forecast, Inventory, Customer, Pricing, Sales, Data and Operational Intelligence domains provides rapid and measurable value to enterprise customers. In pursuit of advancing our AI solutions, IDEAS is currently seeking a Development Intern – Machine Learning (ML) / Optimization. This internship will center on advancing IDEAS’ Pricing and Customer Intelligence solutions.  

 

A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

  • Explore a new frontier in employing ML and Optimization techniques to improve the quality of our existing Pricing and Customer Intelligence solutions.  

  • Assess how these emerging methods perform relative to our existing solutions using benchmark datasets. 

  • Prototype integration into our current architecture and determine how they could enhance Infor’s AI-driven capabilities across multiple business domains.  

  • Evaluate whether we can incorporate these new methods into our production pipeline.  

  • Maintain development artifacts and technical documentation in GitLab. 

 

Basic Qualifications: 

  • Final year candidates in the Master's / Engineering program in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or a related quantitative discipline from an accredited university. 

  • Software development experience in Python and familiarity with scientific libraries commonly used in statistical analysis and machine learning e.g., pytorch, transformers library, and scikit-learn. Familiarity and basic understanding of PySpark, SQL or other data processing frameworks. 

  • Familiarity with software development environments such as Visual Studio Code, and version control using Git and CI/CD pipelines. 

  • Knowledge of data models, graphs, and relational databases. Proficiency in handling large datasets and data analysis with Tableau, Power BI, or similar BI tools.  

 

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Experience or strong interest in modern ML architectures, including transformers, diffusion models, or foundation models. 

  • Familiarity with task management with JIRA.

We are seeking a skilled professional with a strong background in DevOps, data engineering, and database administration to join our collaborative team. The role focuses on automation, performance tuning, and supporting large-scale, high-availability systems. You will contribute to our transition to AWS Aurora and work closely with experts in Oracle, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server. This position is ideal for candidates who thrive in dynamic environments and are eager to learn and grow.


A Day in The Life Typically Includes
  • Supporting databases: index maintenance, performance tuning, backup/recovery, and script execution
  • Automating database and product integration processes
  • Migrating databases from SQL Server/Oracle to Aurora PostgreSQL
  • Collaborating on automation and data engineering initiatives
  • Troubleshooting and resolving database issues
  • Executing scripts for maintenance and integration
  • Engaging in cross-team communication and knowledge transfer


What You Will Need: Basic Qualifications
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in database administration, DevOps, or data engineering roles
  • Hands-on experience with automation (Python, PowerShell, or shell scripting)
  • Solid skills in SQL Server and/or Aurora PostgreSQL administration
  • Proven ability in performance tuning, troubleshooting, backup/recovery, and script execution
  • Strong communication skills for cross-team collaboration
  • Work setup: Hybrid 3x onsite


What Will Put You Ahead: Preferred Qualifications
  • AWS cloud experience (certification preferred; hands-on experience highly valued)
  • Familiarity with monitoring tools such as CloudWatch, Sumo Logic, or Grafana
  • Experience supporting large-scale, multi-tenant applications and high-availability systems
  • Bonus points for adaptability and willingness to learn in a fast-paced environment

Infor is seeking a highly motivated, results-oriented professional to join the Infor Deal Desk. The Deal Desk team is a dynamic organization, chartered with providing mission-critical support to field sales in all aspects of the sales process.

The Deal Desk Analyst will serve as a trusted advisor to field sales, legal, business approvers, and revenue operations teams on pricing, product configuration, and business terms to support the sales effort. The Deal Desk Analyst will report to the Deal Desk Manager and will be a sales advocate and partner to internal organizations.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Performing Deal Desk functions including, but not limited to contract research, validation of price quotes, business approvals, contract drafting, and order structuring request for varying levels of deal size and complexity.
  • Collaborate and build proactive, positive relationships with peers, managers, sales operations, shared services, and account teams to ensure consistency within processes, determine best practices, and work efficiently.
  • Work closely with the field sales team to gather deal information, assess deal requirements, and structure non-standard deals that comply with published policies.
  • Identify and drive implementation of pricing and contracting tools and process improvements to support efficient and sustainable growth.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience working with Sales teams and multiple internal stakeholders across management levels.
  • Experience gathering data from various sources and producing analyses and business summaries.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in Deal Desk, Contract Management, or a similar role preferably within a technology company.
  • Experience working with pricing and contracting tools such as CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) and CLM (Customer Lifecycle Management.)

Job Location: (Atlanta, GA - Hybrid - 3 days in office, 2 days remote)

description_html:
As the Delivery Executive at Infor, you will be responsible for the end to end success of large, global, highly complex projects, including co-development projects involving on-premise, hybrid and cloud delivery models.  The Delivery Executive owns the project relationship and is the liaison between the company and client in order to ensure that all targets and requirements are met, including all project milestones and budgets.  Delivery Executives communicate and interact at the executive level, as well as up and down the value chain of the customer organization, including navigating tough conversations and challenging personalities with integrity, respect, and a blend of firmness and flexibility that creates a positive working environment while aligning with company policies and goals. 


A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Working with Sales, Architects, Services and others to set scope, staffing and organization aspects of a new engagement. You will also work with all involved to reorganize and revise staffing and organization as needed.   80% of this role is focused on delivery (this is a billable role) and 20% is focused on presales and deal structuring.  
  • Oversee the creation of the delivery solution, scope and SOW. You will own the integrated project plan and responsibility for the oversight and execution.  You will build relationships with existing customers to ensure that they are engaged and getting the most value from our services. 
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Project Managers, regularly assess project and team health through stakeholder interactions, and collaborate with the PM team to address issues and implement improvements as needed.
  • Be the primary leader in escalation mitigations and recoveries relationship management.  The Delivery Executive will proactive communication with Infor, Partner, and Customer Executives.
  • Assist & Review SOW details, review staffing plan, budget, and schedule for work being proposed.
  

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience delivering professional services engagements, on-premise, cloud and hybrid.  
  • Experienced in Agile methodologies, such as Sprint Planning, Scrum Management, Epic/Feature work break-downs, Story-Pointing, Velocity Tracking, Burn-downs/Burn-ups, etc. 
  • Experience selling consulting services and adding value in the sales process.
  • Experience managing successful global custom and/or co-development projects and ability to simultaneously manage multiple functions, projects, priorities and time pressure.
  • P&L experience related to programs and projects.
  • Ability to travel up to 50%
  • Legal Authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience building trust-based, constructive working relationships with customer executives and Infor colleagues. 
  • Professional services experience from an enterprise software company, ideally a cloud applications business or a systems integration consultancy firm.
  • Distribution manufacturing industry experience.
  • Experience negotiating.   
  • Willing and able to travel extensively, including extended international. 

Remote (Dallas, TX and Atlanta, GA)

As a business analyst, you will be part of an international team of business analysts. You will help bringing Infor’s data strategy to the next level through our Data Fabric solution, which is part of the Infor OS technology platform. Data Fabric enables our customers to maximize the use their business data to quickly gain insights, and to drive innovations by using data for new applications using new technologies. • Experience of business intelligence and data visualization.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience evaluating information from various sources and resolve conflicts.
• Experience engaging in multiple initiatives simultaneously, prioritize tasks and make effective decisions under pressure.

description_html:
We are looking for a Business Analyst who will play a key role in enhancing our Financials and Supply Chain Management solutions, specifically in Procurement and Distribution Management. You will collaborate with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to define and document features that drive efficiency and innovation for global enterprises.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives on creating clear Feature Specifications, solving complex problems, and applying analytical and critical thinking skills to deliver impactful solutions.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Gather and Analyze Requirements: Work closely with product managers and stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into actionable requirements.
  • Create Feature Specification Documents: Develop detailed specifications including functional requirements, acceptance criteria, user flows, and mock-ups.
  • Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with architects and engineers to ensure requirements are accurately implemented.
  • Ensure Quality: Support QA teams in validating requirements and participate in acceptance testing.
  • Drive Continuous Improvement: Identify gaps, propose solutions, and optimize processes for Financials and Supply Chain modules.
  • Communicate Effectively: Present ideas and solutions clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
 What You Will Need:
  • Experience in Feature Specification Creation and requirements documentation.
  • Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.
  • Proven Critical Thinking: Evaluate multiple solutions, assess risks, and recommend the best approach.
  • Excellent Problem-Solving Skills: Creative and structured approach to resolving complex issues.
  • Familiarity with Financials and Supply Chain Management systems, particularly procurement and distribution processes.
  • Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies and tools like Confluence, Jira.
  • Teamwork and organizational skills.
  • Self-motivation and discipline, ability to multi-task.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Analytical skills to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources.
  • 2+ years experience in the design and/or use of enterprise business software applications.
  • Functional and technical product knowledge.
  • Understands requirements analysis, specification, and verification practices and can apply them in practice.
  • Knowledge of how enterprise software products are positioned and developed.
  • Modeling skills – ability to represent requirements and design information in graphical forms that augment textual representations.
