description_html:
Job Summary

We are seeking a proactive and experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our technology team.
The ideal candidate will have an MBA in Information Technology or Business Analytics and a strong understanding of how to bridge business needs with technical solutions.
In this role, you will collaborate closely with global stakeholders, product owners, and technical teams to define business requirements, design process improvements,
and deliver scalable IT solutions aligned with organizational goals.

Key Responsibilities

·       Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document detailed business and functional requirements.

·       Translate business objectives into clear specifications including Business Requirement Documents (BRD), Functional Specification Documents (FSD), and User Stories.

·       Facilitate workshops and meetings to elicit requirements, define scope, and align expectations between business and IT teams.

·       Support the full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) — from requirement analysis through design, testing, deployment, and post-implementation review.

·       Participate actively in Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, backlog grooming, daily stand-ups, reviews, and retrospectives).

·       Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) by developing test scenarios, tracking defects, and validating fixes.

·       Prepare and maintain process flow diagrams, use case models, and data mapping documents using tools such as Lucidchart or Visio.

·       Work closely with US-based teams to support global project initiatives and ensure seamless communication across time zones.

·       Partner with developers, QA engineers, and project managers to ensure technical solutions meet business expectations.

·       Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation using ERP or analytics tools.

·       Produce high-quality documentation, reports, and presentations for management and stakeholders.

Required Skills & Qualifications

·       MBA or equivalent degree in Information Technology, Systems, or Business Analytics.

·       6+ years of experience as a Senior Business Analyst in enterprise or technology-driven environments.

·       Strong understanding of business processes and ability to map them to system capabilities.

·       Experience with ERP systems especially Manufacturing domain (Infor M3, SAP, Oracle, etc.), SQL, APIs, or data analytics tools is an advantage.

·       Knowledge of Agile methodologies and SDLC best practices.

·       Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills.

·       Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and collaboration tools like JIRA and Confluence.

·       Ability to manage multiple priorities and work effectively in cross-functional teams.

·       Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Skills

·       Hands-on project experience in Business Analysis, Process Configuration, and Quote-to-Cash or Procure-to-Pay domains.

·       Experience in process modeling tools and creating UML diagrams.

·       Exposure to Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) workflows.

·       Experience in data-driven decision-making using Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent tools.

·       Certifications such as CBAP, CCBA, or PMI-PBA are a plus.

Soft Skills

·       Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder engagement abilities.

·       Detail-oriented with strong organizational and documentation skills.

·       Self-motivated, proactive, and adaptable to dynamic environments.

·       Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively with global teams.

description_html:
Position Overview

The Dev Project Manager with 6-7years of experience will oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of sprint-based projects within the development team. This role ensures that Agile methodologies are followed, sprint goals are met, and cross-functional collaboration drives continuous improvement. The Dev Project Manager is responsible for managing sprint cycles, removing impediments, and delivering value on time and within scope.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the planning, coordination, and execution of sprint projects using Agile Scrum methodology.
  • Own the sprint lifecycle including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
  • Collaborate with Product Owners to maintain and prioritize the sprint backlog.
  • Facilitate communication and collaboration between development teams, stakeholders, and other business units.
  • Track sprint progress and performance metrics (e.g., velocity, burn-down charts, cycle time).
  • Identify risks, blockers, and dependencies; proactively work with teams to resolve issues and keep sprints on track.
  • Coach team members on Agile principles and practices to foster a culture of continuous improvement.
  • Manage scope, timeline, and resource constraints to meet project deliverables.
  • Prepare and present sprint reports and updates to leadership and stakeholders.
  • Drive alignment between business goals and technical execution.
  • Support the scaling of Agile practices across multiple teams if applicable.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Project Management, or a related field.
  • Proven 6-7 years of experience as a Project Manager or Scrum Master managing sprint projects in Agile environments.
  • Strong understanding of Agile frameworks, especially Scrum and Kanban.
  • Certification such as Certified Scrum Master (CSM), PMI-ACP, or equivalent is preferred.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Proficiency with Agile project management tools (e.g., Jira, Azure DevOps, Rally).
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to risk management.
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams including developers, QA, UX/UI, and business stakeholders.

Work Environment

  • Agile-focused, collaborative team culture.
  • Hybrid or remote work flexibility.
  • Involvement in fast-paced, iterative software development projects.

description_html:
The Senior Project Manager oversees complex, multi-team initiatives and ensures timely, high-quality delivery across cross-functional stakeholders. This role drives structured execution, maintains program governance, and proactively identifies risks and dependencies. The position requires strong communication, stakeholder management, and experience with project workflows, automation, and reporting tools, including knowledge of Microsoft Power Automate and ecosystem-based process automation.

The Senior Project Manager operates with a high degree of ownership, enabling predictable delivery while fostering collaboration across engineering, product, design, and business teams.

Key Responsibilities

Program & Project Delivery

  • Lead end-to-end delivery of medium to large-scale initiatives across multiple workstreams.
  • Drive project planning, execution tracking, risk management, and issue resolution.
  • Establish and maintain clear timelines, milestones, and delivery checkpoints.
  • Ensure adherence to governance processes, quality standards, and organizational guidelines.

Stakeholder & Communication Management

  • Coordinate with cross-functional teams, senior leaders, and external partners as required.
  • Facilitate regular program cadence — status reviews, stand-ups, readouts, and steering meetings.
  • Prepare concise, executive-ready updates summarizing progress, blockers, dependencies, and decisions required.
  • Manage expectations and improve transparency across stakeholders.

Operational Excellence & Automation

  • Utilize Microsoft Power Automate and related platforms to streamline workflows and automate repetitive processes.
  • Identify opportunities to enhance reporting, approvals, and data flows through automation.
  • Support the creation and maintenance of reusable templates, dashboards, and documentation.

Process, Governance & Continuous Improvement

  • Implement standardized project management practices across teams.
  • Conduct retrospectives and drive action plans for improving delivery efficiency.
  • Establish mechanisms for risk/issue tracking, dependency mapping, and change control.
  • Ensure team alignment to defined processes and promote a culture of accountability.

Team Coordination & Leadership

  • Work with engineering, product, and operational teams to align priorities and orchestrate joint outcomes.
  • Support decision-making with structured analysis and scenario planning.
  • Mentor junior PMs or coordinators as needed and contribute to PMO frameworks.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, or related discipline.
  • 7–10 years of experience managing cross-functional technology or business projects.
  • Strong understanding of project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid).
  • Proficiency with project management tools (Jira, Confluence, MS Project, or equivalent).
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Power Automate, Power Apps, or similar workflow automation tools.
  • Strong ability to communicate with senior stakeholders and manage cross-team alignment.

Preferred Qualifications

  • PMP, Prince2, CSM, or equivalent professional certification.
  • Experience delivering complex multi-team programs in matrixed organizations.
  • Exposure to process automation, data-driven dashboards, and reporting frameworks.
  • Familiarity with enterprise tools such as Power BI, Azure DevOps, or collaboration platforms.
  • Ability to manage ambiguous problem spaces and drive structure in rapidly evolving environments.
  • Experience coordinating distributed or global teams.

We’re looking for a Development Business Analyst to join our M3 Purchase and Manufacturing application team. Here, you’ll work with M3, a Java-based ERP system supporting purchasing, warehouse management, manufacturing, sales, and finance. You’ll play a key role in developing and supporting applications that drive our clients’ success.


Why Join Us?

  • Grow Where You Excel: We personalize roles and responsibilities to match your unique strengths and interests, helping you maximize your contribution and satisfaction.
  • Mentorship & Learning: You’ll be supported by experienced mentors and a diverse team, with plenty of opportunities for hands-on learning and professional growth.
  • Collaborative, Values-Driven Culture: We foster humility, curiosity, and team spirit. We value your ideas and encourage you to take initiative.

description_html:
As a DevOps Engineer, you will develop, test, document, and support cloud DevOps implementations using automated techniques to deliver secure and efficient environments. You will focus on building advanced cloud network implementations and managing Kubernetes and serverless architectures. This involves leveraging tools like Terraform for AWS infrastructure and CI/CD practices for continuous integration and deployment. The role requires collaboration with development teams to design scalable systems and lead a small team in delivering timely DevOps solutions.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop, test, and support cloud DevOps implementations with a strong focus on security. 
  • Build and manage cloud network implementations, emphasizing security best practices. 
  • Implement Kubernetes solutions, creating necessary object YAML files for system components. 
  • Utilize CI/CD tools for continuous integration and delivery, optimizing deployment processes. 
  • Collaborate with development teams to design scalable systems using serverless architecture. 
  • Manage infrastructure using Terraform within AWS, ensuring efficient operations. 
  • Monitor and optimize environments using AWS services such as EC2, VPC, and Lambda. 
  • Coordinate with cross functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions. 
  • Lead the DevOps pipeline across complex cloud-based systems for automated delivery.
Basic qualification:
  • Minimum 4-5 years' Experience in Cloud DevOps with containers and Kubernetes. 
  • Proficiency in Linux OS, shell scripting, and serverless architecture. 
  • Strong knowledge of Kubernetes components and flows. 
  • Experience with Terraform and AWS infrastructure management. 
  • Familiarity with AWS services including EC2, VPC, and Lambda. 
  • Proficient in Docker, Jenkins, and Groovy scripting. 
  • Well-versed in DevOps patterns and CI/CD tools like Jenkins. 
  • Excellent communication skills. 
  • Strong problem-solving skills and quick solution delivery. 
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Preferred Qualification: 
  • Experience with GitLab CI/CD pipelines and registry will be a plus. 
  • Advanced knowledge of Python scripting or Groovy. 
  • Familiarity with additional AWS services and DevOps tools.

description_html:
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our Manila team. This role focuses on automating and operating AWS cloud deployments for the MRM/OCM products. You will collaborate closely with CloudOps teams in the US, development teams in Sydney and India, and other cross-functional teams. 

The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, has a strong “can-do” attitude, enjoys learning new technologies, and is capable of documenting complex architectures clearly. You will be hands-on in infrastructure automation, CI/CD, and operational support through modern DevOps tooling.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

Cloud & Infrastructure Automation
1. Build, maintain, and improve AWS cloud infrastructure using Terraform or similar tools.
2. Design and automate deployment pipelines using Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or equivalent.
3. Implement infrastructure-as-code best practices, including modularization, naming conventions, and versioning.
4. Automate environment provisioning, configuration, patching, and observability.

Operations & Support
1. Work closely with CloudOps teams in the US on production support, incident resolution, change management, and operational improvements.
2. Perform environment upgrades, scaling, monitoring, performance tuning, and cost optimization.
3. Troubleshoot deployment/infrastructure issues across Windows and Linux environments.

Collaboration & Documentation
1. Collaborate daily with developers across Sydney and India to support releases and improve automation.
2. Produce clear architecture and environment documentation, runbooks, and deployment guides.
3. Participate in Agile ceremonies and contribute to planning and continuous improvement.

What You Will Need?
Required Skills & Qualifications
Technical
1. 5+ years of experience in DevOps, Cloud Engineering, or Infrastructure Automation.
2. Strong hands-on experience with AWS (EC2, S3, CloudWatch, IAM, RDS, Lambda, ALB/ELB, VPC, SNS/SQS, etc.).
3. Strong experience in Terraform or other tools.
4. Experience with CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins or GitLab CI/CD.
5. Proficiency in scripting with Python, PowerShell, or Shell Script.
6. Good understanding of networking, security groups, firewalls, VPC networking, SSL/TLS, DNS, IAM security best practices.
7. Experience working on both Linux and Windows servers.

Soft Skills
1. Excellent communication skills (working with US & AU teams).
2. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
3. “Can-do” attitude with a willingness to take ownership.
4. Ability to learn new tools, frameworks, and technologies quickly.
5. Strong documentation habits.
6. Able to collaborate effectively in a distributed global team.

Preferred Qualifications
1. Experience with Docker, containerization, or ECS/EKS.
2. Knowledge of monitoring tools like CloudWatch, CloudTrail, Kafka/Grafana.
3. Experience with security scanning, compliance tools, or automated QA.
4. Exposure to Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).
5. Familiarity with .NET/Java applications, IIS, Tomcat, or web application deployments

Work Setup Requirement: This role follows a hybrid work arrangement, requiring onsite presence three times per week.

description_html:
Infor is seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to join the Infor Hospitality – Restaurant team. This strategic role will lead the design, implementation, and operation of our cloud-native restaurant solutions—including POS, mobile ordering, and Kitchen Display Systems (KDS)—on AWS and other platforms. The Senior DevOps Engineer will drive infrastructure-as-code excellence, security best practices, CI/CD maturity, and operational resilience, while mentoring team members and partnering with development, QA, security, and business leaders.

You will architect scalable cloud environments, establish security hardening standards, champion automation and observability, and foster a culture of DevOps excellence across the restaurant technology ecosystem.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes

  • Leading the design and implementation of cloud infrastructure using Terraform, CloudFormation, and other infrastructure-as-code tools
  • Architecting and maintaining GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, security scanning, deployments, and rollbacks
  • Integrating and managing application security scanning tools including Veracode and Cobalt for vulnerability management
  • Implementing platform security best practices, security hardening, compliance controls, and incident response protocols
  • Partnering with developers, QA, and security teams to ensure robust environments, efficient release management, and secure operations
  • Managing monitoring, logging, alerting, and observability for distributed production environments (e.g., AWS CloudWatch, Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana)
  • Mentoring junior and mid-level DevOps engineers, conducting code reviews, and driving technical excellence
  • Troubleshooting complex deployment, infrastructure, and security issues across restaurant solutions
  • Collaborating cross-functionally to ensure operational readiness, high availability, performance, and security posture
  • Driving innovation in automation, infrastructure patterns, observability, and cloud-native operations


Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • 7+ years in DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering, or cloud platform operations
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience designing and implementing infrastructure using Terraform in production environments
  • Strong expertise in AWS (EC2, ECS, RDS, Lambda, S3, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation) with proven cloud architecture experience
  • Proficiency with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes/EKS)
  • Extensive experience building and maintaining GitLab CI/CD pipelines, including multi-stage deployments and automated testing
  • Hands-on experience integrating and managing application security tools such as Veracode and Cobalt for static/dynamic analysis
  • Deep understanding of platform security, security hardening, vulnerability management, and compliance frameworks
  • Programming proficiency (C#, Java or similar languages)
  • Advanced scripting capabilities (Python, PowerShell, Bash) and automation development
  • Strong experience with monitoring, logging, and alerting tools (CloudWatch, Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana, or similar)
  • Track record with configuration management and version control systems (Git, GitLab)
  • Deep understanding of networking, DNS, load balancing, security groups, and distributed systems operations
  • Proven ability to mentor engineers and drive technical initiatives
  • Excellent collaboration, communication, and leadership skills


Ideal Candidate Profile

  • Experience supporting .NET/C# application environments in production
  • Familiarity with restaurant systems (POS, KDS, mobile platforms) or hospitality technology
  • Experience with SQL database administration and operations (Microsoft SQL Server or similar)
  • Knowledge of configuration management tools (Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Experience with disaster recovery, backup strategies, and business continuity planning
  • Understanding of compliance standards (PCI-DSS, SOC 2, GDPR) in cloud environments
  • Experience integrating third-party services and APIs
  • Contributions to open-source DevOps projects or technical community involvement
  • AWS certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer, Security Specialty)
  • Passion for DevOps best practices, continuous improvement, automation excellence, and team mentorship

description_html:
Infor MES is a leading Manufacturing Execution System product sold by Infor. We are expanding our capabilities by delivering Infor MES as a SaaS offering hosted on AWS, targeting new customers with a scalable, secure, and multi-tenant cloud solution. The Senior Development Operations Engineer will play a vital role in building, automating, and managing the tooling, infrastructure, and processes that enable this SaaS transition and ongoing operation. This role requires expertise in cloud-native DevOps practices, automation, and cloud infrastructure engineering, ensuring that the SaaS environment is robust, efficient, and secure.


A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Architect, develop, and maintain the tooling, automation, and CI/CD pipelines that power the delivery and operation of Infor MES as a SaaS offering on AWS.
  • Collaborate closely with product development, cloud engineering, and operations teams to design multi-tenant SaaS infrastructure and deployment workflows.
  • Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) frameworks for consistent, version-controlled cloud environments using Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar tools.
  • Automate configuration management, deployment, and release processes to support frequent, reliable, and secure SaaS releases.
  • Build and maintain monitoring, alerting, and logging solutions to ensure service health, performance, and security compliance.
  • Support containerization and orchestration strategies (e.g., Kubernetes, Amazon ECS) for efficient SaaS application scaling.
  • Drive cloud cost optimization, capacity planning, and security best practices within the AWS environment.
  • Participate in incident response and root cause analysis to continuously improve system reliability and customer experience.
  • Document operational processes, architecture, and best practices for SaaS tooling and infrastructure.
  • Mentor and guide junior engineers, fostering a culture of automation and operational excellence.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in DevOps, cloud engineering, or related roles, with a strong focus on SaaS platforms.
  • Deep hands-on experience with AWS services including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, CloudWatch, VPC, and IAM.
  • Proven expertise with CI/CD systems like Jenkins, GitLab CI, AWS CodePipeline, or CircleCI.
  • Proficiency in infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform or AWS CloudFormation.
  • Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash, PowerShell) for automation and integration tasks.
  • Experience with container platforms (Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon ECS).
  • Solid understanding of monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, AWS CloudWatch).
  • Familiarity with multi-tenant SaaS architectures and operational challenges.
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills, able to work effectively across teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
  • AWS certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or AWS Certified Solutions Architect.
  • Experience leading migration or transformation projects from on-premises to cloud-based SaaS.
  • Knowledge of cloud security, governance, and compliance frameworks.
  • Experience with DevSecOps practices embedding security into the CI/CD pipeline.
  • Understanding of database migration and management in cloud SaaS environments.
  • Prior experience building SaaS tooling for automated provisioning, monitoring, and scaling.
  • Experience or knowledge of Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) or industrial software is a plus.

description_html:
The Director, Consulting – Value Engagement will lead Infor’s global Value Engagement program, driving measurable customer outcomes, accelerating opportunity generation, and standardizing delivery across all regions. This high-impact leadership role will own the Value Engagement framework, ensuring repeatability, scalability, and quality through standardized artifacts, reporting, and enablement. The Director will work cross-functionally with Consulting, Customer Success, Sales, and Regional teams to deliver consistent value engagements that directly influence revenue growth and customer satisfaction.


A Day in The Like

Leadership & Strategy

· Define and own the global Value Engagement vision, framework, and delivery model.

· Lead a distributed team of Solution Architects (including low-cost Global Delivery Services hubs) and regional resources to execute engagements at scale.

· Establish and track KPIs for engagement quality, velocity, conversion, and ROI.

· Drive regional adoption and expansion of Value Engagements, including support for Latin America and other growth markets.

Program Governance & Execution

· Ensure delivery of Value Engagements and meet revenue/margin and sales opportunity generation targets.

· Oversee engagement scheduling, scoping, execution, and follow-up in alignment with playbooks and best practices.

· Maintain a robust pipeline in collaboration with Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing.

· Monitor and report on performance, conversion rates, and financial impact to leadership.

Standardization & Enablement

· Create and maintain standardized artifacts, templates, and methodologies to ensure consistent engagement quality.

· Implement ROI tracking and reporting processes for transparency and continuous improvement.

· Lead enablement of Solution Architects, Sales, and Customer Success teams on the Value Engagement process.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

· Partner with FP&A to align reporting, performance tracking, and economic impact.

· Coordinate with Velocity Suite and other strategic initiatives to maximize cross-sell and upsell opportunities.

· Serve as the primary liaison to the Value Engagement Steering Committee.

Innovation & Continuous Improvement

· Launch new Value Engagement offerings and automation pilots.

· Identify and implement process improvements to reduce cost per engagement and improve scalability.

· Leverage customer feedback and delivery metrics to refine the portfolio and delivery model.


Qualifications

· Proven leadership experience in consulting, value engineering, or customer success, with a track record of driving measurable business impact.

· Strong experience; advanced degree in Business, Engineering, or related field preferred.

· Strong understanding of enterprise software and business value realization methodologies.

· Experience building and leading distributed, cross-functional teams across geographies.

· Demonstrated ability to create and execute standardized frameworks for scalable program delivery.

· Exceptional stakeholder management, communication, and presentation skills.

. An English-fluent speaker and Spanish-fluent would be a plus. 


What We Offer

· Opportunity to lead a global program that directly drives revenue and customer satisfaction.

· Strategic role influencing Infor’s approach to customer value delivery across all regions.

· Competitive compensation and benefits package.


Job Title: Director, Consulting – Value Engagement 

Location: Barcelona

Employment Type: Full-Time

· Maintain a robust pipeline in collaboration with Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing.
· Monitor and report on performance, conversion rates, and financial impact to leadership.
Standardization & Enablement
· Create and maintain standardized artifacts, templates, and methodologies to ensure consistent engagement quality.
· Implement ROI tracking and reporting processes for transparency and continuous improvement.
· Lead enablement of Solution Architects, Sales, and Customer Success teams on the Value Engagement process.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
· Partner with FP&A to align reporting, performance tracking, and economic impact.
· Coordinate with Velocity Suite and other strategic initiatives to maximize cross-sell and upsell opportunities.
· Serve as the primary liaison to the Value Engagement Steering Committee.
Innovation & Continuous Improvement
· Launch new Value Engagement offerings and automation pilots.
· Identify and implement process improvements to reduce cost per engagement and improve scalability.
· Leverage customer feedback and delivery metrics to refine the portfolio and delivery model.

· Proven leadership experience in consulting, value engineering, or customer success, with a track record of driving measurable business impact.
· Strong experience; advanced degree in Business, Engineering, or related field preferred.

description_html:
The Sales Director is responsible for sales leadership of the team that sells the Infor CPQ (Configure/Price/Quote) solutions.  This position includes building, leading, coaching and mentoring a team of direct Account Managers to achieve their sales quotas. The Sales Director will work with the sales team to evaluate opportunities and execute intelligent pursuit plans.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:
  • Articulate the Infor CPQ solution suite value proposition and successfully communicate the competitive advantages, resources and processes to client and prospects.
  • Responsible for the team being equipped with the right skills, coordinating all necessary enablement and related education to run sales cycles to completion.
  • Drive alignment of team members and execute talent management programs throughout the year.
  • Responsible for the effectiveness of people processes, ensuring people initiatives are completed and monitored (Roles, Responsibilities & Expectations (RREs), compensation reviews, talent reviews etc.).
  • Understand and execute the Principal Based Management journey for all employees by championing our guiding principles to transform our culture, proactively tracking, monitoring, and managing all agreed KPIs.
  • Own the implementation and execution of all operational plans that impact team. 
  • Meet and achieve all quota goals.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience building, managing and coaching enteprise software sales teams to quota achievement.
  • Experience selling SaaS ERP or Manufacturing business solutions.
  • Experience building and communicating competitive advantages, value, resources and processes to client and prospects.
  • Experience working with sales teams and prospective clients to understand their business objectives and create appropriate solutions and value to meet their business needs.
  • Experience developing value propositions based on ROI cost/benefit analysis.
  • Experience with customer account strategies and tactical penetration plans.  Establish, document, and maintain solid communication and follow-up procedures for all assigned accounts. 
  • Experience negotiating pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.


Preferred Skills:

  • Experience selling SaaS CPQ business solutions.
  • Experience developing MEDDPICC Sales Strategies.
  • Experience working with large enterprise business processes.
  • Bachelor’s Degree.

Location:  Remote Based US (Dallas, TX, Atlanta, GA)

description_html:
Associate Consultant (The Early Talent Program)

Would you like to work on implementing future digital solutions?

As an Associate Consultant, you will gain knowledge about our Cloud solutions, implementation methodology, consulting skills, and industry business practices. Throughout the program, you will learn how to create and implement digital solutions to address our customers' needs. This is a full-time position, starting within the Early Talent Program. No prior technical background or ERP experience is required.


Your daily tasks as an Associate Consultant will include:

  • Implementing ERP solutions
  • Analyzing business processes
  • Interacting with customers
  • Designing business solutions
  • Preparing and participating in workshops for our customers
  • Learning new business implementation methods
  • Supporting customer training
  • Assisting in go-lives

ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) refers to the integrated management of core business processes, often in real-time and facilitated by software and technology. ERP is typically a suite of integrated applications that organizations use to collect, store, manage, and interpret data across various business activities.

About The Early Talent Program

The program lasts 12 months and includes both academy training and hands-on project work to accelerate your consulting career. Early in the program, you will help customers leverage our world-class Cloud solutions in industries such as Distribution, Food & Beverage, Automotive, and Manufacturing. This experience will provide a solid foundation in managing innovative local and global Infor projects from both IT and business perspectives.

The Early Talent Program includes:

  • Project work
  • Product training
  • Mentorship
  • Soft skills training
  • Customer consulting
  • Business travel


This program is set in an international environment, where you will interact with instructors and other Early Talents from across EMEA. In addition to training in business processes, applications, and industry solutions, you will also receive an introduction to Infor, our values, and our ways of working.

All elements of the program are designed to help you learn, innovate, improve, and transform into a skilled consultant.

You're a great fit if you:

  • Have a genuine interest in business processes and IT
  • Are willing to travel and hold a valid driver’s license
  • Have a "can-do" attitude
  • Are eager to grow and learn
  • Enjoy interacting with people
  • Have practical experience in the Distribution, Equipment and Rental Industries

description_html:
As the Go to Market (GTM) program manager for Infor U’s Revenue Enablement team, you will be responsible for executing product launches and the execution of customer education strategy that ensure our products and services successfully reach and resonate with our target customers. You will orchestrate cross-functional alignment between sales, marketing, product, learner engagement and other teams to drive revenue growth by enabling and equipping teams with the right tools, content, and messaging.

 A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, sales marketing and other teams to ensure alignment and coordinated execution of GTM initiatives.
  • Manage the execution of the go-to-market roadmap including customer segmentation positioning and launch strategies.
  • Manage detailed launch timelines and ensure on-time delivery of all launch activities.
  • Create and maintain sales collateral, enablement content, and training materials to support successful product launches.
  • Provide hands-on enablement support during launches to ensure all teams are fully equipped.
  • Conduct data analysis and reporting to inform strategy, prioritize initiatives, and support decision making.
  • Maintain and update critical documentation related to customer enablement and GTM processes, product information, and enablement assets.

 

Basic Qualifications: 

  • Leading cross-departmental meetings to align on customer education goals and strategy execution.
  • Experience conducting competitive and customer research analysis.
  • Experience creating and updating sales enablement content.
  • Experience coordinating product launch activities and marketing campaigns.
  • Experience presenting customer enablement plans and progress to leadership using PowerPoint.
  • Experience monitoring customer enablement KPI’s and providing actionable insights for optimization.

 

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Experience with GTM or Revenue Enablement role, preferably in learning, technology and related industries.
  • Strategic planning experience to interpret data and business impact.
  • Cross-functional collaboration and stakeholder management experience.
  • Experience translating product features into customer-centric messaging.
  • Project management experience.


Job Location:     Remote

description_html:
As a Sales Coach and Enablement Leader, you will be at the forefront of driving sales excellence by empowering Sellers, Sales Supervisors, and customer-facing teams across the customer journey. You will lead the deployment and adoption of global sales enablement programs, coaching methodologies, and tools working closely with Business Unit leadership and the Global Sales Enablement team.

This role is critical in fostering a high-performance culture by accelerating skill development, embedding proven sales methodologies, and ensuring cross-functional collaboration to deliver a seamless and differentiated buyer experience.


A Day In The Life Includes: 

  • Design and deliver dynamic coaching and enablement programs that elevate sales skills and behaviors across Sellers and Sales Supervisors.
  • Act as a “coach-the-coach” leader, equipping Sales Supervisors with tools and strategies to cascade effective coaching throughout their teams.
  • Collaborate closely with the Global Sales Enablement Program team to drive strong adoption and embedment of global content, tools, and methodologies within your assigned Business Unit.
  • Partner with leadership across the sales ecosystem—including Customer Success, Marketing, and Sales Support—to align enablement initiatives with business priorities and the evolving customer journey.
  • Leverage data and sales performance analytics to identify gaps, measure program impact, and continuously improve coaching effectiveness.
  • Support onboarding, certification, and ongoing learning programs to accelerate new hire readiness and continuous skill growth.
  • Drive cultural change and ensure consistent adoption of sales methodologies (e.g., MEDDPICC, Value Selling) and sales technology platforms.


Basic Qualifications: 

  • Experience in sales coaching, sales enablement, or sales management and complex selling roles—preferably within the software or technology sector supporting Manufacturing Verticals.
  • Experience partnering with sales leaders, supervisors, and cross-functional teams.
  • Experience designing and deploying scalable coaching programs that drive measurable sales outcomes.
  • Experience presenting and storytelling, including coaching C-suite team.
  • Experience leveraging dashboards and analytics to drive continuous improvement.
  • Experience working in a matrixed global environment.


Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Experience with sales methodologies like MEDDPICC or Value Selling is highly desirable.

Job Location: Alpharetta, GA; Dallas, TX.

description_html:
As a ERP Finance Subject Matter Expert /QA at Infor in Barneveld you will have the unique opportunity to join a successful and rapidly growing company and to contribute to the development of amazing digital solutions in the cloud!

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the Quality Assurance Team based in Barneveld. You will test the software to ensure the product meets the requirements. You will work in a multi-disciplinary project team in an international development environment.

Our customers are running in the cloud and are receiving frequent updates. You are representing the customer in our development organization to ensure the updates are not disturbing our customers business.

Your activities like manually testing new features, creating and monitoring automated regression tests are very important in our “Quality First” development approach.


Your responsibilities include:

  • Develop an understanding of the finance usage of Infor/ERP LN applications.
  • Learn new features and concepts through self-learning.
  • Perform any QA related tasks such as Test Preparation, Test Execution and Test Automation.
  • Closely cooperate with different teams and stakeholders in different time zones.
  • Participate in reviews of test scripts within the test group.
  • Learn and use automated testing tools and test frameworks for automated functional testing.

What do you need to have:

  • Graduated in Economics, Finance or equivalent.
  • Experience with ERP software.
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Fluent in English languages, Dutch is a plus.
  • A passion to improve things and a drive for continuous improvement.
  • Strong analytical skills and a clear focus on quality.
  • Experience in one or more of the following: finance, financial accounting, working with ERP systems in a finance context, experience with end-to-end financial processes is a plus.
  • A passion for improving software and closely aligned to the benefits this provides to Infor customers.

What Will Put You Ahead?

  • Testing knowledge is not mandatory, we will teach you the product, test tools and Infor processes.
  • Degree or Masters educated, would be a bonus, in particular studies Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.

What do we offer you:

  • A permanent workplace in Barneveld.
  • Training as a Software Tester.
  • Fine cooperation with experienced colleagues.
  • Growth opportunities to other functions within Infor.
  • Market-compliant working conditions.

description_html:
The Project Director will take full ownership of the end-to-end delivery of Infor's most complex, multi-million dollar, multi-site, and international projects—including hybrid, on-premise, cloud, and co-development engagements. You will be responsible for formulating successful strategies to increase operational performance and ensuring alignment with customer business objectives and contractual requirements (Statement of Work).


This role requires leadership in resource management, project planning, financial control, risk mitigation, and customer engagement to drive project success and maximize customer satisfaction and retention.


Key Responsibilities

· Provide strategic leadership and ownership of large, complex and global projects.

· Develop, maintain, and control integrated project plans, schedules, and budgets.

· Establish alignment between Infor and customer expectations, ensuring clarity on scope and responsibilities and success of the project.

· Lead implementation planning and execution using Infor's methodology and project management tools.

· Manage all project resources, including internal teams, offshore, and third-party subcontractors.

· Track project status and communicate regularly to customers and internal stakeholders.

· Manage change control processes and update project baselines as needed.

· Identify, assess, and mitigate risks and issues proactively.

· Lead governance and steering committees with customer executives.

· May need to manage multiple workstreams on a project acting as program manager in large complex, multi workstream projects. Projects may have several other project managers leading workstreams in which the project director will lead and have ownership of the entire project.

· Coach and mentor Project Managers and other delivery team members.

· Transition deliverables to Global Support or Managed Services effectively.

· Own and responsible for project financials, including forecasting, billing, and cost control.

· Participate in presales and deal structuring activities as required.

· Drive continuous improvement through stakeholder feedback and lessons learned.



Required Qualifications & Experience

· Project Management Professional (PMP®) certification or equivalent.

· Significant experience managing full lifecycle ERP or complex software implementation projects.

· Proven ability to operate effectively in dynamic, high-growth environments with demanding customers.

· Strong organizational, leadership, and communication skills.

· Experience managing multi-country, multi-vendor, multi-product projects.

· Active application of tools for Project Management (like Certinia PSA) and Project Planning (like MS Project, GANTT) and Task-Management tools (like JIRA, ADO, SharePoint)

· Knowledge of enterprise software, cloud applications, and Agile methodologies.

· Experience with co-development and hybrid delivery models.

· Strong negotiation and influencing skills at all business levels.

· Factual based decision making.

· Ability to read customer reality, develop trust-based relationships with customers and internal teams.

· Familiarity with organizational change management (OCM) principles.

· Experience in leading virtual teams, mentoring project managers, and contributing to project management communities.

· Business proficient in both English and French.

· Ability and willingness to travel, including international travel.

description_html:
As a ERP Quality Assurance Analyst at Infor in Barneveld you will have the unique opportunity to join a successful and rapidly growing company and to contribute to the development of amazing digital solutions in the cloud!

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the Quality Assurance Team based in Barneveld. You will test the software to ensure the product meets the requirements. You will work in a multi-disciplinary project team in an international development environment.

Our customers are running in the cloud and are receiving frequent updates. You are representing the customer in our development organization to ensure the updates are not disturbing our customers business.

Your activities like manually testing new features, creating and monitoring automated regression tests are very important in our “Quality First” development approach.


Your responsibilities include:

  • Develop an understanding of the finance usage of Infor/ERP LN applications.
  • Learn new features and concepts through self-learning.
  • Perform any QA related tasks such as Test Preparation, Test Execution and Test Automation.
  • Closely cooperate with different teams and stakeholders in different time zones.
  • Participate in reviews of test scripts within the test group.
  • Learn and use automated testing tools and test frameworks for automated functional testing.

What do you need to have:

  • Graduated in Economics, Finance or equivalent.
  • Experience with ERP software.
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Fluent in English languages, Dutch is a plus.
  • A passion to improve things and a drive for continuous improvement.
  • Strong analytical skills and a clear focus on quality.
  • Experience in one or more of the following: finance, financial accounting, working with ERP systems in a finance context, experience with end-to-end financial processes is a plus.
  • A passion for improving software and closely aligned to the benefits this provides to Infor customers.

What Will Put You Ahead?

  • Testing knowledge is not mandatory, we will teach you the product, test tools and Infor processes.
  • Degree or Masters educated, would be a bonus, in particular studies Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.

What do we offer you:

  • A permanent workplace in Barneveld.
  • Training as a Software Tester.
  • Fine cooperation with experienced colleagues.
  • Growth opportunities to other functions within Infor.
  • Market-compliant working conditions.

description_html:
The Senior Solution Architect is responsible for proposing specific Infor solutions that fit within the customer’s business environment and business objectives and can be shown to address the customer’s business problems and exploit opportunities. The Senior Solution Architect is able to understand customer business drivers and current IT environment. The Solution Architect ensures solution feasibility and proposes a roadmap and the solution stack to realize the solution.

The Senior Solution Architect is deployed operationally across multiple solution domains utilizing their broad knowledge of the Infor solution portfolio to identify the components required to construct the most appropriate solution for the customer. The Senior Solution Architect is typically engaged full time as part of the project delivery structure, involved in the sales circle process (e.g. customer success workshop) and has experience in one or more industry segments such as Distribution, Consumer Goods, Retail. 

Your Responsibilities Include:

General:

  • Acts as an expert and evangelist in Infor Applications and Technology
  • Maintains up to date product and technical knowledge of the Infor portfolio and roadmap for an industry and/or horizontal solution set
  • Knowledge of one or more Industry sectors and is able to present solutions in an Industry context.
  • Ability to decompose large complex problems into manageable pieces allowing communication on both business and technical levels.
  • Skilled at presenting to C-level audiences focusing on demonstrating the business value of solutions rather than technical detail.
  • Knowledge and experience in the application of Infor architecture engagement processes and tools.
  • Knowledge of the important standards for business processes, information models and architectural models generally applied in an industry.
  • Maintains awareness of IT Industry architecture frameworks and approaches.
  • Maintains up to date knowledge of business drivers & typical customer needs within an industry.

Sales:

  • Designs, develops, documents and delivers solution architectures that meet client needs.
  • Leads architectural discussions with clients around proposed solutions.
  • Determines solution approach, identifies the critical path and defines an appropriate solution roadmap.
  • Builds and maintains effective relationships with customer throughout the sales lifecycle.
  • Ensures solution is practical and provides continuity in the implementation project.

Delivery:

  • Acts as the primary point of ownership with responsibility for functional solution.
  • Experience in delivery of complex cross-pillar solutions utilizing Infor products.
  • Challenges requirements to take advantage from the value-added provided by Infor solutions.
  • Manages changes to the solution architecture due to change requests.
  • Ensures that the different solution pieces built by different teams are consistent.
  • Actively ensures that design/development standards are upheld.

Knowledge and Skills, You Bring to the Organization:

  • Industry experience (Consume Goods, Retail, Distribution) process know how.
  • Knowledge of Infor M3 is highly desired, but not a must to have.
  • Implementation experience across all business process areas of Warehousing, Logistics, Procurement; or Manufacturing and Planning; or Customer Sales, Management; or Service and Rental.
  • Experience of several full project life-cycle implementations as Lead Consultant or Solution Architect.
  • Significant customer-facing consulting experience.
  • Reliability and deadline-driven approach.
  • Strong organizational skills & time management skills.
  • Strong oral and written communication that effectively articulates complex ideas.
  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team but also self-motivated.
  • Team player with the ability to build strong peer and interpersonal relationships.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytic skills.
  • Fluent in German language and English language is mandatory.
  • Willingness to travel.

description_html:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Compliance Operations Professional to oversee and manage activities, communications, and deliverables for Infor's FedRAMP service. This role is critical to ensuring our compliance with federal government regulations, involving documentation, data mining, and reporting processes. The ideal candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams to track and report on compliance status, ensuring that all deliverables meet the strict timeframes set by the federal government, and keep the various stakeholders informed. 

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Organize, Track, and ensure Delivery of Monthly Deliverables for multiple regulatory bodies.
  • Integrate and operate with Security in Continuous Monitoring functions.
  • Manage Plan of Action and Milestones to completion with Stakeholder updates from SVP to Engineering levels.

Required skills:

  • Experience in project management, with a demonstrated ability to manage timelines and deliverables in high-pressure environments.
  • Exposure to federal compliance frameworks, including FedRAMP, NIST, or other related standards.
  • Experience mining and interpreting data for decision-making and reporting purposes.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred skills:

  • Experience working in a SaaS company, technology company, or other related industry.
  • Familiarity with vulnerability management processes and tools specific to federal compliance requirements.
  • Ability to navigate the intricacies of working with government agencies and an understanding of the reporting and documentation required in the federal space.
US Remote (Dunwoody, GA or Dallas, Texas)

The Field Operations Business Manager, Associate reports directly to the Sales Operations Team Lead and provides support to the global license sales team. The responsibilities include Managing CRM System to ensure data accuracy and accessibility. Evaluate sales data to identify trends and provide insights that help improve sales strategies. Provide support to sales teams by streamlining processes and improving operational efficiency. You will collaborate across departments such as Business Development, Finance and Marketing to align strategies and optimize performance.

Required Skills
What You Will Need:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communication, Business, or Information Technology.
  • Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in a Sales Operations or Sales Support role.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
  • Strong knowledge of Excel functions, including PivotTables and VLOOKUP.
  • Good English communication skills verbal and written

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Exposure to CRM systems (Salesforce, Dynamics, or others) is preferred.

  • Opportunity Management and reporting using Salesforce and Domo dashboard.
  • Perform mass uploading of data for accounts, opportunities and contacts.

As part of Infor's continued growth in North America, we are expanding our team of experienced LN Functional Consultants. This role supports our mission to deliver effective financial solutions that help clients improve operational performance. The Senior Consultant will apply expertise in Infor LN and industry-specific finance implementations to support clients in sectors such as Automotive, Industrial Enterprise, Aerospace & Defense, and Engineering & Construction. Infor Consultants collaborate with clients to implement Infor software and industry-standard processes that enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and strengthen business collaboration.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Supporting clients in achieving measurable business benefits.

Infor is looking for a senior software engineer senior to join the Process Intelligence development team. Infor Process Intelligence’s Process Modeler is a cloud-based business process management solution designed to capture and design unique operational processes that can improve business efficiency by standardizing process models. Leveraging Infor’s unique shared platform, users can collaborate with key stakeholders to modify, improve, and create new business processes to maintain consistency and alignment across the organization. Built to support current business practices, Infor Process Modeler delivers company-wide visibility to operations that helps facilitate increased levels of efficiency and effectiveness.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

As a senior software engineer, you’re responsible for delivering high-quality software. You will work within a multidisciplinary agile development team in close collaboration with other skilled software engineers, QA engineers, architects and business analysts. You determine your daily tasks in coordination with these colleagues rather than waiting for work to be assigned to you. You will be involved in all aspects of software development and have room to grow professionally.

Required skills:
Profile:

Skills:

·       JavaScript/Typescript

·       CSS3

·       HTML5

·       Angular 18 or Angular 14+

·       Git

·       Modern frontend tooling (SASS, Gulp, Yarn)

·       Debugging skills

·       Performance optimization experience

description_html:
Job location: Germany, Austria - office or home based.

The Partner Sales Lead, Central Europe, is accountable for the execution of Infor’s ecosystem strategy, including recruitment, onboarding, development and management of Infor’s strategic partners who influence, sell, deliver and build-with Infor solutions.

The role requires an experienced leader with a player-coach mindset who will develop and manage a team of partner account managers across the DACH region. You will work cross-functionally with sales, marketing, product marketing, professional services, and enablement teams with the objective of accelerating growth and delivering successful customer outcomes through the Infor partner ecosystem.

A Day in the Life Includes:

  • Lead a direct team of partner account managers and business development managers to expand and activate business models with existing partners
  • Lead the identification, recruit and onboarding motion for new strategic partners, including commercial agreements
  • Develop and execute annual growth plans, including recruitment of new partners
  • Lead joint business planning and governance, driving revenue target and KPI alignment between the ecosystem and direct sales teams
  • In conjunction with sales, lead pipeline development and deliver forecast accuracy
  • Ensure partners are fully enabled, including achievement of sales authorizations and technical certifications
  • Lead regular business reviews with partners and Infor stakeholders to review progress and activate growth opportunities

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience leading a team of partner managers in enterprise SaaS/cloud-based solutions
  • Experience working in a role with Ecosystem Partners, relevant industry (including micro verticals) and software/products in a business development/lead generation role
  • Experience establishing and nurturing strategic partner relationships, including leading development and negotiations of commercial agreements
  • Experience building and scaling partner ecosystems in a SaaS or enterprise tech environment
  • Experience collaborating and building cross-functional support for partners with sales, marketing and enablement teams. Experience assisting with onboarding of new partners
  • Experience with executive communication including delivering presentations.
  • Fluent German (native speaker level) and English
  • Travel requirements: 60%

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Saas / Cloud / ERP sales experience, with a focus on indirect GTM models

description_html:
As an HR Administrator, you will join a committed team focused on transforming our work processes and enhancing the experience of both employees and internal stakeholders. In this role, you will act as a subject matter expert on HR processes, collaborating with various internal teams to address their needs and challenges. You will identify opportunities to automate and streamline operations, quickly gaining an understanding of diverse HR processes to become a proactive thought partner and expert in the field.
We currently have multiple openings, and we are looking for candidates who will support one of the following regions: Southern Europe, Nordics, MEA or Benelux.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:
  • Managing the HR inbox and redirecting queries to relevant local HR colleagues when needed
  • Maintaining accurate employee records in the HR system, including updates to employment terms and ensuring relevant teams are informed
  • Managing the full employee lifecycle (hire‑to‑retire) for your assigned region
  • Ensuring accuracy and timeliness of payroll-related data
  • Creating and updating regional process guides regularly
  • Preparing standard and ad‑hoc reports as required
  • Providing backup support for other regions within the HR SSC team
  • Supporting standardization and automation initiatives across HR processes in multiple countries
  • Initiating and implementing process improvements and automation solutions
  • Participating in projects aimed at improving efficiency and work quality

Basic Qualifications:
  • Previous experience in Payroll, HR, or Administration
  • Willingness to learn and develop in HR and payroll topics
  • Ability to adapt to a rapidly evolving environment
  • Very good command of written and spoken English
  • Strong computer literacy (including Microsoft Office)
  • A team-oriented mindset with strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to manage workload independently and balance competing priorities

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience working in an HR Shared Services environment is an advantage
  • Knowledge of additional European languages — Spanish, Italian, and/or French — will be considered a strong plus

description_html:
The Senior HR Business Partner serves as a trusted advisor to senior functional leadership, shaping global HR strategies and driving transformation initiatives across multiple countries. This role provides thought leadership on organizational design, talent strategy, and change management, ensuring alignment with Koch’s PBM principles and global priorities. The Senior HRBP leads cross-country HR initiatives and mentors other HRBPs to build organizational capability.


Key Responsibilities

Strategic Leadership

  • Define and influence global HR priorities for the function in partnership with senior leadership.
  • Lead strategic workforce planning and talent pipeline development across regions.
  • Represent HR in global functional leadership forums and decision-making processes.
  • Drive integration of HR technology and analytics for data-driven decision-making.

Functional & Country Oversight

  • Provide oversight for HR operations across multiple countries, ensuring compliance and consistency.
  • Serve as escalation point for complex employee relations and compliance issues.
  • Manage Works Council (CSE) relations, organize meetings, and ensure compliance with legal obligations.
  • Monitor global HR metrics and deliver insights to inform leadership decisions.

Transformation & Capability Building

  • Lead organizational design and change management initiatives to support business transformation.
  • Mentor and coach HRBPs to strengthen functional HR capability.
  • Champion continuous improvement in HR processes, systems, and employee experience.


Qualifications & Experience

  • Extensive HR experience in senior business partner roles within multinational, matrix environments.
  • Expertise in strategic HR disciplines, organizational design, and global compliance.
  • Proven ability to influence senior leaders and manage complex stakeholder relationships.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with HRIS platforms (Infor HCM preferred).
  • Fluency in English and French; additional languages a plus.


PBM Alignment

  • Creating Value: Shape global HR strategies that drive sustainable growth.
  • Principled Entrepreneurship: Provide strategic counsel with integrity and transparency.
  • Knowledge Processes: Leverage global data insights for informed decision-making.
  • Decision Rights: Enable senior leaders to make impactful decisions through HR partnership.
  • Incentives: Design programs that align global priorities with business outcomes.

Job Title: HR Shared Services Representative I

Experience Level: 2+ years
Location: Hyderabad
Reporting To: Team Lead, HR Shared Services

Role Overview

The HR Shared Services Representative I is responsible for delivering high-quality support and services to employees and managers across various HR processes. This role ensures accurate and timely handling of HR transactions, inquiries, and documentation while maintaining compliance with company policies and legal requirements.

Key Responsibilities

  • Serve as the first point of contact for employee HR inquiries via ticketing system.
  • Process HR transactions related to onboarding, offboarding, benefits, payroll, and employee data changes.
  • Maintain accurate employee records in HR systems (HCM)
  • Ensure compliance with company policies, labour laws, and data privacy regulations.
  • Collaborate with HR business partners and other stakeholders to resolve complex issues.
  • Generate and review HR reports for accuracy and completeness.
  • Support continuous improvement initiatives within HR Shared Services.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree preferably in Business Administration, or related field.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in HR operations, shared services, or similar role.
  • Strong knowledge of HR processes and systems.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
  • Proficiency in MS Office and HRIS platforms.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience with HR ticketing systems and case management tools.
  • Familiarity with global HR practices and compliance requirements.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

description_html:
The Infor HR Business Partner (HRBP) acts as a strategic partner to functional leadership and provides oversight for HR operations within one or more countries. This role drives business success by integrating Koch’s Principle Based Management (PBM) principles into people strategies and delivering tailored HR solutions that support functional goals and local compliance. The HRBP balances deep understanding of the global functional HR agenda with responsiveness to country-specific needs, ensuring alignment with Koch’s culture and capabilities.


Key Responsibilities

Functional HR Partnership

  • Collaborate closely with functional leaders to understand business strategy, workforce needs, and culture.
  • Provide expert HR advice on talent acquisition, workforce planning, organizational design, and succession planning.
  • Drive performance management processes that enable continuous feedback, development, and alignment with business goals.
  • Lead initiatives on learning and development aligned to functional capability gaps and growth plans.
  • Facilitate change management efforts within the function to support transformation and operational efficiency.


Country Oversight

  • Oversee HR practices and compliance in assigned countries, ensuring adherence to local labor laws and regulations.
  • Partner with local HR Advisors to ensure consistent application of global HR policies with local adaptation when required.
  • Support employee relations and engagement efforts within country operations, fostering a positive, inclusive work environment.
  • Coordinate with legal and compliance teams to mitigate risks related to employment regulations and workforce changes.
  • Monitor and analyze HR metrics at the country level, providing insights to functional leaders and global HR.
  • Responsibilities related to the Works Council (CSE):
  • Manage and maintain strong relations with the CSE and employee representatives.
  • Organize and co-lead meetings together with the CSE President, ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory obligations.
  • Negotiate and implement collective agreements with social partners while fostering a constructive social climate.
  • Prepare mandatory reports and documentation.


Strategic Influence & Collaboration

  • · Act as a key liaison between global HR Centers of Excellence and country operational teams to drive integrated HR services.
  • · Champion Koch’s PBM principles by promoting principled entrepreneurship, decision rights, and value creation through people.
  • · Continuously identify opportunities to improve HR processes, systems (including Infor HCM), and employee experience, in conjunction with the HRSS team
  • · Support communication and deployment of HR initiatives at the functional and country levels.


Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, or related field; advanced degree or HR certification preferred.
  • Strong experience of progressive HR experience in a business partner or advisory role, ideally within a multinational, matrix environment.
  • Strong knowledge of functional HR disciplines and local labor laws in relevant countries.
  • Proven ability to influence and build trusted relationships with leaders, CSE members and employees at all levels.
  • Experience with HRIS platforms, preferably Infor HCM, and data-driven HR decision making.
  • Excellent communication, coaching, and project management skills.
  • Fluency in English and French.


Alignment with Koch’s Principle-Based Management (PBM) Philosophy

The Infor HR Business Partner advances Koch’s PBM framework by:

  • Creating Value: Partnering with leaders to develop people strategies that enhance organizational performance and sustainable growth.
  • Principled Entrepreneurship: Acting with integrity, transparency, and accountability in all HR interactions and decisions.
  • Knowledge Processes: Using data analytics and insights to inform talent and organizational decisions that best serve the market and company.
  • Decision Rights: Empowering managers and employees with the right information, autonomy, and support to take ownership of their roles.
  • Incentives: Designing and supporting incentive programs that align individual and team goals with Koch’s values and business outcomes.

Consultant 
The Infor Consulting Services Organization is looking for a Consultant to join our team supporting clients across the UK and Europe.

Using your experience in consulting and/or consumer goods, you’ll bring thought leadership and client understanding to solve complex and strategic issues. You’ll work on a variety of projects ranging from complex data analysis to software implementations, and play a key role in driving change management.

As a Consultant, you’ll collaborate closely with our development and consulting teams to implement software solutions and deliver strategic consulting services. You’ll work with cross-functional colleagues and clients to design and deliver solutions that address complex business challenges, combining technical implementation with business strategy.


A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Acting as an expert and advocate for Infor applications and technology
  • Providing consultative guidance and technical assistance to users, following Infor’s implementation methodology
  • Decomposing complex problems into manageable pieces and communicating effectively with both business and technical stakeholders
  • Presenting to senior audiences, focusing on business value and solution impact
  • Designing, developing, documenting, and delivering solution architectures that meet client needs
  • Building and maintaining effective relationships with customers throughout the project lifecycle
  • Ensuring design and development standards are upheld
  • Supporting onboarding and training for new team members, emphasizing on-the-job learning and early responsibility

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in consulting, commercial roles for consumer brands, or relevant technical fields
  • Experience with building integration flows between applications and data preparation workflows
  • Proficiency in analytics tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Birst, and Infor ION
  • Ability to handle large data sets and deliver visualizations and insights
  • Strong customer-facing consulting experience
  • Reliability and deadline-driven approach
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Team player with strong peer and interpersonal relationship skills
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytic skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Databricks, Data Factory, Logic Apps, or similar technologies
  • Background in consumer goods or strategy consulting
  • Exposure to both data engineering and analytics (candidates with both may be rare, but either is valuable)

description_html:
The Senior Consultant is responsible for implementing Customer Order Management (COM) functions on Infor Consulting Services M3 implementation projects. This is a billable consulting role that plays a key role in project execution. Infor Consultants collaborate with clients to implement Infor software and recognized industry solutions, focusing on cost management, customer service improvement, and business process optimization. The job holder will provide business process and application consulting services, including process design, application configuration, testing, and client training on Infor software, technologies, and tools.


A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Assist in the realization of business benefits for clients.
  • Participate in full life cycle client-facing implementation projects relating to Infor applications, working as part of an Infor Project team.
  • Lead the information gathering and design process for a client implementation, including the development of functional business requirements and solution scope documents.
  • Develop and execute test plans and test software configurations.
  • Provide training to client’s key and end users.
  • Provide implementation consultancy and application best practice advice.
  • Provide regular internal reports on the status of projects.


Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in Sales Order Management business processes within an ERP system, which may include: Pricing strategies, Costing models, Bonus/Commission structures, Discount management, Supplier Rebates, Quotation management, Trade Agreements, and Sourcing Rules.
  • Experience in multiple ERP implementation projects, with focus on Customer Order Management and/or Sales Order Management.
  • Experience in ERP implementations with direct client interaction, including facilitating client workshops.
  • Experience in the following industry segments: Food & Beverage, Distribution, or Manufacturing, with hands-on ERP configuration and process optimization.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or sponsorship now or in the future.
  • Ability to travel up to 75% throughout North America (US and Canada), based on project needs.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with Infor M3 Sales Order Management Modules including Integration with Credit Card processors.
  • Knowledge of Order to Cash, Infor Sales hub and Customer Lifecycle Management processes in Infor M3.
  • Experience with Infor OS and Various Customer Order Management Integrations. (Cenpos/EDI/GoSimple/Salesforce)


Remote (Dallas, TX, Alpharetta, GA)

description_html:
Join Infor as an Industry Solution Architect and help shape the future of enterprise innovation.

We’re looking for a visionary Industry Solution Architect with deep domain expertise in the Food and Beverages industry. By leveraging industry best practices, you will address customers unique needs and goals, enabling them to stay ahead of the curve and drive competitive advantage in today's rapidly evolving digital landscape.

As an Industry Solution Architect, you will play a pivotal role in helping our Food & Beverages customers to manage their critical business processes and drive innovation. In this strategic role, you will not be hands-on in solution implementation—instead, you will serve as an industry expert, guiding our customers with insight, foresight, and thought leadership.

As a Trusted Advisor, your mission is to help clients navigate the future by identifying the innovations, capabilities, and strategies that will deliver long-term business value. You will collaborate closely with Infor’s product experts and implementation teams, who drive ERP deployment success, while you focus on shaping industry-specific roadmaps, enabling business transformation, and ensuring alignment with Infor’s innovative technologies and cloud platform.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Act as a strategic advisor to customers in the Food & Beverages sector, with a deep understanding of their industry challenges, regulatory environments, and market trends.
  • Define and communicate end-to-end solution visions—combining business strategy, technology innovation, and best practices.
  • Collaborate closely with Infor’s delivery team to ensure alignment between business goals and ERP delivery.
  • Lead customer-facing workshops and executive briefings to map out strategic transformation journeys.
  • Present and articulate how Infor’s industry cloud solutions support innovation, sustainability, and scalability.
  • Contribute to internal and external thought leadership—through whitepapers, webinars, and industry events.

What You Bring

  • Proven expertise within the Food & Beverages industry with the ability to develop and drive innovative solutions for our customers.
  • Solid experience in solution architecture, business consulting, or enterprise advisory roles.
  • Understanding of ERP and digital transformation within your assigned industry.
  • Ability to engage confidently with senior stakeholders, from operational managers to C-level decision makers.
  • Passion for helping businesses innovate and adapt through modern technology.
  • Excellent communication and storytelling skills.
  • Fluency in English and Swedish language-speaking and writing.
