Position Summary

Plan, organize, write online help, user, installation, and release-related documentation for business software that is correct and written to standards within the timeline defined for a project. The information developer works closely with development teams. The scope of external communication is limited. Has to operate under general supervision; typically reports to a Manager of Information Development.

Essential Duties

• Demonstrates technical writing expertise by writing and publishing help text, user manuals, installation instructions, and release notes.
• Researches and gathers information; interprets software business and organizes and writes content for documentation projects.
• Provides key content that enables the user to understand functionality and perform processes effectively; avoids writing intuitive, repetitive and unnecessary content.
• Creates, tests, and troubleshoots online help for assigned software applications.
• Delivers quality documents with minimal errors; edits materials for clarity, organization, and adherence to standards.
• Takes an active role in projects, presents ideas in a constructive manner, demonstrates openness and builds on the ideas of others.
• Works with business, quality and programmer analysts to ensure appropriate UI content and design.
• Plans projects and schedules, balances multiple projects, and follows through on project deadlines.

• Assists other writers with writing, tools, technical and standards issues.

• Bachelor’s degree in technical writing, business, or computer science or the equivalent level of technical training and work experience.

• Demonstrates excellent English language usage and writing skills.

• Familiarity with markup languages and proven experience with an authoring tool such as XMetaL Author, Arbortext Epic, the Adobe Technical Communications Suite, Madcap Flare, or Dreamweaver.

Preferred Qualifications

• Industry specific knowledge or experience
• Excellent interpersonal skills; works well with team members at all levels of the organization.
• Manages time effectively resulting in maximum overall efficiency.
• Resourceful and creative in devising processes and solutions.

The Inside Sales Representative plays a key role in achieving our ambitious revenue growth objectives. This role suits someone who enjoys building relationships, creating value-driven conversations, and progressing opportunities over time.
You will engage with customers through a mix of thoughtful outbound calls and personalized digital outreach, use modern forecasting and CRM tools, collaborate closely with internal teams and partners, and help guide opportunities from early interest through to close across our emerging markets.
We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds and strongly encourage women and underrepresented groups to apply.

A Day in the Life of an Inside Sales Representative
  • Build and execute territory plans and account strategies for key accounts using programmatic campaigns and other strategic approaches
  • Own monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets within assigned markets
  • Develop trusted relationships within Infor’s installed customer base to create, manage, and close sales opportunities
  • Learn and clearly articulate the value of Infor’s business solutions, tailoring messaging to customer needs

description_html:
An Inside Sales Representative is responsible for managing the full sales cycle, from lead qualification to close, for a portfolio of strategic accounts. Working collaboratively with field sales, marketing, and customer success teams, this role drives pipeline growth, builds strong customer relationships, and supports revenue attainment through proactive and consultative engagement.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
•Qualify and manage inbound and outbound sales leads.
•Identify customer needs and propose relevant Infor solutions.
•Conduct product presentations and virtual demos.
•Manage and maintain a sales pipeline in CRM (Salesforce).
•Achieve and exceed quarterly sales quotas and KPIs.
•Partner with Account Executives to develop and execute territory plans.
•Provide timely, accurate forecasts and updates to sales leadership.
•Stay current on Infor’s product portfolio and industry trends.

Basic Qualifications
•B2B inside sales experience, preferably in Cloud / SaaS / ERP or enterprise software.
•Experience achieving or exceeding quota consistently.
•Experience presenting and negotiation.
•Experience with CRM tools (Salesforce preferred) and sales engagement platforms.

Preferred Qualifications
•Experience selling to mid-market or enterprise clients

description_html:
The Senior Learning Designer drives the rapid development of high-quality learning assets to meet learners when and where needed, and thrives in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. This role requires excellence in producing technical educational content efficiently using templates and modern tools, including AI-powered technologies. The role requires strong informal leadership, exceptional project management skills, and a relentless focus on fast, scalable course construction.

This is a hybrid position based in the Infor Hyderabad office with no travel required.

Day in the Life

  • Lead rapid construction of learning assets using standardized templates and course authoring tools (e.g., Articulate Rise, Storyline).
  • Manage multiple instructional design projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery against tight deadlines and high-volume targets.
  • Fully utilize AI-assisted tools to accelerate course production and maintain quality standards.
  • Drive collaboration and communication with Subject Matter Experts, ensuring timely completion of deliverables to meet established deadlines.
  • Foster team engagement through informal leadership, including mentoring peers, sharing best practices, and driving continuous improvements.
  • Track and report project progress using Jira, proactively identifying risks and implementing solutions.
  • Ensure all content meets internal standards and quality benchmarks through rigorous review and feedback.
  • Adapt quickly to evolving tools and methodologies, continuously enhancing skills to support rapid development needs.

Required Skills

  • Mastery of English (spoken and written), with proficiency validated by a standard written exam.
  • Extensive experience in instructional design, emphasizing rapid course development.
  • Advanced proficiency with course authoring tools, especially Articulate Rise and Storyline.
  • Experience with course development templates and AI-powered content creation tools, such as Microsoft Copilot and Articulate AI Assistant.
  • Proven track record of success in technical software training content development.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects under aggressive timelines while maintaining quality.
  • Commitment to meeting established development metrics with fast turnaround times while also driving toward aspirational targets.
  • Strong informal leadership and mentoring skills demonstrated through experience leading complex projects or teams.
  • Excellent time management, organizational skills, and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Flexibility to collaborate during US business hours within a global team.
  • Must earn designated product certification within one year of hire.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Education, or related field.
  • 6+ years of relevant experience in high-volume, fast-paced instructional design environments.
  • Expertise in integrating GenAI or AI-assisted tools for rapid course creation.
  • Experience building AI agents that improve efficiency.
  • Familiarity with video/audio development tools (e.g., Camtasia).
  • Experience using Jira or similar project management tools for tracking and reporting.

Are you a seasoned integration expert ready to take your career to the next level? Do you thrive at the intersection of technology, strategy, people, business processes and innovation? If you’re passionate about building smart, scalable, and future-proof integration solutions — this is your opportunity to make an impact.

📍 Location: Linköping or Stockholm

🕒 Type: Full-time

📅 Start Date: Flexible / As agreed


🌟 What You’ll Do

As an Integration Architect, you’ll be the go-to expert guiding clients through the full integration journey — from vision to execution. You’ll design modern architectures, develop seamless integrations, and bring systems and people together.

You’ll collaborate with Swedish and international clients across diverse industries, gaining exposure to different business landscapes and the latest Infor enterprise technologies. Beyond projects, you’ll also shape our internal integration work, processes, mentor others, and share your knowledge to help drive innovation across the organization.

description_html:
Infor is looking for a talented Integration Specialist to join our India Infor SunSystems development team as we build momentum for our Multi-Tenant cloud solution. SunSystems is a well-established financial management solution with a depth of functionality that attracts thousands of B2B customers in multiple verticals around the globe. The solution is combined with real time analytics and is tightly integrated into Infor’s Technology platform.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:


  • Understanding customer and channel partner use-cases for the product, and coming up with creative ways to deliver against these use cases, making use of the extensive range of technical options available through the product, the InforOS platform and third party tools.
  • Developing new software integrations, workflows, automations and UX enhancements to bring additional functionality and capability to our product offering, working alongside product owner / business analyst, developers, QA, scrummaster.
  • Using our extensive range of APIs, and working with the development teams when enhancements or extensions of the API capability is required for integrations and workflows to use.
  • Investigating customer-reported issues and improvement requests to resolve in a timely and effective manner.
  • Working closely with the other team members in our “front end” experiences team, and with the back end teams responsible for API creation and maintenance.
  • Working closely with InforOS platform teams to learn the capabilities of InforOS and creatively apply these capabilities to the benefit of the product and customers.
  • Supporting product owner in understanding complexity of work, identifying constraints and dependencies and in estimating delivery timescales.

Basic Qualifications

  • Strong skills in Python software development, with in-depth understanding of the language and experience of typical software engineering tools (config & source control systems, CI/CD, tracking systems, e.g. Jira, wiki tools, e.g. Confluence)
  • Ability to deliver customer solutions by providing efficient, scalable solutions using pre-existing technology platforms and scriptable data pipelines
  • Strong experience working with REST and GraphQL APIs
  • Experience with integration / data transformation languages, such as JSON, JSONPath, JQ, JSONL / NDJSON, XML, XPath, XPointer, XLink, XSLT
  • Experience with OS scripting, PowerShell and/or Bash
  • Experience building integrations, establishing and working with data flows between systems.  
  • Experience working in an Agile (pref. Scrum)  and iterative development approach.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
  • Enthusiasm and ability to collaborate well with others, including remote teams
  • Professional pride, drive and curiosity, a diligent self-starter that keeps up to date with best practise and keeps your skillset sharp.
  • Solid problem resolution skills

description_html:
The IT Support Engineer, Associate will be part of the Infor Global Sales team, responsible for delivering exceptional support across team's process and tools, support with testing, tool maintenance in terms of clauses library, procedures, processes, documentation, triage, and ticketing system.

Required Skills
What You Will Need:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).
  • 1-3 years of Quality Assurance/Testing, Business Process Improvement, or Application Support experience.
  • Ability to support and maintain and update tools, systems, and libraries (e.g., clauses library, templates, knowledge base)
  • Attention to detail to ensure accuracy of configurations, data, and documentation
  • Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and work effectively with cross-functional teams.

What Will Put You Ahead?
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience supporting ICertis CLM or other CLM tools.
  • Experience with SharePoint Online (off-prem) page/site creation.
  • Exposure to CRM systems (Salesforce, Dynamics, or others) is preferred.
  • Experience supporting Infor CPQ or equivalent.
  • Basic to intermediate SQL skills for troubleshooting and reporting.

A Day In The Life Typically Includes
  • Provide end-user support across enterprise applications, ensuring timely resolution of incidents and service requests.
  • Support with testing and tool maintenance
  • Create, maintain, and enhance SharePoint Online (off-prem) pages/sites for business collaboration.
  • Collaborate with IT Support to administer CLM solutions (e.g., ICertis or similar platforms), including user access, workflows, and incident troubleshooting.
  • Collaborate with IT support for CPQ applications (Infor CPQ or other solutions), assisting business teams in quoting and configuration processes.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders and IT teams to resolve functional and technical issues.
  • Perform SQL queries for troubleshooting, data validation, and reporting purposes.
  • Document issues, solutions, and contribute to a growing knowledge base.
  • Collaborate with IT Project Team in application testing, user training, and enhancements.

description_html:
Summary:

We are seeking an experienced IT Support Specialist – Associate to provide high-quality end-user support, hardware troubleshooting, and application assistance across Windows, Linux, and macOS platforms. The ideal candidate will also manage AV operations, support hybrid workforce environments, and work closely with internal teams and vendors to ensure seamless IT service delivery.


Key Responsibilities:

End-User & IT Support

  • Provide Level 2/3 support for laptops (hardware diagnostics, replacements, vendor coordination).
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues across Windows 10/11, Linux (Ubuntu), and macOS.
  • Support internal and SaaS-based applications, including email, VPNs, printers, and network connectivity.
  • Utilize and manage IT ticketing systems to track incidents and service requests.
  • Ensure timely resolution of issues within defined SLAs.
  • Assist with user onboarding/offboarding and IT asset lifecycle (deployment, refresh, return).
  • Maintain accurate documentation, SOPs, and troubleshooting playbooks.

Audio-Visual (AV) Support

  • Set up, operate, and troubleshoot AV equipment for meetings and events.
  • Support audio systems, microphones, and video conferencing solutions.
  • Ensure flawless AV execution for in-person and virtual events.

Collaboration & Vendor Management

  • Work closely with IT Infrastructure, AV, Security, and Facilities teams on cross-functional tasks.
  • Coordinate with third-party vendors for warranty claims and service fulfillment.


Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree (B.Sc., B.Tech.) or diploma in Computer Science, Electronics, AV, or related fields
  • 2–4 years of hands-on IT support experience across multi-OS environments.
  • Proficient in troubleshooting Windows, macOS, and Linux (Ubuntu).
  • Experience in laptop diagnostics, repairs, and handling warranties (Dell, HP).
  • Familiar with Active Directory, remote support tools, and endpoint security practices.
  • Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Customer-first mindset with strong problem-solving abilities.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certifications: CompTIA A+/N+, Microsoft (MCSA/MCP), Apple ACSP, ITIL Foundation.
  • Experience supporting hybrid (remote + in-office) workforce environments.
  • Knowledge of scripting (PowerShell, Bash, or Python) for automation.
  • Familiarity with ITIL processes and asset management tools.
  • Exposure to Windows Server, Office 365, Adobe, and general enterprise applications.

Functieomschrijving

Door de voortdurende groei van onze ontwikkelingsactiviteiten is ons Infor LN Development Team op zoek naar een enthousiaste software engineer in Technology. Samen met een multidisciplinair team van ervaren collega’s ontwikkel je de LN Studio, waarmee Infor LN-producten worden ontwikkeld, terwijl je altijd de visie van de klant in het oog houdt. Gebruiksvriendelijkheid en kwaliteit van het product staan altijd centraal. Je bent betrokken bij alle aspecten van het ontwikkelingsproces en krijgt ruimte om je professioneel te ontwikkelen. De werklocatie is Barneveld, waar je samenwerkt met zowel junior als ervaren collega’s.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

· Ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van hoogwaardige software voor LN Technology

· Uitvoeren van validatie- en verificatietests

· Ontwikkeling van geautomatiseerde tests

· Onderhoud van bestaande versies en releases ter ondersteuning van klanten

· Samenwerken met collega’s zoals Business Analysts, Product Architects en andere Software Engineers

Jouw kennis en vaardigheden

· Je hebt sterke analytische vaardigheden en een duidelijke focus op kwaliteit

· Je hebt kennis van Java/Eclipse

· Je staat open om andere programmeertalen te leren

· Je bent afgestudeerd aan een HBO of Universiteit

· Je spreekt vloeiend Engels, Nederlands spreken is zeer welkom

Wat wij jou bieden

· Mogelijkheid om te werken voor een van de grootste Enterprise softwarebedrijven

· Een vaste werkplek in Barneveld

· Fijne samenwerking met ervaren collega’s

· Doorgroeimogelijkheden naar andere functies binnen Infor

· Marktconforme arbeidsvoorwaarden


Position Summary

As a result of the continued growth of our Development activities, our Infor LN Development Team is looking for an enthusiastic software engineer in Technology. Together with a multidisciplinary team of skilled colleagues, you will develop the LN Studio used to develop Infor LN products, whilst never losing sight of the customers’ vision. The usability and quality of the product is always vital. You will be involved in all aspects of the development process and have room to grow professionally. The work location will be in Barneveld where you will collaborate with junior and experienced colleagues.

Your Responsibilities Include

description_html:
Infor Workforce Management (WFM) is a world-class enterprise application providing comprehensive solutions for workforce planning, execution, and analysis. Built on a proven technology platform, we serve a global customer base and continue to innovate to solve tomorrow's workforce challenges. We use industry best practices: code reviews, pair programming, TDD, BDD, and continuous integration. Quality matters - we write code we're proud of.

Why We're Hiring

Our product is expanding globally, and we're growing our development teams in Poland. This is a new position - we hire multiple developers throughout the year as part of our ongoing growth.

Our Tech Journey

We're actively modernizing a mature enterprise application, which means you'll gain experience across both legacy and modern technologies. Our backend was originally built in Java, but today Kotlin is our first choice for new service-oriented code. On the frontend, we're transitioning from JSP pages with JavaScript and jQuery to Angular. You'll work on maintaining critical existing systems while building their modern replacements - a balance that offers variety and real-world refactoring experience.

What You'll Do
  • Develop new features for web and mobile applications
  • Work in a small, cross-functional Scrum team with real autonomy
  • Collaborate directly with designers and product owners
  • Write unit and integration tests (JUnit, Mockito, Cucumber)
  • Participate in code reviews and pair programming
  • Contribute to our modernization efforts
What You'll Need
  • Java experience with solid understanding of object-oriented programming principles
  • Ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code
  • Basic understanding of JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS
  • Familiarity with SQL and relational databases (Oracle, Postgres, MySQL, or DB2)
  • Eagerness to learn and grow (Kotlin, Angular, and modern practices)
  • Proficient English (spoken and written)
Nice to have
  • Kotlin or Angular development
  • Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
  • TDD practices and testing frameworks
  • Agile/Scrum methodology
  • Application servers (WebLogic, Wildfly)
  • Build tools (Maven, Ant, Git, SonarQube)

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Junior Full Stack Java Developer to join our growing Workforce Management organization. Infor Workforce Management is a powerful scheduling solution that focuses on employee scheduling, and time and attendance tracking, serving a Fortune 500 client portfolio.

You would be joining a dynamic, fast-paced, cross-functional team composed of business analysts, developers, architects, product owners and quality assurance analysts delivering a portfolio of world-class products. description_html:
Infor is looking for an experienced Team Leader to join the Infor Data Fabric development team. The Infor Data Fabric is a cloud data storage and query platform which provides capabilities to store petabytes of data and subsequent rapid query and analytics capabilities. Infor Data Fabric platform is tightly integrated with Infor Data Lake, consuming big data from all of Infor’s business applications, especially ERP systems. Data Fabric stores, queries, extracts, and keeps cloud data secure for thousands of customers in real-time. You will be involved in all aspects of software development and have room to grow professionally.

Required skills:

Experience : 7-10 Years

Looking for candidate who has experience in leading a team.

· Extensive Java development experience and demonstrable understanding of Spring framework.

· Experience with Web Services development (RESTful APIs, SaaS).

· Considers and treats unit-testing as an intrinsic part of development.

· Experience with Java development tooling (Java 17+ SDK, Git, Maven, Gradle).

· Experience with contemporary SDLC – Git Flow, merge requests, code review, CICD.

Preferred Qualifications:

· AWS cloud services (DynamoDB, KMS, OpenSearch, Kinesis, S3, SQS, Aurora, and others)

· SQL, GraphQL, Kotlin, Scala, Python

· SOLID programming, pair programming

· Kubernetes deployment, Docker images, AWS CLI

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

As a team leader, you’re responsible for guiding your team in delivering high-quality software. You will work within a multidisciplinary agile development team, collaborating closely with other software engineers, QA engineers, architects, and business analysts. You will help define tasks and priorities, ensuring that your team has clear direction and support, rather than just waiting for tasks to be assigned.

In this role, you will be accountable for both your deliverables and the overall success of the team. You will foster collaboration and communication within the team, encouraging knowledge sharing and growth while also taking an active role in mentoring and supporting your colleagues.

description_html:
Business Development Manager

Responsibilities  

  • Demand Funnel Ambassador: understands each stage of the funnel, the connection to profitability and economic thinking (review regularly with direct reports), The demand funnel is at the core of the communication with internal stakeholders (Field & Marketing)
  • Talent retention & Development:  Continued focus on developing career path options and adhering to internal best practices to allow teams to self-actualize in this role & beyond
  • Coach: Focus on developing individual growth by analyzing skills strength and weaknesses, Managing: Weekly reporting / visibility into KPI attainment and effectiveness by individual
  • Communication:  owns communication with internal stakeholders, highlighting team's work on regular basis; Drive collaboration within and outside of the team
  • Collaboration: Engaging the Wheel, Work with global BDR org, Strengthen BDR and AE relationships, consistent feedback loop

Expectations

  • Demand Funnel Ambassador: Advanced knowledge and team execution on advanced prospecting and Business Development pillars, Driving toward Demand Gen Targets, Achieve pipeline and revenue targets 
  • Talent retention & Development:  Monitor attrition, develop backfill plans, adopt a PBM mindset when hiring, consistent recruiting/ onboarding
  • Coach: Leverage tech stack and internal resources, maintain blueprint conversations, help team achieve their quota, grow leadership pipeline
  • Communication:  Touching base with Sales directors, monthly demand gen reviews, weekly meetings with marketing, Updates to senior leadership, celebrating success
  • Collaboration: Identifies eco system based on territory or focus industry. Knows who is the best resource to help and how to leverage and improve existing resources. Takes an active approach to collaboration, does not wait to be asked. Proactively shares knowledge


A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Lead a team of Business Development Representatives across ASEAN and India territories
  • Hire, ramp up and continuously grow talent and sales readiness. We build pipeline by growing our people. Provide a positive and constructive talent development structure to the Team – deliver feedback on the spot, offer a defined and consistent 1:1 structure and personal development check-ins
  • Own Go-To-Market execution through inbound lead qualification and outbound prospecting
  • Hands on coaching and shadowing on advanced prospecting methodology, including multi-channel, prospecting sequence, account mapping & inbound lead management
  • Advanced understanding of the marketing vehicles and tactics that contribute to build a pipeline that moves, up to the won stage
  • Key contributor in elevating best practices at a global level – leading cross regional initiatives as well as BDR led programs. Ability to operationalize, roll out and measure/track results in a matrix organization
  • Key stakeholder in the BDR/Sales/Marketing alignment – own consistent communication & reporting cadence
  • Advanced use of the prospecting technology stack is a must. Comfortable in leveraging prospecting data as leading indicators of the Rep performance and effectiveness
Workplace Fairness and Non-Discrimination Commitment

Infor is committed to fostering a fair and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, religion, nationality, gender, age, marital status, language, pregnancy status, caregiving responsibilities, disability, mental health condition, or any other characteristic protected under applicable laws, including the Workplace Fairness Legislation. All employment decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and business needs.

Data Migration & Mastering Manager, you will lead a team of consultants and oversee the delivery of strategic data initiatives across the organization.   • Excellent organizational, leadership, and communication skills.

description_html:
Infor is seeking a Talent Manager to join our GPS organization in Japan. The Talent Manager reports to the Director of Consulting Practice and manages a team of consultants with the main focus on people management and ongoing projects. The Talent Manager communicates with consultants to design Roles, Responsibilities and  Expectations (REE) based on PBM and individual career plan. The Talent Manager also monitors performance of each consultant to improve KPI and support achievable plan. The Talent Manager periodically communicate with each consultant to assess performance with feedback.

The principal KPI’s are GPS revenue, margin & customer satisfaction and employee satisfaction. The Consulting Manager works closely with the Project Managers, Client Partners, Account Executive, Competency Centers and with Resource Planning.

Your Responsibilities Include:

·       Manage a team of Consultants and Developers with responsibility for team utilization, recruitment, retention, performance evaluation, competence development, coaching and team building.

·       Assure high customer satisfaction by providing high quality in services and product delivery.

·       Support Sales by providing subject matter experts for sales opportunities.

·       Hire, on-board and develop graduate recruits (young professionals).

·       Drive knowledge exchange processes within both the team & across Services organization.

·       Oversee Subject Matter Experts and Technical Solution Architects.

·       Actively contribute to and establish business developments plans with the assigned region.

·       Serve as escalation point for Consultant issues and concerns.

·       Work closely with Regional Management, PM’s, Client Partners, Account Executive, Competency Center, Near- and Offshore Centers on capacity planning, resourcing requirements for major projects & resource competence development plans.

·       Work closely with Resource Planning on scheduling & optimization of resources and staffing of projects.

·       Be a spokesperson internally and externally to support development and growth of the assigned region.

·       Manage internal communication to employees.

Knowledge and Skills, you must bring to the organization:

·       More than 15 years of ERP or relevant business application implementation experience

·       More than 10 years of experience in the Food and Beverage related industries

·       Experience of team management including project-basis

·       Business development and sales support experience

·       Services delivery experience and strong track record of overachievement on targets

·       Proven ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly changing environment.

·       Proven ability to develop and maintain effective internal and external business relationships with various levels of management

·       Experience working with, and or coordinating the efforts of multiple parties

·       Knowledge of applicable industry terminology and practices, esp. ERP-Software, Security and Transformation programs

·       Ability to manage utilization & revenue forecast and reflect a true position

·       Excellent communication, presentation, organizational and planning skills

·       Excellent understanding of Japanese and English (communication and writing)

·       Excellent interpersonal skills to work as a team member

·       Professional appearance and presentation

·       Experience of successful implementation of large-scale software implementation projects

Other:

·       Ability to travel regionally, nationally and internationally as required.

description_html:
We are seeking an experienced Customer Support Operations Manager to lead their assigned team of support analysts and optimize our support operations. The role is responsible for effectively guiding team members and ensuring they have the required technical and product knowledge to address customer issues. The role will contribute to shaping the organizational culture, fostering collaboration within the team and cross-functionally with key stakeholders, while proactively identifying and addressing obstacles to enhance both team performance and customer experience. The Customer Support Manager drives team development, performance management and mentoring, fostering engagement and motivation, promoting collaboration and addressing conflicts constructively to help team members grow and achieve their career goals.

Key Responsibilities:

Leadership and team management:
  • Lead, motivate, and coach a team of support analysts (10 people).
  • Set clear expectations, conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and develop team members and help them achieve their career goals
  • Foster a positive and collaborative team environment, encouraging high engagement and motivation, celebrating achievements, recognizing contributions, and creating opportunities for team members to feel valued and connected to the broader goals
  • Invest in the growth of the team members, getting them the required training, knowledge and enablement.
  • Help shape the culture of the support function, ensuring alignment with broader organizational goals.

Process improvement, technical and product knowledge:
  • Maintain and evolve a solid understanding of the technical and product contexts to effectively guide and support the team.
  • Ensure teams have the required technical and product knowledge to effectively address customer needs.
  • Identify, analyze, and implement support process improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Develop and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) and workflows.
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and identify areas for improvement.

Team and customer experiences
  • Collaborate across the Support function and with product development, Cloud Operations and other key counterparts to proactively identify problems, assess systemic issues and clear obstacles, ensuring that the support team is equipped to address customer issues effectively.
  • Monitor customer feedback and drive areas for improvement in the customer experience.
  • Implement strategies to enhance support team effectiveness and improve customer satisfaction and retention.

Reporting and analysis:
  • Generate regular reports on support operations performance and key metrics.
  • Analyze data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement, taking a proactive approach to identifying issues.
  • Present findings and recommendations to senior management.

Plan management:
  • Develop and manage the support operations plan for assigned team
  • Monitor expenses and ensure that the plan is adhered to.

Required Qualifications:

  • Proved experience in customer support or operations management.
  • Proven leadership and team management skills.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with customer support tools and technologies.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience in a high-growth, fast-paced , global environment.
  • Experience with data analysis and reporting tools.
  • Knowledge of ERP, Cloud technology, technical expertise not limited to technology platform and domain expertise in the fields of supply chain or warehouse management.
  • Knowledge of industry best practices in customer support operations.
  • Experience with project management methodologies.
  • Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.

description_html:
The Office Services Assistant II is responsible for supporting the daily operations of the Dallas office, ensuring a smooth and efficient workplace experience for all employees. The position plays a key part in maintaining office services, responding to staff needs, and contributing to the overall success of the company by fostering a productive and welcoming environment.


A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Providing reception services, such as answering phones, greeting guests, and managing incoming mail and deliveries
  • Managing office supply inventory and restocking as needed
  • Responding to help desk tickets for office services, including repairs and maintenance
  • Coordinating seating allocations and maintaining accurate records of office assignments
  • Supporting event scheduling and meeting room calendar coordination
  • Collaborating with team members to resolve office-related requests and maintain a positive workplace atmosphere


Basic Qualifications

  • Experience using Microsoft Office applications (i.e. Outlook, Word)
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship


Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior administrative or office support experience
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel

description_html:
The Principal Software Supply Chain Manager provides strategic leadership in vetting and managing Infor’s software and hardware supply chain, ensuring vendor compliance and resilience. This role also serves as the senior point of contact for customer queries regarding the security and compliance of Infor’s supply chain on an offering-by-offering basis. Secondarily, the role project manages Infor’s Source Code Program, ensuring source code is only provided under proper terms and conditions and that all usage complies with the Source Code License Agreement.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Lead strategic vetting, approval, and management of third‑party vendors supporting Infor’s software and hardware supply chain
  • Respond to customer queries with clear, timely, and accurate information on supply chain security and compliance
  • Oversee negotiation and compliance of source code agreements to safeguard intellectual property and business interests
  • Project manage Infor’s Source Code Program, ensuring source code is only provided under proper terms and conditions
  • Monitor compliance with the Source Code License Agreement and enforce source code usage terms
  • Collaborate with executive stakeholders, legal, IT, and engineering teams to align vendor and source code strategies with business goals
  • Track vendor deliverables, KPIs, and compliance metrics, reporting results to senior leadership

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in software/hardware procurement and supply chain management
  • Experience in global ERP supply chain operations and multi‑jurisdictional vendor management
  • Experience vetting and managing third‑party vendors in ERP environments
  • Knowledge of supply chain security, compliance frameworks, and customer engagement practices
  • Experience with contract negotiation, vendor governance, and risk management
  • Experience responding to customer queries on compliance and security
  • Experience managing source code programs and enforcing license agreements
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business, IT, or related field
  • Experience working with intellectual property law, source code licensing frameworks, and compliance enforcement
  • Experience working to improve vendor performance, risk mitigation, and customer satisfaction
  • Experience with OneTrust or similar vendor management systems
Location:  US Remote (Atlanta, GA; Dallas, TX)

description_html:
The Partner Business Development Manager (P-BDM) is accountable for activating and developing new business model capabilities within existing partners, while also identifying and recruiting new partners by identifying and addressing market gaps.

The P-BDM will collaborate with the Partner Account Manager (PAM) and will identify opportunities with specific partners and will own the business development model.

A Day in the Life Includes:

· Recruit net new partners to fill gaps identified in Infor’s partner coverage heatmap.
· Develop existing partners to expand business model(s) and practices. Working closely with assigned PAM who will own the relationship.
· Identify and develop joint business plans and go-to-market strategies and lead generation opportunities.
· Leverage the Infor Partner Network (IPN) program to help the partner expand in markets and industries where they have a comparative advantage.
· Guide partners through their specific learning journeys ensuring comprehensive training and enablement for each partner.
· Align with partners on revenue targets and track consistently – supporting partners as needed while managing partner deliverables.
· Hold regular Quarterly Business Reviews with partners and appropriate Infor stakeholders to optimize growth opportunities.


Basic Qualifications:

· Experience working with Ecosystem Partners, relevant industry (including micro verticals) and software/products in a business development/lead generation role.
· Experience building sales/partner relationships developing commercial agreements.
· Experience working with PAM’s to identify and engage partners to develop sales pipelines and achieving ACV growth.
· Experience recruiting net new partners with experience sharing sales presentations to key stakeholders.
· Experience collaborating and building cross-functional support for partners with sales, marketing and enablement teams. Experience assisting with onboarding of new partners.
· Experience with executive communication including delivering presentations.
· Travel requirements: 50%
·  English and French fluent Speaker

Preferred Qualifications:
· Saas / Cloud / ERP sales experience, with a focus on partner or channel-driven models.

Infor is seeking a Principal Solution Consultant (Presales) with deep expertise in global supply chain, logistics, multi-enterprise networks, and supply chain visibilityto support our growing Infor Nexus business in Japan. This role is ideal for candidates with strong knowledge of global trade, supplier collaboration, transportation, order management, supply chain finance, and related logistics processes.
Experience in Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and broader logistics operations is a strong secondary plus and desired for end-to-end solution storytelling.

The successful candidate will support sales cycles by delivering compelling, value-driven demonstrations of Infor Nexus and related supply chain/logistics capabilities. You will work closely with account executives, solution consulting peers, partners, and product teams to define solution scope, articulate business value, and guide customers through strategic transformation discussions.
This position requires strong business acumen, consultative storytelling, and the ability to manage complex enterprise sales engagements while being a trusted advisor to customers.

description_html:
The Senior Procurement Specialist will lead strategic contracting and end-to-end Information Technology (IT) procurement for software, hardware, network, cloud, and related services supporting Infor’s Product Management, Product Development, and enterprise technology needs. The role owns the full supplier lifecycle—from evaluation, negotiation, and onboarding through contract stewardship, performance governance, and renewals—ensuring adherence to Infor’s commercial standards, financial guardrails, and risk controls.

As a key liaison across Product Development, Product Management, IT, Legal, Finance, Security, and executive stakeholders, this leader structures and negotiates complex commercial terms and builds long-term, value-creating relationships that scale with the business.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Lead strategic negotiations for complex IT related Agreements including, but not limited to enterprise licensing, perpetual licensing, SaaS subscriptions, services, Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
  • Own end-to-end supplier lifecycle management, including evaluation, selection, onboarding, contract administration, and renewals.
  • Translate product and IT roadmaps into proactive sourcing plans; conduct market analysis; and optimize supplier portfolios for cost, delivery, and innovation.
  • Ensure compliance with commercial, financial, legal, security, privacy, and reputational controls; maintain accurate agreement and supplier data across systems.
  • Govern supplier performance using KPIs and SLAs; resolve issues rapidly and drive continuous improvement and risk mitigation.
  • Interpret and amend existing agreements to meet evolving business requirements, steward software asset management principles and entitlement accuracy.
  • Champion (Vendor Management Office) VMO process excellence to improve cycle time, data quality, and forecasting while supporting team operations as needed.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in IT procurement, sourcing, vendor or product partner management in the software/IT industry.
  • Experience negotiating complex software and cloud agreements and enterprise licensing models (SaaS and on-premise).
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle, pricing and licensing constructs, and supplier performance management.
  • Experience in commercial contracting and negotiation skills with the ability to assess financial implications quickly and accurately.
  • Demonstrated influence skills and executive presence with internal and external senior stakeholders.
  • Organizational skills, disciplined execution, and ability to manage multiple initiatives independently.
  • Experience with Microsoft applications, financial controls, approval workflows, and contract administration processes.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Experience sourcing software, hardware, and network equipment; supplier consolidation and strategic supplier management.
  • Demonstrated risk identification and mitigation, continuous improvement, and cost-optimization programs.
  • Familiarity with software asset management concepts and reporting/analytical practices; SQL knowledge a plus.
  • Professional certifications (e.g., MCIPS/CIPS, project management, Six Sigma) and experience with SharePoint or document management platforms.
  • International sourcing experience and multilingual capability (e.g., German, French, Portuguese).   

Location:  Hybrid – 3 day in office requirement (Atlanta, GA or Dallas, TX)

description_html:
The Product Manager for Talent Acquisition (TA) is responsible for defining the vision, strategy, and roadmap for our integrated hiring and recruiting software solutions within the broader Human Capital Management (HCM) platform. This role requires a deep understanding of the global talent acquisition landscape, including Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), Candidate Relationship Management (CRM), and the critical integration points with Core HR, Payroll, and Onboarding modules. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker, a passionate user advocate, and a hands-on leader capable of driving execution across engineering, design, sales, and marketing teams.


A Day In The Life Includes: 

  • Ensure that product roadmaps and product strategy align with larger Infor business goals.
  • Prioritize, develop and communicate product roadmaps and strategy to customers, partners, analysts and prospects.
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders including industry strategy, sales, marketing, support, design and product development on product line strategy.
  • Drive partnership, platform and integration strategy across the solution.
  • Keep a pulse on buyers, competitors and larger HCM market.
  • Set strategic goals and initiatives to strengthen Infor’s market position.
  • Develop metrics to monitor and quantify impact of new capabilities and opportunities for further investment.


Basic Qualifications: 
  • Possess a sense of ownership and "CEO of your product" attitude.
  • Ability to influence multiple stakeholders, achieve strategic goals and evolve product strategy based on research, data, and industry trends.
  • Previous experience working on HR, payroll, benefits or work technology-related software products.
  • Previous experience using qualitative and quantitative data to prioritize and drive decision -making.
  • Comfortable using product, collaboration and development tools such as JIRA and Aha.
  • Experience in product management, management consulting or related experience in SaaS.
  • Experience with Agile Scrum development principles and best practices.


Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, journalism, communications or similar fields.
  • Direct experience as product manager for talent acquisition software.
  • Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance or Marketing.


Job Location: US Based (Remote).

description_html:
Infor is seeking a Product Support Analyst to provide dedicated technical and operational support for Department of Defense (DoD) customers utilizing Infor’s Hospitality Management Solution (HMS). This role serves as a key liaison between Infor Support and DoD partners, ensuring seamless communication, timely issue resolution, and exceptional customer experience across military base implementations. The ideal candidate combines strong problem-solving skills, technical proficiency, and a customer-first mindset to deliver reliable, high-quality remote support that upholds Infor’s commitment to service excellence.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Serve as a support liaison between the Infor Support business unit and the customers for both functional and technical support for the Hospitality product lines.
  • Provide courteous customer service in an accurate and timely manner in accordance with existing procedures.
  • Provide application support by responding to incidents, interpreting queries and problems, examining data, error logs, and utilizing all available support material and tools to successfully resolve the problem.
  • Resolve customer questions or problems over the telephone or via the chat tool focusing on product functionality, operating environments and system configuration/setup.
  • Proactively keep customers informed of how and when problems are resolved with a focus on retention and reference ability.
  • Develop and maintain effective customer communications by managing the customers’ expectations through use of negotiation, persuasion, diplomacy, and clear communication in the English language, ensuring customer satisfaction and customer retention.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Experience working in customer service or support.
  • Experience using a CRM such as ServiceNow to log work cases.
  • Experience using SQL.
  • Experience identifying and evaluating possible solutions for product related questions.
  • Experience with operating environments.
  • Experience with remote desktop viewing through tools such as Webex or SecureLink.
  • Ability to work all shifts as required, including weekends and holidays.
  • US Citizenship is required due to US Government contract requirements. 

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Hospitality industry experience with check in/out, accounting, and/or reporting.
  • Experience with technical support of cloud applications.
  • Technology Help Desk experience a plus.
  • Knowledge of various software applications used for testing, troubleshooting, call logging, etc.

description_html:
We are looking for a proactive and technically skilled Product Support Analyst to join our team. This role focuses on providing exceptional software support for PLM for Process solutions, ensuring timely issue resolution, and delivering a seamless customer experience. The ideal candidate is analytical, customer-focused, and thrives in a fast-paced, global support environment.


A Day In a Life:

  • Deliver expert-level software support for PLM for Process applications.
  • Perform in-depth troubleshooting and root cause analysis of technical issues.
  • Recommend and implement effective solutions or workarounds.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve complex problems.
  • Manage customer interactions with professionalism and empathy.
  • Participate in virtual meetings and support sessions via Zoom or similar platforms.
  • Document issues, resolutions, and best practices in internal knowledge bases.

 

What You Will Need:

  • Strong background in software support, preferably with ERP systems for global external clients.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Excellent communication skills with the confidence to engage with international stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.

 

What Will Put You Ahead:

  • Recognized achiever with awards or honors in academics or professional settings.
  • Technically savvy with a passion for problem-solving.
  • Experience in debugging, reading code logic, and understanding system workflows.
  • Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with ticketing tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira, Zendesk).
  • A collaborative mindset and a drive for continuous learning.

description_html:
As a Support Software Engineer for the XA (ERP) Enterprise Resource Planning product, you are responsible for resolving customer product issues focusing on achieving timely updates and resolutions, and delivering a superior product and technical support. You will have the opportunity to work on Financial, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain modules as well as technologies such as integration tools and development frameworks. In this role, you will work in close collaboration with other skilled software engineers and business analysts and will be challenged to learn a variety of modules and technologies allowing you to grow professionally.

Key Responsibilities

  • Resolve customer product issues utilizing analytical skills in problem interpretation, checking logs, replications, and utilizing the tracking system, support materials, communications channels, and tools.
  • Provide a high-quality and professional customer experience while meeting or exceeding established KPIs and creating quality knowledge content.
  • Develop application knowledge in the specific product suite, technical environment, and technologies.
  • Adhere to incident management standards and is always abreast of updates to tools and standard operating procedures.
  • Participate in special projects and takes on special assignments as needed.
  • Assist support analysts and serves as a resource for others as needed.
  • Manage multiple incidents & problems while working in high-visibility situations.
  • Work independently and with minimal supervision to complete tasks and assignments as directed.
  • Coordinate with internal product and hosting teams to ensure the timely resolution of customer issues.
  • Contribute to our ever-growing Knowledge Base Articles.
  • Identify and promote opportunities to reduce the amount of direct support required through product improvements, training, online support, and self-service.

 Key Requirements/Experience

  • Minimum of 3 years & maximum 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 3 years and a Master's degree; or equivalent work experience.
  • Good communication skills (verbal and written) in English.
  • Experience in customer-facing roles for any enterprise software.
  • Background with an ERP system.
  • Functional Domain knowledge in Manufacturing, or Supply Chain.
  • IBMi Knowledge is a plus.
  • Powerlink/Netlink (IDF) Knowledge is a plus.
  • Customer management skills with a high commitment to customer satisfaction.
  • Excellent analytical skills and systematic approach to problem-solving.
  • Candidate is willing to work in the US time zone (EST/PST) shift on a rotation basis.
  • Japanese language skills are a plus.

description_html:
Position Summary

Our Product Support Analyst, Hospitality are at the front line providing excellent technical support for the various Infor Hospitality products. When our customers contact us for support, either by Live Chat, telephone or when they log an incident, we listen to the customer, understand what the issue is and prioritize it according to the severity and impact.  As our Hospitality customers operate around the clock, we run an 24x7 hotline for the Mandarin speaking customers in the China region, and once trained, the candidate is expected to carry and respond to After Hours calls on a rostered basis.

One of Infor’s important objectives is the retention of customers through superior service, and the realization of Customer Lifetime Value. Thus, being the first point of contact with the customer means taking stock of situations that are not always within our technical scope and liaising effectively with other teams, both within the company and sometimes with vendors, so that the customer concerns can be actioned on. An example is by working with the Development team to identify defects or improvements to the software, or with the SaaS team on various specific needs for our SaaS customers.

As a team member, you are expected to work effectively with other teams, and with team members within the worldwide Support team, locally, regionally and worldwide to ensure that the customers issues are addressed and that the Support Operation targets are met and exceeded.

The candidate will be based in Singapore office and will report to the China Support Manager for Hospitality, there is also frequent interactions with the Sr Manager for the APAC region. Infor constantly looks for better solutions, methodologies, and tools to improving our work process and ultimately improving the Customer Experience, there’s always something new to pick up and improve on!  

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

•            Monitors and connects to the customer via Incidents in the Live Chat software and Support queues

•            Provides initial direct telephone and remote support to customers for troubleshooting and resolution

•            Resolves most frequently asked questions via chat, phone or email with the help of the on-line Knowledge Center.

•            Assigns priorities on customer issues and routes the incidents to the appropriate resource area of Support Services when unable to resolve the incident assigned to oneself.

•            Follow-up on incidents and issues are resolved with their approval and understanding

•            Work and liaise with various team members and teams (SaaS, Sales, Services, Development) on customer issues or requests

•            Documents customer contact activity and maintain accurate data on Infor Support Portal.

•            Educate /demo to customers through the use of the Web site online Knowledge Center.

•            Keep yourself up to date with training webinars and Infor courses and requirements

What You Will Need:

Basic Qualifications:

•            Graduates in Bachelor of Hospitality Management or Science/Engineering (or reasonably related)

•            The candidate should be from Software or Hospitality (*domain) background.

•            Candidates with domain experience over two years

•            Exposure to the Front office or Property Management Software is preferred.

•            Excellent English Communication skills to interact with Infor’s global customers and analysts.

•            Excellent Mandarin Communication skills to interact with Infor’s China/Asian customers and direct team.

•            Confident Cantonese Communication skills to interact with Infor’s China Hongkong / China Macau customers.

What Will Put You Ahead?

•            Longer periods of Front Office experience

•            General product knowledge across Hospitality product suite.

•            Applies the product/technical/functional knowledge to arrive at effective and quick solutions.

•            Customer oriented with attention to detail. 

•            Ability to work with different working styles in a team environment.

•            Passionate about individual, team, and organization’s success.

•            Develops and maintains smooth working relationships with coworkers in one’s own and other departments.

•            Ability to adapt to new technology

•            Demonstrates self-learning ability to develop technical knowledge, skills and self-improvement.

•            Stays informed about industry practices

•            Good data entry skills. (type 30-40 words per minute)

•            General Computer Skills, Microsoft Office and operating systems a plus

•            Have experience deploying or using application software in an AWS environment and understand basic cloud environment concepts such as AWS EC2, S3 and other basic services.



Workplace Fairness and Non-Discrimination Commitment

Infor is committed to fostering a fair and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, religion, nationality, gender, age, marital status, language, pregnancy status, caregiving responsibilities, disability, mental health condition, or any other characteristic protected under applicable laws, including the Workplace Fairness Legislation. All employment decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and business needs.

description_html:
Infor is seeking Associate Product Support Analysts to provide dedicated technical and operational support for Department of Defense (DoD) customers utilizing Infor’s Hospitality Management Solution (HMS). This role serves as a key liaison between Infor Support and DoD partners, ensuring seamless communication, timely issue resolution, and exceptional customer experience across military base implementations. The ideal candidate combines strong problem-solving skills, technical proficiency, and a customer-first mindset to deliver reliable, high-quality remote support that upholds Infor’s commitment to service excellence.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Serve as a support liaison between the Infor Support business unit and the customers for both functional and technical support for the Hospitality product lines.
  • Provide courteous customer service in an accurate and timely manner in accordance with existing procedures.
  • Provide application support by responding to incidents, interpreting queries and problems, examining data, error logs, and utilizing all available support material and tools to successfully resolve the problem.
  • Resolve customer questions or problems over the telephone or via the chat tool focusing on product functionality, operating environments and system configuration/setup.
  • Proactively keep customers informed of how and when problems are resolved with a focus on retention and reference ability.
  • Develop and maintain effective customer communications by managing the customers’ expectations through use of negotiation, persuasion, diplomacy, and clear communication in the English language, ensuring customer satisfaction and customer retention.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Experience working in customer service or support.
  • Experience identifying and evaluating possible solutions for product related questions.
  • Experience with operating environments.
  • Ability to work all shifts as required, including weekends and holidays.
  • US Citizenship is required due to US Government contract requirements. 

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Hospitality industry experience with check in/out, accounting, and/or reporting.
  • Experience using SQL.
  • Experience with technical support of cloud applications.
  • Technology Help Desk experience a plus.
  • Knowledge of various software applications used for testing, troubleshooting, call logging, etc.
  • Experience with remote desktop viewing through tools such as Webex or SecureLink.
  • Experience using a CRM such as ServiceNow to log work cases.

description_html:
The Product Support Analyst for Infor LN provides application and technical support to customers, answering complex questions on function and usage of the product via the telephone and/or remote connections. Support includes functional analysis, program analysis, testing and debugging to resolve customer reported issues. This position serves as primary support liaison between company and customer, in a highly team-oriented environment. We are looking for support analysts to strengthen our technical team in a technical environment that is evolving at a fast pace.

A Day in The Life Typically includes

  • Resolves client application questions or problems in system set up, product functionality and product enhancements within the Logistics and Manufacturing Module of the ERP.
  • Proactively keeps customer informed of how and when problems are resolved with focus on retention and reference ability.
  • Involved in any additional follow up, testing and troubleshooting.
  • Manages workload effectively following Support Procedures.
  • Responsible for appropriate referral to other support analysts, provides feedback to Development with guidance from mentor (more senior analysts) and liaises with other Departments.
  • Contributing and maintaining information in the Support knowledge base.
  • Developing product knowledge in the specific ERP product and identifying areas for further specialization.

Required skills:

  • Excellent customer focus and strong communication skills.
  • Good analytical skills to analyze data research and solve diverse functional issues.
  • Team player with the ability to build strong peer and interpersonal relationships.
  • Fluent in English.
  • Good writing and editing skills which enable you to provide oral and written communication that effectively articulates complex ideas.
  • Relevant degree/master. Equivalent training and/or work experience.

Preferred skills and experience:

  • Knowledge of ERP software
  • Bonus point for previous working experience in Production, Logistics and/or IT Support.
  • Bonus point for German language or other European language.

WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER:

  • Benefit from experienced senior consultants as a mentor for 18 months to build your career.
  • Integration into an exsisiting support team in Wroclaw with 8 analysts.
  • Comprehensive and on-going training and development programs.
  • Opportunity to work with the 3rd largest Enterprise Software company in the world.
  • Rewarding career in an international working environment.
  • Opportunity to work alongside recognized experts in the field.

description_html:
The Product Support Analyst – Infor M3 Finance provides application and technical support to customers using Infor M3, with a focus on Finance and Accounting modules. The role involves answering complex functional and technical questions related to product usage, configuration, and financial processes via phone and/or remote connections.

Support activities include functional analysis, data analysis, testing, and troubleshooting to resolve customer-reported issues. This position acts as a primary support liaison between Infor and its customers, working in a highly collaborative, team-oriented environment. We are looking for analysts to strengthen our Finance support capability in a fast-evolving ERP and cloud environment.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes

  • Resolving customer questions and issues related to Finance modules of Infor M3 (e.g. General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Fixed Assets, Cost Accounting, Financial Reporting).
  • Performing functional and data analysis, testing, and troubleshooting to identify root causes and validate solutions.
  • Proactively keeping customers informed about issue status and resolution timelines, with a strong focus on customer satisfaction and retention.
  • Managing workload effectively while following established Support Procedures and SLAs.
  • Collaborating with other support analysts, escalating appropriately, and providing structured feedback to Development teams, with guidance from senior analysts or mentors.
  • Participating in follow-up activities, including regression testing and validation of fixes.
  • Contributing to and maintaining knowledge base documentation, including solutions, workarounds, and best practices.
  • Continuously developing product and domain knowledge in Infor M3 Finance and identifying areas for further specialization.

Required Skills

  • Strong customer focus with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills, particularly for financial and functional issues.
  • Ability to analyze data, accounting flows, and system behavior to identify root causes.
  • Team player with the ability to build strong working relationships with peers and stakeholders.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Strong writing skills, enabling clear documentation of complex functional concepts.
  • Relevant degree or master’s (Finance, Accounting, Information Systems, or related field), or equivalent training and experience.
  • Knowledge of ERP systems.
  • Solid understanding of accounting principles and financial processes.

Preferred Skills and Experience

  • Previous experience working in a finance or accounting environment, ideally with hands-on exposure to ERP systems.
  • Experience supporting or using Infor M3 Finance or another ERP finance module.
  • Knowledge of financial closing, reporting, and reconciliation processes.
  • French or another European language is a plus.

What We Have to Offer

  • Mentorship from experienced senior analysts to support career growth.
  • Opportunity to be part of an exciting expansion of Support Operations in Tunisia.
  • Comprehensive onboarding and continuous training and development programs.
  • Opportunity to work with one of the world’s leading enterprise software companies.
  • A rewarding career in an international, multicultural environment.
  • Exposure to complex customer environments and collaboration with recognized experts in ERP and Finance domains.

description_html:
Infor is hiring a technical Product Support Analyst to join our Talent Acquisition systems team. This role resolves complex technical issues across platforms like Infor HR Talent, lead cross-functional troubleshooting efforts, and delivers efficient, high-impact solutions that elevate the customer experience. The Product Support Analyst drives continuous improvement and helps shape product enhancements through direct customer feedback—all while ensuring system reliability and alignment with business goals.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Resolve highly complex, high-impact issues related to Talent Acquisition systems (e.g., Infor HR Talent), focusing on product functionality, system configuration, integrations, and technical environments – often serving as the final escalation point before engineering.
  • Conduct in-depth functional and program analysis, testing, and debugging to diagnose and resolve customer-reported issues with precision and efficiency.
  • Uphold a professional, service-oriented image by delivering clear, proactive communication and sustainable solutions that strengthen user confidence and team collaboration.
  • Act as the go-to product and process expert on critical cases; coordinating cross-functional support efforts with sound judgement, technical leadership, and focus on minimizing downtime and maximizing productivity.
  • Mentor junior team members, fostering a high-performing support culture, and driving continuous improvement in both team capabilities and customer satisfaction.
  • Engage with high-priority customers to deliver fast, accurate solutions using advanced system and business knowledge—ensuring alignment with talent acquisition priorities.
  • Translate real-world user feedback into actionable product recommendations, serving as a key liaison between customers and engineering to drive meaningful enhancements.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Experience in supporting multiple product suites and modules, with underlying technical environments; demonstrated through analytical skills in data analysis, research, diagnostics, and resolution of diverse, complex technical issues.
  • Experience supporting Human Resources Software (Benefits, Payroll, Talent Acquisition) processes and systems in a technical capacity (e.g., configuration, troubleshooting, or integration support).
  • Experience delivering efficient, high-impact service to clients under tight deadlines.
  • Experience managing escalations and setting clear, realistic expectations with customers.
  • Experience conducting virtual sessions or phone interactions including screen-sharing, troubleshooting complex technical issues, and facilitating interactive discussions with customers.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Bonus: Hands-on experience with Infor HR Talent (or other Talent Acquisition software suites such as Workday, SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM, or iCIMS).
  • Bonus: Hands-on experience with computer programming or application coding (e.g., Java, JavaScript, SQL, or scripting).
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or equivalent technical training preferred.

description_html:
Job location: Austria or Germany - home or office based.

The Project Director will take full ownership of the end-to-end delivery of Infor's most complex, multi-million dollar, multi-site, and international projects—including hybrid, on-premise, cloud, and co-development engagements. You will be responsible for formulating successful strategies to increase operational performance and ensuring alignment with customer business objectives and contractual requirements (Statement of Work).

This role requires leadership in resource management, project planning, financial control, risk mitigation, and customer engagement to drive project success and maximize customer satisfaction and retention.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Provide strategic leadership and ownership of large, complex and global projects.
  • Develop, maintain, and control integrated project plans, schedules, and budgets.
  • Establish alignment between Infor and customer expectations, ensuring clarity on scope and responsibilities and success of the project.
  • Lead implementation planning and execution using Infor's methodology and project management tools.
  • Manage all project resources, including internal teams, offshore, and third-party subcontractors.
  • Track project status and communicate regularly to customers and internal stakeholders.
  • Manage change control processes and update project baselines as needed.
  • Identify, assess, and mitigate risks and issues proactively.
  • Lead governance and steering committees with customer executives.
  • May need to manage multiple workstreams on a project acting as program manager in large complex, multi workstream projects. Projects may have several other project managers leading workstreams in which the project director will lead and have ownership of the entire project.
  • Coach and mentor Project Managers and other delivery team members.
  • Transition deliverables to Global Support or Managed Services effectively.
  • Own and responsible for project financials, including forecasting, billing, and cost control.
  • Participate in presales and deal structuring activities as required.
  • Drive continuous improvement through stakeholder feedback and lessons learned.

Required Qualifications & Experience:
  • Project Management Professional (PMP®) certification or equivalent.
  • Significant experience managing full lifecycle ERP or complex software implementation projects.
  • Proven ability to operate effectively in dynamic, high-growth environments with demanding customers.
  • Strong organizational, leadership, and communication skills.
  • Experience managing multi-country, multi-vendor, multi-product projects.
  • Active application of tools for Project Management (like Certinia PSA) and Project Planning (like MS Project, GANTT) and Task-Management tools (like JIRA, ADO, SharePoint)
  • Knowledge of enterprise software, cloud applications, and Agile methodologies.
  • Experience with co-development and hybrid delivery models.
  • Strong negotiation and influencing skills at all business levels.
  • Factual based decision making.
  • Ability to read customer reality, develop trust-based relationships with customers and internal teams.
  • Familiarity with organizational change management (OCM) principles.
  • Experience in leading virtual teams, mentoring project managers, and contributing to project management communities.
  • Business proficient in both English and German (huge bonus points for French).
  • Ability and willingness to travel, including international travel.
