description_html:
The Infor Decision Analytics and Science (IDeAS) team is responsible for setting the innovation strategy at Infor. We are a diverse, well-integrated, and customer-focused team of data scientists, data engineers, solution architects, application developers, and science solution managers with an ambitious vision to enable enterprise Machine Learning (ML) for all Infor customers across multiple industries and segments.
 
Project Manager in IDeAS represents a liaison between various stakeholders to build data-centric products. As a project manager, you will be defining various industry use cases and performing market assessments, mapping out personas, building story maps, and coordinating among various teams on execution, branding, and storytelling. A successful candidate is expected to bring passion for AI/ML and data-related implementations; solid business acumen and judgment; ability to balance strategy, governance, and implementation; desire to have an industry-wide impact and ability to work within a fast-moving environment in a large company to promote decision analytics across various industry verticals.
 
 

Position responsibilities include:

  • Leading discussions with customers to identify potential problems that can be solved using machine learning, optimization, and other analytical approaches
  • Acting as a subject matter expert on all data science systems and Infor technologies
  • Working with scientists and engineers to support the transformation of prototypes and PoCs to products and diagnose science-related bugs, supporting technical analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and deployment
  • Communicating technical concepts and challenges in machine learning space to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Defining, measuring, creating business intelligence reports, and communicating key metrics for team progress and value delivered
  • Participating in the development process including activities such as sprint reviews, science testing, user acceptance testing, etc
  • Taking ownership of risk mitigation and solving issues as they arise
  • Data visualization tools such as Tableau, Birst, Power BI or similar

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelors (or foreign equivalent) in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related discipline from an accredited university
  • 2-5 years' experience implementing analytics data driven software solutions
  • Demonstrated real-world experience in defining personas, developing story maps, gathering requirements, building workflows, preparing roadmaps, and producing qualitative and quantitative industry business cases
  • Strong analytical skills and good working knowledge of Machine Learning, and data concepts.
  • Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to come up and perform data storytelling
  • Self-starter with a passion for analytics and data-related implementations.


What Will Put You Ahead?

  • of progressive responsibilities and process ownership
  • Experience effectively presenting to Leadership teams 
  • Experience and/or certification in agile software development
  • Enjoy working with multiple levels and teams across organizations (engineering/research, product, sales, and marketing teams) and externally (prospects, customers, partners)
  • A proven desire to continue learning to stay ahead in competitive environments and changing technological landscapes
  • Proficiency in any one of the following Python, SQL

description_html:
The Senior Project Manager will need to understand customer project objectives and take ownership of Infor contractual requirements defined in the Statement of Work. They will manage resources assigned to fulfil those requirements using Infor’s implementation methodology, lead implementation planning, control project plan, be accountable for managing cost of delivery and overall execution, develop positive relationships with all project stakeholders creating a high level of customer satisfaction, and help the customer realize expected benefits.

  

Your Responsibilities Include

 
  • Align project requirements to resource competencies and establish the team; build project plan together with project team.
  • Establish cost control plan and allocate the project budget.
  • Constantly coordinate the various disciplines within the project (the business departments, the IT, the project bodies).
  • Assigns / delegates work assignments to project team members; motivate project staff and focus on quality, time and scope.
  • Monitors project deliverables and progress through continuous communication with project members.
  • Monitor progress, anticipate disruptions, and provide progress reports.
  • Ensures that billable projects remain on schedule and within budget, maintaining margin expectations.
  • Ensures projects are completed according to agreed upon plan. Maintains project financial and project profitability, to include resource scheduling, revenue forecasting per project, billing reconciliations, expense report and time approval for project work, etc.
  • Monitor compliance with agreed procedures, agreements and guidelines regarding the operation of the ERP system.
  • Exercise risk and issue management.
  • Act as the primary point of contact towards the client and manage customer expectations and satisfaction.
  • Ensure the customer expected outcomes align with the project deliverables and are understood by the project team with clear success criteria agreed prior to go live.
  • Ensure successful go lives and customer satisfaction.
  • Assist where applicable in pre-sales engagements.
  

Knowledge and Skills, You Bring to the Organization

 
  • Project Management experience on completion of numerous software and product implementations e.g. leading full lifecycle ERP implementation projects.
  • Proven ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly-changing environment, working with complex projects and handling demanding customers.
  • Possess a high degree of project planning, organizational skills, and systems integration expertise.
  • MS Office skills.
  • Possess knowledge of the market to which they are assigned, including: industry, trends, the applicability of Infor products within the target market, and key competitors.
  • Project Management Professional (PMP®) certification or equivalent is desirable.
  • Strong stakeholder, commercial and conflict management.

description_html:
As a Development Project Manager for Infor’s HR Talent & Workforce Management solutions, you will manage delivery for strategic customer accounts and help them succeed with their HCM technology platform adoption. You will develop strong relationships with HR and Operations leaders, understand their workforce challenges, and translate those needs into actionable delivery plans. By connecting the right Infor experts at the right time, you will remove obstacles, improve product utilization, and ensure customers fully realize the value of their Infor HRT and WFM solutions.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Serving as a key delivery owner for HRT/WFM customers, championing their success and long-term partnership through collaborative engagements
  • Facilitating structured success check-ins to assess adoption trends, identify friction points, and co-develop action plans
  • Gathering customer requirements, struggles, and enhancement requests related to HR, payroll, compliance, time/attendance, and scheduling
  • Collaborating with Product Management, Development, CloudOps, Support, and other SMEs to expedite issue resolution and improve customer experience
  • Helping customers implement best practices that increase automation, efficiency, and business outcomes in HR and workforce operations
  • Advising internal roadmap decisions with data-driven insights on common customer needs and identified gaps
  • Managing customer communication around service delivery, prioritization, and release impacts, while maintaining complete transparency and trust

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience working directly with customers in a support, implementation, service delivery, or account management role
  • Experience learning quickly and effectively being able to discuss Infor HRT and/or WFM capabilities
  • Experience with relationship-building skills with both technical and business stakeholders
  • Experience navigating complex environments and driving alignment across multiple internal teams
  • Experience with follow-through, accountability, and proactive problem-solving
  • Experience working with enterprise SaaS solutions in HR, workforce, or operational environments
  • Experience balancing multiple accounts and priorities while maintaining high service quality

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with Infor HRT, Infor WFM enterprise platforms
  • Experience in handling and leading escalation management
  • Experience supporting or delivering payroll, compliance, time & attendance, scheduling, or HR processes
  • Background working with global customers in industries such as healthcare, retail, manufacturing, or public sector
  • Ability to shape account strategy — not only resolve tactical needs
  • Experience leading executive-level updates, escalations, or success planning sessions

description_html:
As a Quality Assurance Engineer you are guided by testing principles and values. You will play a key role in the testing and quality assurance of a highly innovative product that plays an important role within the current overall business strategy of Infor. You own, advocate and guard all aspects of QA in collaboration with software engineers, business analysts, architects, product managers, development managers. 

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

• Be a product expert, improving your knowledge through continuous learning and by working in close collaboration with cross functional teams and colleagues.
• Meet with developers/product managers understand the product requirement, communicate defects to  development teams.
• Discuss testing strategies with fellow QA members.
• Create and review test cases for the product releases.
• Create automation scripts when test cases are ready.
• Communicate QA findings/defects using Jira system.
• Manage QA artefacts using source control system.

Required skills:

• Experience in test planning, designing, execution, defect tracking and test case creation/execution.
• Experience in automation test script creation.
• Experience of QA methodology and tools.
• Experience with Enterprise, SaaS / cloud software development, having experience of working with AWS cloud technologies.

Preferred Qualification:

• MS SQL Server experience.
• Experience with our tools – Jira, Confluence, Jenkins, Git.
• Experience testing APIs (REST/SOAP).

description_html:
Our Sales and Event Management development team build momentum in deploying application features and modernizing with Cloud technologies. Every developer plays a key role in maintaining the team's culture and benefits from an environment of collaboration and support.

As a member of our R&D team, the QA Engineer works closely with Business Analysts, Product Owner, Product Managers, the wider QA organization and Support teams to develop new functionality and provide an excellent experience to our customers and partners. The successful candidate will be responsible for validating new software features, preventing regression to existing features, supporting developers with investigation of issues/defects, and supporting a major modernization of the product. The core focus for the QA team is to expand the coverage of our automation test suite and to enhance the capabilities of our load and performance test suite.

Job Description:

- Learn new product knowledge by reading the requirements, attending cross functional meetings, and working with the existing QA team
- Meet with developers/product managers to understand new and existing product requirements
- Communicate defects to the development team by documenting steps to reproduce and staging data in the QA environments
- Discuss testing strategies with fellow QA members, senior and principal developers, managers, and product members
- Create and review automated test cases for the product releases currently written in Selenium and Loadrunner
- Document QA findings using Jira and communicate the status and priority of these issues in daily standup meetings
- Manage QA artifacts using Git and explore the integration of test automation into GitLab pipelines


Job Requirements:

- Solid Experience in test planning, designing, execution, defect tracking and test case creation/execution
- Strong knowledge of authoring, debugging, and maintaining automation tests using Java and Selenium
- Excellent work ethic and team attitude; a commitment to exhausting coverage and finding issues that the team has missed
- A love for breaking things and finding ways to work around problems
- Ability to think through large abstract systems and processes, comfortable problem-solving and working with data.
- Good verbal and written communication skills in the English language

Preferred skills:

- Understanding and experience of working with AWS cloud technologies
- Exposure to LoadRunner for load and performance testing
- Strong SQL skills for querying and analyzing large data sets
- Experience with our tools – Jira, Confluence, Git, GitLab
- Experience testing APIs (REST/SOAP)
- Customer focused mindset, with the ability to understand end user requirements and consider how users work with our software, to validate user experience as well as functionality.

description_html:
The Associate Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for supporting the quality and reliability of Landmark Platform through structured testing and validation activities. This role involves designing and executing test cases and test scripts, validating defect fixes, and accurately documenting test results. 

The Associate QA Engineer also assists in the development, maintenance, and enhancement of automated test scripts. Working closely with software developers and cross-functional teams, the role helps identify defects early in the development cycle and supports timely resolution. This position contributes to the organization’s quality assurance goals by following best testing practices and helping deliver high-quality software solutions. 

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:  
  • Learning and understanding product features, business workflows, and system requirements. 
  • Executing manual and automated test cases for new and existing application features. 
  • Developing, maintaining, and optimizing automation scripts to improve test efficiency and coverage. 
  • Reporting, tracking, and validating defects using tools such as JIRA. 
  • Collaborating with developers, product owners, and fellow QA team members to troubleshoot and resolve issues. 
  • Participating in Agile ceremonies such as daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives. 
  • Installing, configuring, and managing QA tools, test environments, and software dependencies. 
  • Requesting and managing access to test environments and system dashboards. 
  • Documenting test results and contributing to test strategies, test plans, and QA documentation. 
  • Continuously learning and adopting best practices in software testing and automation. 
  • Reporting progress, risks, and blockers to the QA Supervisor. 

What You Will Need:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. 
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills. 
  • Background with Java and/or JavaScript programming. 
  • Background with automation testing. 
  • Background of QA methodologies, testing techniques, and defect lifecycle management. 
  • Ability to analyze requirements and define complete test coverage. 

What Will Put You Ahead? 
  • Strong teamwork, communication, and interpersonal skills. 
  • Experience with automation tools (e.g. Cypress, Selenium). 
  • Ability to analyze requirements and define complete test coverage. 
  • Experience using or integrating AI-assisted testing or AI productivity tools (e.g. Test automation with GenAI, AI-based code analysis, AI-powered test case generation). 
  • Strong logical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. 
  • Ability to effectively plan workload and meet project deadlines. 
  • Strong teamwork, communication, and interpersonal skills.

description_html:
As a Quality Assurance Analyst at Infor, you will have a critical role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality enterprise applications that meet the evolving needs of our global customers. You’ll collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and customer success teams to validate functionality, performance, and scalability—helping us deliver smarter, faster, and more intuitive software.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Develop, document, and execute detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts based on product requirements and user stories.
  • Perform manual and automated testing across web-based and cloud-native applications. 
  • Identify, log, and track defects using tools such as JIRA, collaborating with development to ensure timely resolution.
  • Work in Agile/Scrum teams to ensure continuous testing, integration, and delivery pipelines. 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to understand application use cases, industry-specific workflows, and regulatory compliance requirements. 
  • Participate in user story reviews and contribute to requirements clarification and risk assessment. 
  • Monitor application performance, usability, and stability throughout the development lifecycle. 
  • Contribute to the enhancement of QA best practices, frameworks, and continuous improvement initiatives. 
What You Will Need:
  • Experience in software quality assurance, preferably in enterprise software or cloud environments.
  • Experience in M3, ERP
  • Experience of SQL, APIs, and data validation.
  • Experience with Agile methodologies and tools like JIRA, Confluence, and Jenkins.
  • Highly detail‑oriented, structured, and process‑driven
  • Strong self‑learning mindset and eagerness to grow with the product and team
  • Ability to balance autonomy with adherence to established QA processes
What Will Put You Ahead:
  • Exposure to test automation tools or frameworks (any language or tool is acceptable)
  • Willingness and aptitude to transition into automation testing over time
  • Clear communication skills, especially during defect triage and escalation scenarios

description_html:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Analyst

Location: Hyderabad (Permanent Work from Office)
Job Type: Full-Time

Job Description:

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented QA Analyst with an analytical mindset to join our team.  This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in both quality assurance and business analysis, contributing to Infor's success. Motivated by contribution, with the ability to adapt to transformation and embrace change effectively The ideal candidate should have at least 4-5 year of experience in software testing or Business Analysis, a solid understanding of testing concepts, and technical skills in automation tools. The candidate should be able to get started on Functional/Automation Testing with minimal coaching or training and possess good logical and programming skills. The candidate will work on applications that are used organization-wide to support business operations.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform functional and automation testing, including story-level test case design and regression suite creation.
  • Analyse business processes/workflows to improve efficiency and application performance.
  • Identify, document, and track defects, review production bugs and update regression coverage.
  • Conduct regression testing during releases and sprints to ensure system stability.
  • Collaborate with BAs, developers, and stakeholders to clarify requirements and resolve issues.
  • Participate in test automation efforts, code reviews, and maintain functional/automation scripts.
  • Engage in daily Scrum and team meetings, providing updates and escalating issues when needed.
  • Coordinate QA deliverables with peers and support team members with testing techniques.
  • Create and maintain Requirement Traceability Matrix for complete coverage.
  • Analyse and document enhancements for usability and process improvements.
  • Ensure smooth project transition with complete knowledge transfer and artifacts.
  • Continuously explore and recommend automation opportunities to improve efficiency.

Requirements:

Educational Qualifications

  • Degree in B Tech/BE (Specialization in CSE/IT/ECE) or M.Sc. (Computer Science) or MBA (preferred IT Applications for Management/Finance) or BCA or MCA.


Experience:

  • 4-5 years of experience required in one or more of the following areas: web application testing, database testing, business analysis, or data analysis.


Technical Skills:

  • Strong understanding of software testing concepts and Agile methodologies.
  • Good programming skills in Core Java, Python, or similar languages.
  • Hands-on knowledge of automation tools and test automation frameworks such as Playwright, Selenium, or equivalent.
  • Exposure to AI tools, AI adoption for QA manual and automation
  • Working knowledge of APIs and SQL.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD practices is a plus.


Professional Skills:

  • Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team.
  • Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Excellent documentation skills with attention to detail.
  • Ability to understand applications from an end-user perspective.

description_html:
The Quality Assurance Analyst (Automation) will be responsible for all testing phase of our production releases and all testing activities to ensure that the products meet the company standards. We are looking for a Quality Assurance Analyst (Automation) with strong expertise in test automation and test framework development. This role will focus on building test tools, automating manual regression tests, and integrating automation into CI/CD pipelines. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, a problem solver, and has leadership potential.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

· Design, develop, and maintain test automation scripts and frameworks using tools such as Playwright, Selenium, Robot Framework, Python, or similar technologies.

· Build and enhance test tools to improve QA efficiency and coverage.

· Integrate test automation into CI/CD pipelines.

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure quality standards throughout the SDLC in an Agile environment.

· Execute automated and manual tests for e-commerce platforms and SaaS applications.

· Document test plans, processes, and results with high accuracy.

· Champion process improvements and contribute to QA best practices.

· Manage and prioritize tasks effectively to meet project timelines.

· Participate in defect tracking and resolution using industry-standard tools.


What You Will Need:

Basic Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering.

· 3+ years of experience as a QA Analyst, QA Engineer, Software Engineer in Test, or Software Developer in Test, with emphasis on test automation and tool development.

· Strong experience in QA methodologies, SDLC, and Agile practices.

· Proficiency in test automation tools (Playwright, Selenium, Robot Framework, Python, or similar).

· Working knowledge of defect tracking systems.

· Excellent problem-solving and fact-finding skills.

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

· Ability to manage and prioritize tasks efficiently.

· Can do RTO 3x a week - dayshift schedule.


What Will Put You Ahead?

Preferred Qualifications:

· Experience in building and deploying test automation frameworks in CI/CD environments.

· Familiarity with Docker, containerization, and continuous integration/continuous deployment practices.

· Background in software development transitioning to quality automation is a plus.

· Automation experience in e-commerce websites.

· Familiarity with one or more of the following:

o Robot Framework / Python / GitLab

o JMeter / Groovy / OpenSearch / Grafana

o MS SQL and DynamoDB

o Microsoft SQL, Dynamo DB

The Quality Assurance Analyst will be part of the Infor Cloverleaf team will be responsible for defining test strategies, creating comprehensive test cases and designing/implementing automated tests to validate functionality, performance, and data integrity across complex healthcare workflows. Your work will directly contribute to ensuring high-quality, compliant, and scalable healthcare interoperability solutions. You will collaborate closely with developers, QAs, architects, and product owners, and you will have access to industry-leading processes, tooling, and standards within the global healthcare technology domain.

What You Will Need?
Required skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related major
  • 2+ years’ experience in software testing
  • Experience in manual, functional, and API testing
  • Basic automation experience, including running and improving scripts with Karate, JMeter, or other automation tools.
  • Solid knowledge of software development process (especially in Agile process), QA methodology, and tools (Jira, Database, etc.)
  • Ability to maintain high-quality standards in test planning, designing, defect tracking, and test case creation and execution
  • Hands-on experience with API testing using tools such as Postman, Swagger, or equivalent.
  • Experience with SQL
  • Good verbal and written English communication skills
  • Quick learner
  • Strong work ethic and team attitude

  • Experience with performance testing and security testing
  • Knowledge/exposure to cloud environment testing
  • Proficiency in creating automation scripts using languages such as Python, Java, C#, or JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Familiarity with cloud environment testing
  • Proficiency in testing on Linux environments
  • Working knowledge of Docker containers
  • Healthcare domain exposure is a plus

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • You will participate in a multitude of activities with developer, product manage and business analyst.
  • You will conduct testing and create test cases for the software modules you will eventually be responsible for
  • You will be an active QA contributor to a product release

Your work will directly contribute to ensuring high-quality, compliant, and scalable healthcare interoperability solutions. You will collaborate closely with developers, QAs, architects, and product owners, and you will have access to industry-leading processes, tooling, and standards within the global healthcare technology domain.

What You Will Need?
Required skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related major
  • 2+ years’ experience in software testing
  • Experience in manual, functional, and API testing
  • Basic automation experience, including running and improving scripts with Karate, JMeter, or other automation tools.
  • Solid knowledge of software development process (especially in Agile process), QA methodology, and tools (Jira, Database, etc.)
  • Ability to maintain high-quality standards in test planning, designing, defect tracking, and test case creation and execution
  • Hands-on experience with API testing using tools such as Postman, Swagger, or equivalent.
  • Experience with SQL
  • Good verbal and written English communication skills
  • Quick learner
  • Strong work ethic and team attitude

What Will Put You Ahead?
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience with performance testing and security testing
  • Knowledge/exposure to cloud environment testing
  • Proficiency in creating automation scripts using languages such as Python, Java, C#, or JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Familiarity with cloud environment testing
  • Proficiency in testing on Linux environments
  • Working knowledge of Docker containers
  • Healthcare domain exposure is a plus

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • You will participate in a multitude of activities with developer, product manage and business analyst.
  • You will conduct testing and create test cases for the software modules you will eventually be responsible for
  • You will be an active QA contributor to a product release

description_html:
Position Summary

 

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Quality Assurance Analyst to join our growing Workforce Management organization.  Infor Workforce Management is a powerful scheduling solution that focuses on employee scheduling, and time and attendance tracking, serving a Fortune 500 client portfolio.

Key Responsibilities

  • Actively participate in planning, preparing and executing effective test efforts
  • Effectively use test tools, defect tracking tools and other test support tools and identify and implement process improvements where applicable
  • Prioritize testing tasks based on goals and risks of projects and ensure testing milestones, activities and tasks are completed as scheduled
  • Report the status of test planning, defects and execution activities, including regular status updated to the project team using quality metrics
  • Work as part of a dynamic team in an Agile environment with minimal supervision
  • Ensure traceability between product requirements, delivered code and test case verification
  • Maintain and extend test coverage along with designing test cases from user stories, creating appropriate tools, utilities, and automation scripts that assist in functional testing and to create test data
  • Share best practices and improve processes within and across product teams
  • Become subject matter expert in respective modules, maintain expert functional and technical product knowledge
  • Participate in planning and/or creation of test automation

 Key Requirements/Experience

  • 6+ years of professional experience in testing and QA
  • Experience in Both Automation and Manual testing.
  • Good experience in Java, Selenium, API Testing.
  • Structured test planning and execution including ability to turn requirements into good test cases
  • Strong knowledge of Coding and SQL
  • Strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Understanding of web applications and multi-tiered product architectures
  • Flexible to work across different time zones

Desired Requirements/Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field of study
  • Knowledge of the Agile methodology
  • Strong knowledge of at least one programming language
  • Previous experience and/or desire to write automated tests
  • Experience in all stages of application testing, including functional, usability, regression, load/stress and performance testing
  • Knowledge of Jira and other Atlassian tools
  • AWS knowledge
  • Gen AI tools knowledge and experience in using AI for testing

description_html:
QA Engineer, Senior

SUMMARY:  

The Senior Automation Engineer’s primary responsibilities include software testing design, planning, scripting and test execution for a variety of enterprise applications. He/She will also be responsible to mentor and train new hires.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Performs product test script design, development, execution and maintenance for single product modules/sub-systems or lower level issues on multiple products.
  • Conduct integration and regression testing.
  • Submit defects based on execution of test plan.
  • Participate in troubleshooting and triaging of issues with different dev and QA teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution.
  • The individual will work closely with developers, project managers and other stakeholders throughout the SDLC, executing test iterations, tracking / reporting results, troubleshooting and coordinating defect resolution
  • Perform automated testing cycles using Playwright
  • Additional responsibilities for Senior Automation Engineer will be:  Bug verification, release testing, research and analysis of new test engine frameworks. Mentor and train software automation engineers.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

·      BS in Computer Science or related degree

·      Around 4 yrs of hands-on experience in automation testing tools like Selenium & BDD/TDD frameworks (primary) & REST API Automation

Required Skills:

·       Experience in Selenium, Playwright and Webservices automation.

·       Excellent scripting skills (preferably Java and/or Xtend scripting, BDD)

·       Experience in API testing

·       Experience in CI/CD

·       Technical background and an understanding of Enterprise asset applications.

·       Experience in migrating/integrating scripts to new frameworks.

·       Experience in test and script lifecycle management in JIRA

·       Experience in working in Agile model.

·       Relevant work experience in automation development and/or testing role.

·       Experience in test automation framework (Keyword/Data driven/ Hybrid, etc)

·       Strong analytical and problem solving skills

·       Excellent verbal and written communication skills

·       Must be flexible, independent and self-motivated

description_html:
An Electro‑Mechanical Assembler is responsible for building, testing, and troubleshooting assemblies that combine mechanical components with electrical wiring, circuits, and hardware. This role supports production, engineering, and quality teams to ensure products are built accurately, safely, and on schedule.

A Day in Life Typically Includes:

  • Assemble electro‑mechanical components, sub‑assemblies, and full systems using schematics, wiring diagrams, blueprints, and work instructions.
  • Perform wiring, soldering, crimping, routing, and mechanical fastening.
  • Operate hand tools, power tools, torque tools, and basic test equipment.
  • Inspect parts and assemblies for accuracy, quality, and proper fit.
  • Conduct functional tests and record results according to procedures.
  • Identify and troubleshoot assembly issues; escalate complex problems to engineering.
  • Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work area.
  • Follow all safety, ESD, and quality control procedures.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience with electro‑mechanical assembly in a manufacturing or production environment.
  • Experience reading and interpreting technical drawings, schematics, and wiring diagrams.
  • Experience working with hand tools, soldering equipment, and measurement devices with small components.
  • Experience working with codes and quality standards.
  • Experience working in a role involving electrical principles (voltage, continuity, polarity).
  • English reading and writing communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • IPC‑A‑610 or J‑STD‑001 certification.
  • Experience with cable harness assembly.
  • Experience with lean manufacturing or 5S practices.
  • High school diploma or equivalent; technical training.

description_html:
We are seeking an experienced Data Science Engineer to join Infor Decision Analytics and Science (IDeAS), a division of Infor that delivers AI/ML solutions across industries. The role is responsible for designing, building, and operationalizing large-scale predictive and prescriptive analytics that drive measurable business impact for customers. Data Science Engineers at IDeAS combine analytics expertise and technical depth to transform data into actionable solutions, enabling fast and effective decision automation for business functions.

Key Responsibilities:

Machine learning solution development

  • Design, build, and manage the end-to-end lifecycle of machine learning solutions, including model orchestration and data pipelines.

  • Design and implement ETL/ELT processes from customer data sources to support ML solution requirements.

  • Perform and review exploratory data analysis on large and complex datasets to assess quality, extract insights, and guide modeling.

  • Design and build innovative, pragmatic AI/ML solutions leveraging the latest technologies across industries.

Business collaboration and leadership

  • Lead discussions with business stakeholders to identify challenges that can be addressed with AI/ML.

  • Communicate analytical results and implications clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Review and provide guidance on the work of junior team members within projects.

Communication and knowledge sharing

  • Share technical ideas and code effectively through blog posts, GitHub, or similar platforms.

  • Present complex technical topics in clear and actionable terms for audiences ranging from scientists and engineers to business leaders.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Mathematical Modeling, Operations Research, Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electrical, Industrial, or a related quantitative field.

  • Extensive real-world experience designing and implementing full ML/optimization solution pipelines (ETL, preprocessing, data analysis, prototyping, deployment, and inference).

  • Proficient programming skills in Python and data-querying skills using SQL, PySpark, or similar technologies.

  • Strong data modeling and problem-solving skills.

  • Hands-on experience with analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.

  • Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.

  • Collaborative mindset with strong interpersonal skills to solve complex business problems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.

  • Experience in building time-series forecasting and recommendation models.

  • Experience with applied AI/ML solutions in demand forecasting, anomaly detection, pricing, or recommendations.

Are you passionate about shaping the future of cybersecurity? We’re looking for a dynamic Security Analyst who thrives on fresh ideas and bold approaches to risk management and social engineering attacks. This isn’t just a role—it’s an opportunity to lead transformation, inspire change, and make security engaging and impactful across the organization.


A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Reimagine Risk Assessment: Own and evolve our security scoring framework to keep us ahead of threats. Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive smarter decisions.
  • Lead with Influence: Be the voice that makes security matter. Create compelling dashboards, reports, and stories that spark action and accountability across teams.
  • Innovate Awareness & Engagement: Help design phishing simulations that aren’t just tests—they’re learning experiences and helping to create a Security Culture. Partner with teams to build a security culture that sticks.
  • Empower Sales & Customers: Deliver security insights that add real value to conversations and strengthen trust.
  • Serve as the Engagement Manager for company-wide social engineering attack solutions.
  • Collaborate closely with Security Awareness to deliver meaningful training materials and communications aimed at improving employee security behavior.
  • Monitor and report on metrics to continuously improve program effectiveness.


Basic Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with cybersecurity principles
  • Previous experience working with cyber exposure or risk assessment programs (i.e. BitSight, Security Scorecard, UpGuard)
  • Previous experience with social engineering attack tools and security scoring frameworks (i.e. Proofpoint)
  • Previous experience building dashboards and creating reports
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous experience implementing a cyber exposure or risk assessment program
  • CompTIA Security+ or SSCP certification

This isn’t just a role—it’s an opportunity to lead transformation, inspire change, and make security engaging and impactful across the organization.
A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
Reimagine Risk      Assessment: Own and evolve our security scoring framework to keep us ahead      of threats. Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive      smarter decisions.
Lead with Influence: Be      the voice that makes security matter. Create compelling dashboards,      reports, and stories that spark action and accountability across teams.
Innovate Awareness      & Engagement: Help design phishing simulations that aren’t just      tests—they’re learning experiences and helping to create a Security      Culture. Partner with teams to build a security culture that sticks.
Empower Sales &      Customers: Deliver security insights that add real value to conversations      and strengthen trust.
Serve as the Engagement      Manager for company-wide social engineering attack solutions.
Collaborate closely      with Security Awareness to deliver meaningful training materials and      communications aimed at improving employee security behavior.
Monitor and report on      metrics to continuously improve program effectiveness.
Basic Qualifications:
Familiarity with cybersecurity principles
Previous experience working with cyber exposure or risk assessment programs (i.e. BitSight, Security Scorecard, UpGuard)
Previous experience with social engineering attack tools and security scoring frameworks (i.e. Proofpoint)
Previous experience building dashboards and creating reports
Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous experience implementing a cyber exposure or risk assessment program
CompTIA Security+ or SSCP certification

description_html:
As part of our evolving Vulnerability Management team, the Security Analyst will play a pivotal role in shaping the next generation of cyber defense. This position is not just about finding vulnerabilities—it’s about preventing them through innovation, automation, and AI-driven insights. We are transforming vulnerability management into a scalable, intelligent, and proactive service that anticipates risks before they materialize. The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking, data-driven professional who leverages advanced technologies to predict and mitigate threats, applies a risk-adjusted lens to decision-making, and collaborates across the organization to embed security into every layer of our digital ecosystem.


A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Harness AI and automation to proactively identify and remediate vulnerabilities before they impact business operations.
  • Conduct vulnerability analysis across modern architectures, including containers, serverless environments, and cloud-native platforms.
  • Apply risk-based prioritization using severity, exploitability, and business impact to guide strategic remediation efforts.
  • Translate complex technical findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and business stakeholders.
  • Develop predictive dashboards and data visualizations that tell a compelling story of security posture and emerging trends.
  • Collaborate with development and operations teams to embed security into their CI/CD pipeline, reducing vulnerabilities at the source.
  • Continuously explore new technologies and process improvements to enhance scalability and resilience in vulnerability lifecycle management.


Basic Qualifications:

  • Hands-on experience with AWS Cloud and security practices
  • Experience with vulnerability scanning tools (i.e. Qualys, Tenable) and container security solutions (i.e. Aqua Security, AWS Inspector)
  • Experience with CIS Benchmark, Policy Audit tools, and networking technologies (i.e. Routers, WAF, ELB/ALB, CloudFront)
  • Previous experience creating security automation workflows
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with FedRAMP frameworks and compliance reporting
  • Experience integrating security into the software development lifecycle (SSDLC)
  • Ability to interpret security workflows using code (i.e. Python, Java)
  • AWS Cloud Practitioner or AWS Solution Architect certification

description_html:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Account Manager to join our team in Denmark. This role focuses on strategic license sales within the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) domain, targeting new large and enterprise customers. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in ERP sales and a proven track record of working with large business and enterprise clients.

 


A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 


  • Drive strategic license sales of Infor's ERP solutions to enterprise customers.
  • Build and nurture strong, long-term relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Develop and execute comprehensive account strategies to meet and exceed sales targets.
  • Identify and pursue new business opportunities within the large business and enterprise segment
  • Collaborate with internal teams and partners to ensure successful implementation and customer satisfaction.
  • Act as a trusted advisor, providing insights and solutions that align with the customers’ business  objectives.
  • Manage the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing, ensuring accurate forecasting and reporting.
  • Work closely with the team to share knowledge, strategies, and drive collective success.
  • Demonstrate a team-oriented mindset, contributing to a positive and collaborative work environment.


Basic Qualifications: 


  • Extensive experience in ERP sales with a proven track record of successful sales towards large business and  enterprise customers
  • Strong strategic thinking and the ability to develop and execute long-term account plans.
  • Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to influence key decision-makers.
  • Self-motivated, results-oriented, and able to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
  • Familiarity with the Danish enterprise market and an understanding of industry trends and challenges.
  • A team player who thrives in a collaborative environment and contributes to the success of the team.



Why Join Infor?


  • Be part of a global company with a strong presence in the ERP market.
  • Work in a collaborative and innovative environment with a team of experienced professionals.
  • Opportunity to engage with leading enterprise customers and make a significant impact on their business transformation.
  • Competitive compensation package, including performance-based incentives and comprehensive benefits.
  • Professional development opportunities to grow your career within a supportive and dynamic organization.

description_html:
Job location: Germany/ Austria - home or office based

About the Role:

As a valued member of our Technology & Innovation Sales team, you will inspire and empower organizations by sharing the transformative potential of Infor’s digital business platform. You will engage with both existing customers and new industry partners to champion all aspects of our platform, including AI/ML Augmented Intelligence, Generative AI, Agentic, Enterprise Automation, Process Mining, Enterprise Integration, and Data Management.
We’re looking for someone passionate about weaving compelling industry stories around innovative technologies—always through the lens of meaningful customer outcomes and the real economic benefits of digital transformation.


What You'll Do:

  • Build Meaningful Relationships: Nurture strong, trust-based connections with regional Infor sales teams and customers by 
  • understanding their unique challenges and goals.
  • Collaborate Creatively: Partner with marketing and business development to design thoughtful marketing plans tailored to your industry accounts.
  • Discover and Solve: Listen carefully to uncover prospects’ business needs and align those with smart, innovative business platform solutions.
  • Lead with Confidence: Prepare and deliver engaging C-suite presentations that focus on transformational outcomes and the client’s vision.
  • Encourage Fresh Perspectives: Inspire clients to rethink their business with innovation strategies grounded in clear ROI and cost-benefit insights.
  • Stay Informed and Ahead: Keep your industry knowledge sharp by participating in user groups and monitoring competitive offerings.
  • Work Together Across Teams: Collaborate seamlessly with Sales, Pre-sales, and Solution Consulting to ensure smooth and client-centered solutions.
  • Negotiate with Integrity: Guide pricing and agreements toward mutually beneficial outcomes to successfully close deals.
  • Stay Organized: Keep account information and activities up to date in internal systems and communicate forecasted revenue clearly with your sales leadership.

What You Bring:

  • A passion for thriving in dynamic, start-up or incubated environments.
  • A solid understanding of AI/ML, Generative AI, Hyper Automation, Enterprise Integration, and Data Management.
  • The ability to translate complex technology into tangible business value and process improvements.
  • Familiarity with business operations such as supply chain management, inventory optimization, and sales forecasting.
  • A track record of success in a multi-product, collaborative team selling environment.
  • Creativity paired with strong attention to detail.
  • A proactive mindset with a natural sense of urgency.
  • Confidence and grace in building and nurturing executive-level relationships.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • A history of meeting or exceeding annual sales quotas of $1M+.
  • Comfort managing multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously.
  • A hunter’s spirit for identifying and pursuing new opportunities.
  • Fluent German and English

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Deep competitive and industry knowledge.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
  • Proven experience in solution selling.
Travel: Up to 50% travel to connect with clients and teams.
Industry: Cross-vertical, with opportunity to explore diverse sectors.

We’re passionate about creating an inclusive environment where everyone’s voice is heard and valued. If you’re ready to grow your career while making a meaningful impact, we’d love to hear from you!

The Senior Account Manager is responsible for promoting and selling Infor products by nurturing and developing sales opportunities. The Senior Account Manager will be responsible for achieving both company and personal quotas. Responsibilities include developing marketing plans that provide leads, managing assigned accounts, and understanding customers’ business issues and design strategies. 

A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

  • Work closely with existing clients to understand their business objectives and create appropriate solutions to meet their business needs.
  • Articulate the Infor value proposition and successfully communicate the value, competitive advantages, resources and processes to clients.
  • Generate pipeline and achieve or exceed consistent annual quota achievement.
  • Challenge your clients and prospects to think differently by developing compelling value propositions based on ROI cost/benefit analysis.
  • Develop customer account strategies and tactical penetration plans. Establish, document, and maintain solid communication and follow-up procedures for all assigned accounts.
  • Negotiate pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale.

  • Experience selling technology business solutions.
  • Experience establishing and managing executive level customer relationships across an organization.
  • Experience managing multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously.
  • Experience developing business relationships with extended team members to drive sales.
  • Previous success in achieving or exceeding assigned quotas.
  • Ability to travel up to 50%.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working cross functionally in a matrix-management environment with extended team members.
  • Previous experience within the SI partner community.

To strengthen our ERP M3 Consulting team within the Services Organization in the Central Region, we are looking for a motivated, creative and enthusiastic ERP Senior Consultant.

You will be responsible for delivering business process and application consulting services which include process design, application configuration, testing, client training on Infor software, technologies and tools in accordance with standard implementation methods. Developing ongoing, successful business relationships with clients and for providing clients with "industry best practice" recommendations is also an important part of your role.

Your Responsibilities Include:

  • Provide consultative guidance and assistance in a professional and organized manner directly to customers within the Cloud Suite Food & Beverages area.
  • Participate in full life cycle client facing implementation projects, including information gathering, analysis, design, implementation, testing and go live processes relating to Infor applications, working as part of an Infor project team.
  • Add value to customer projects by using the know-how about Infor solutions and implementations derived from practical experiences.
  • Provide customers with integration and industry expertise as well as “best practice” recommendations; act as an advisor to Infor customers regarding best practices and how to configure their Infor solution for making their processes and way of working more efficient.
  • Design and configure efficient client business solutions.
  • Develop and execute test plans.
  • Perform testing of software configurations and customer solutions.
  • Provide training to client’s key and end users.
  • Achieving engagement objectives.
  • Provide regular internal project reports when required.
  • Be a team player, form a relationship with the customer at all levels and also be able to drive a problem through to resolution

Knowledge and Skills, you bring to the organization:

  • Experience in at least one industry segment: Equipment, Service Management & Rental, Food & Beverage, Fashion, Distribution and Manufacturing.
  • Business process change knowledge in one or more of the areas: Supply Chain, Warehousing, Logistics, Procurement, Customer Sales Management, Manufacturing.
  • Consulting experience
  • Implementation experience using M3 or equivalent software is highly desired
  • Fluent written and spoken German and English is mandatory
  • Willingness to travel

description_html:
The Senior Consultant is responsible for overseeing and executing key aspects of the Infor XM application (which contains expense reporting, travel plans (a.k.a. pre-trip authorization), check requests, and timesheet modules) implementation projects, focusing on the design, configuration and deployment of the Infor XM applications. The Consultant is responsible for prospect presentations, discovery, estimate development, and service work order development. Works with the customer’s project team to ascertain and translate their business requirements into design specifications. Configures the application as required, performs and assists in testing, and trains client resources on Infor software, technologies, and tools per Infor methodology. The Consultant is also responsible for developing ongoing, successful business relationships with clients and providing clients with "industry best practice" recommendations.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

  • Lead Infor XM implementation projects, ensuring they stay on schedule and within budget. 
  • Gather and analyze business requirements, translating them into functional specifications and configuring Infor XM solutions to meet client needs. 
  • Provide expertise on best practices and industry standards during implementation. 
  • Configure a client business solution that includes integrations with ERP systems in customer environments.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align project goals with client expectations.
  • Conduct system testing, including developing and executing test plans.
  • Maintain client relationships by providing expert advice and support throughout the implementation lifecycle. 

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in enterprise software implementation/services, preferably in end-user-facing applications.
  • Full lifecycle implementation experience using Infor XM or Expense Management applications like Concur, Coupa, Chrome River, and Expensify.
  • Experience in software development (e.g., project management, Web-based Java/J2EE applications, and technologies like Apache, Tomcat, JSP, JavaScript, XML, JSON, and HTML).
  • Experience with databases like Oracle and MS SQL.
  • Must be a US citizen or a US Permanent Resident.
  • Willingness to travel throughout North America and Europe - approximately 50% travel.    

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Experience with business intelligence tools with a physical model (e.g., ETL, Business Objects, Cognos, MicroStrategy, Birst).
  • Experience in presenting to both executive and operational stakeholders.
  • Experience leading teams of 3-5 members on client implementation projects.
  • Additional languages (e.g., French, German).

Location: US Remote (Dallas, TX or Atlanta, GA)

As a member of our R&D team, the Senior Data Specialist works closely with Architects and Developers to help articulate the future state of data in SunSystems. As we modernize the solution and continue to grow a microservices architecture, we will be exploring new approaches to data and this team member will have a strong voice in defining future state, weighing up data related decisions (e.g. SQL/NoSQL, data architecture). We are seeking someone with understanding of traditional SQL databases, but more importantly the successful candidate must be broad in their knowledge and experience and able to represent other data paradigms, best practise and innovation in data.
The successful candidate will work side by side with our existing engineers in our data team as we take the product forward into an exciting and innovative future.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Working with architects, engineers and others on the data team (both the SunSystems team, and the central Infor Data Services teams) to design/architect the data aspects of our future modernized product architecture.
  • Providing a key point of database expertise for assisting our Development, QA, Consulting Services, Support and CloudOps teams in resolving internal and Customer issues.

  • Designing and building out the data persistence aspects of our future SAAS product architecture, whether this be SQL / NoSQL, database per service etc.
  • Upgrading Development and Customer databases, with the longer-term objective of having zero downtime (ZDT) upgrades.
  • Ensuring privacy, security, performance, efficiency and high availability is designed in to our product.
  • Working closely with scrum teams to complete data tasks alongside product development.
  • Working with other engineers on customer escalations where data is a factor, to support the investigation and resolution of issues.
  • Ensuring that our data approach and data landscape is well documented and compliant with the Infor Secure SDLC and certification (e.g. ISO27001) requirements.
  • Scope to also get involved in some other aspects of our work, in collaboration with our DevOps team, e.g. looking at efficiency of infrastructure, cost reduction exercises, high availability.  
  • Supporting product team and development leadership team to understand the current state of the product, it’s ability to scale, and to support future forecasting (e.g. of costs, infrastructure requirements, performance vs capacity.

What You Will Need:

Basic Qualifications

  • Broad and deep experience of data persistence approaches in modern software architectures, gained in a software development environment.
  • Understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases and ability to articulate and represent how different data paradigms can be used in different architectural approaches.
  • Understanding of stateless architecture and the data-related aspects of achieving stateless system design.
  • Understanding of approaches to data privacy, security, performance and availability.
  • Experience working in an Agile (pref. Scrum)  and iterative development approach.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
  • Enthusiasm and ability to collaborate well with others, including remote teams
  • Professional pride, drive and curiosity, a diligent self-starter that keeps up to date with best practise and keeps your skillset sharp.
  • Strong problem resolution skills

What Will Put You Ahead?

·       Preferred Qualifications:

    • Experience with SQL and NoSQL data designs, microservices data persistence designs in stateless architectures.
    • Experience with popular databases, e.g. MSSQL, Aurora/Postgres, DynamoDB
    • Experience of Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence)
    • Experience with build technologies such as source code versioning (e.g. Git) and PowerShell scripting.
    • Experience working in AWS data persistence, and knowledge of DevOps fundamentals advantageous.
    • Strong ability to think through large abstract systems and processes, comfortable problem-solving in complex data environments.
    • Customer focused mindset, with the ability to understand end user requirements and consider how users work with software that you develop.
Understanding of Accounting/Reporting/Financial applications, BI tools or experience with or exposure to Infor SunSystems and Query and Analysis, beneficial but not required.

description_html:
The Senior Functional Consultant enables clients to realise business value from Infor Cloud Suite solutions by leading functional consulting engagements, driving fit to standard designs, and promoting Food and Beverage industry best practices.  The role requires strong analytical, communication, and leadership skills to manage requirements, improve business processes, and facilitate change within client organisations.  

A Day in the Life Typically Includes

  • Conduct business process walkthroughs providing functional expertise in industry-aligned business processes such as manufacturing planning, scheduling, production, quality, and traceability processes within the food and beverage industry.
  • Collaborates with both client and internal teams to ensure successful project outcomes, ensures all deliverables are completed on time and within scope.
  • Leadership in consultancy delivery and mentoring.
  • Analyse complex situations or data involving multiple variable factors to resolve issues.
  • Provide expert guidance on regulatory compliance and industry-specific standards.
  • planning, quality control, batch management, catch weight, and lot traceability to support Project Managers, technical resources, and project team members.
  • Participate in pre-sales activities, including solution demonstrations and proposal development.
  • Attend product functionality briefings and training sessions.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and Infor product enhancements to advise clients on future improvements.
  • Willingness to travel as required by client engagements. 
  • Application of PBM dimensions to drive impactful consulting outcomes

Basic Qualifications 

  • Extensive customer-facing ERP consulting experience.
  • Broad knowledge of business process changes, with proven experience in Food & Beverage production and planning.
  • Strong background of project / implementation experience with Infor CloudSuite ERP or similar ERP software.
  • Knowledge of industry compliance requirements (e.g., traceability, lot management, shelf life).
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills for stakeholder management and team collaboration.
  • Commitment to ongoing learning and application of Principle Based Management (PBM) principles.
  • Knowledge of AI driven improvements within F&B manufacturing


Preferred Qualifications 

  • Experience with ERP integration tools and platforms (e.g., cloud-based ERP suites, middleware, EDI).
  • Familiarity with Cloud Infrastructure or SaaS applications.
  • Knowledge of change management practices during ERP implementations.
  • Understanding of project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall).
  • Relevant ERP certifications or related credentials.
  • Experience of implementing Infor’s CloudSuite, but also other ERP systems are meritorious e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft, Jeeves, IFS, Visma or similar systems.

description_html:
To strengthen our ERP Cloud Food & Beverages Consulting team within the GPS Organization in the Central Region, we are looking for a motivated, creative and enthusiastic ERP Senior Finance Consultant.

You will be responsible for delivering business process and application consulting services which include process design, application configuration, testing, client training on Infor software, technologies and tools in accordance with standard implementation methods. Developing ongoing, successful business relationships with clients and for providing clients with "industry best practice" recommendations is also an important part of your role.

Your Responsibilities Include:

  • Provide consultative guidance and assistance in a professional and organized manner directly to customers within the Cloud Suite Food & Beverages Finance area.
  • Participate in full life cycle client facing implementation projects, including information gathering, analysis, design, implementation, testing and go live processes relating to Infor applications, working as part of an Infor project team.
  • Add value to customer projects by using the know-how about Infor solutions and implementations derived from practical experiences.
  • Provide customers with integration and industry expertise as well as “best practice” recommendations; act as an advisor to Infor customers regarding best practices and how to configure their Infor solution for making their processes and way of working more efficient.
  • Design and configure efficient client business solutions.
  • Develop and execute test plans.
  • Perform testing of software configurations and customer solutions.
  • Provide training to client’s key and end users.
  • Achieving engagement objectives.
  • Provide regular internal project reports when required.
  • Be a team player, form a relationship with the customer at all levels and also be able to drive a problem through to resolution

Knowledge and Skills, you bring to the organization:

  • Finance experience in at least one industry segment: Equipment, Service Management & Rental, Food & Beverage, Fashion, Distribution and Manufacturing.
  • The Sr. Finance Consultant will have an in-depth understanding of Finance business processes including:

o   General Ledger

o   Accounts Payable

o   Accounts Receivable

o   Fixed assets

  • Consulting experience
  • Implementation experience using M3 or equivalent software is highly desired
  • Fluent written and spoken German and English is mandatory 
  • Willingness to travel nationally and throughout Europe

description_html:
Job Location: Germany or Austria - home or office based.

The Senior Solution Consultant (SC) possesses deep knowledge of the capabilities included in Infor’s cloud-based, industry-specific enterprise software solutions. The SC provides both solution and industry expertise to Infor prospects and customers in support of driving license revenue and customer success. The SC uncovers the strategic objectives and business opportunities with prospect stakeholders during discovery and understands the key metrics driving the Infor solution evaluation. The SC leads solution presentations and demonstrations. As a senior member of the Solution Consulting team, you will work alongside colleagues from sales management and sales execution, product marketing, the services business unit, alliances, and value engineering, as well as, with non-Infor consulting partners to develop and execute compelling professional presentations. 

A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 

  • Primary responsibility for supporting the sales process and interacting with prospective customers through a variety of sales cycle activities, including: Request for Proposal processes, discovery sessions, executive overviews, scripted and non-scripted solution demonstrations, follow-up discussions and post-demonstration surveys. 
  • Work with account executives on sales opportunities, including: defining the solution scope, designing the account strategy, jointly preparing for prospect interactions. 
  • Lead solution demonstrations to prospects and customers that reinforce solution value at various audience levels, including executives, business users, and stakeholders, and positively influencing license deal pursuits and customer success. 
  • Transform the Solution Consulting community within Infor. Teamwork and continuous improvement are critical to the success of Solution Consulting. It is incumbent on every SC to contribute to the knowledge and content for the collective team. 
  • With the overall Solution Consulting team, participate in shared activities such as marketing events, value engineering engagements, trade shows, and other customer-facing activities, maintaining RFP response repositories, presentation collateral, and demo content. 

Basic Qualifications: 

  • At least 5 years of experience with ERP solutions; experience with other products such as CPQ or MES is welcome.
  • Strong understanding of discrete industries such as mechanical and plant engineering, high-tech /electronics, etc.
  • Solution-oriented mentality, ability to take on various tasks in a team, convincing presentation style, ability to argue the benefits.
  • Fluent German and English. In addition, other European languages would be an advantage.
  • Willingness to travel up to 50 %.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience supporting the sales process and interacting with prospective customers through a variety of sales cycle activities, including: Request for Proposal processes, discovery sessions, executive overviews, scripted and non-scripted solution demonstrations, follow-up discussions and post-demonstration surveys. 
  • Experience working with account executives on sales opportunities, including: defining the solution scope, designing the account strategy, jointly preparing for prospect interactions. 
  • Experience leading solution demonstrations to prospects and customers that reinforce solution value at various audience levels, including executives, business users, and stakeholders, and positively influencing license deal pursuits and customer success.

description_html:
The Senior Solution Architect at Infor is responsible for owning and leading the functional solution design across Infor applications, ensuring alignment with Infor's Cloud Suite off-the-shelf solutions and industry best practices. This role demands strategic oversight of solution architecture governance, minimal customization emphasis, and innovation embedding to drive maximal business value for clients. The Senior Solution Architect works collaboratively with client stakeholders, internal teams, and other architecture roles to deliver coherent scalable, and maintainable solutions

Functional Solution Design Ownership

  • Own the end-to-end functional solution design across one or more Infor applications, primarily focusing on fit to standard configurations that minimise extensions and customisations.
  • Ensure alignment of the solution design with industry best practices embedded within Infor’s Cloud Suite offerings
  • Shape and confirm the scope during sales and engagement phases, ensuring alignment to business outcomes and product roadmaps
  • Maintain design integrity through to cutover, protecting the reuse of standard configurations and challenging unnecessary customisations

      

Architecture Governance

  • Set and enforce product-fit design standards and architecture governance for the application stream
  • Approve configuration choices made by consultants, ensuring conformity with design principles and solution integrity
  • Collaborate with Technical Architects to define application level RICE Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, Enhancements and data requirements
  • Work with Enterprise and Industry Solution Architects to align application scope and maintain architectural consistency across the ecosystem

Innovation and Technology Enablement      

  • Identify and champion opportunities to embed AI, automation, and emerging technologies within solution designs to enhance business outcomes
  • Lead adoption of innovations that complement CloudSuites  standard processes and deliver measurable client value
  • Stay abreast of industry trends and Infors evolving technology capabilities to drive continuous solution improvement

Stakeholder Leadership and Team Coordination

  • Act as the primary architect for the application stream, especially for Edge (stand-alone) deployments owning full application architecture.
  • Collaborate with senior client stakeholders, guiding them on solution strategy and design decisions.
  • Lead and coordinate functional consultants and specialists, providing final decision-making authority on application design and scope.
  • Partner with sales, delivery, and customer success teams to ensure smooth transitions from engagement through to delivery and ongoing support.

Consultancy and Strategic Alignment

  • Support sales and engagement teams by validating solution fit and defining business benefits aligned with client strategy
  • Contribute to success roadmaps, benefits realization frameworks, and governance oversight to ensure delivery of promised business value
  • Apply Principle Based Management (PBM) principles Vision, Virtue & Talents, Knowledge, Comparative Advantage, Motivation in all aspects of solution architecture

      

 Risk Management and Quality Assurance

  • Identify architectural risks and manage change requests or deviations to maintain solution quality and client satisfaction
  • Ensure security, privacy, and compliance requirements are incorporated within solution designs
  • Develop roadmaps to migrate or extend solution components consistent with organizational strategy and cloud adoption plans

A day in the life typically includes

  • Lead the fit-to-standard solution design and scope shaping in collaboration with sales and delivery team
  • Govern configuration and design integrity, approving consultant work and minimizing customizations
  • Drive innovation through AI and new technology integration within solution designs
  • Manage relationships with senior stakeholders and coordinate multidisciplinary teams to ensure delivery success
  • Collaborate with technical and enterprise architects to ensure architectural consistency and data integration
  • Oversee risk management, compliance, and quality assurance in architectural decisions
  • Support benefits realization and articulate the business value of solutions aligned with client strategies

      

Basic Qualifications

  • Extensive experience in enterprise solution architecture, preferably within ERP or Cloud Suite environments
  • Strong functional knowledge of Infor applications and industry best practices
  • Proven ability to design fit-to-standard solutions minimizing customizations
  • Experience leading cross-functional teams and managing senior stakeholder relationships
  • Skilled in leveraging emerging technologies, including AI, to enhance solution value
  • Familiarity with SFIA skill framework and Principle Based Management (PBM)
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving abilities

      

Core Competencies

  • Functional and technical solution architecture
  • Architecture governance and standards enforcement
  • Client and stakeholder leadership
  • Innovation in solution design AI automation
  • Collaborative teamwork and cross-role partnership
  • Risk and quality management
  • Strategic alignment and benefits realization
  • Application of PBM principles to architecture and delivery
