description_html:
We are looking for a Senior HR Project Manager who is not only highly skilled but passionate about all things HR and driven to make meaningful change. This is a unique opportunity for a proactive leader who seizes opportunities to improve how we work, confidently challenges the status quo, and drives critical decisions that shape our HR initiatives and overall organizational success.

About the Role

As a Senior HR Project Manager, you will lead complex and high-impact projects that span multiple functions and geographies. You thrive in ambiguity and excel at breaking down large, complex topics into clear, actionable plans that rally teams and stakeholders behind shared goals. Your mindset is one of continuous improvement, and you’re fearless when it comes to questioning existing processes — even when that means challenging senior leadership — to unlock better solutions.

What Success Looks Like

· You are the driving force behind cross-functional HR projects, leading with clarity, decisiveness, and a focus on outcomes.

· You passionately advocate for HR best practices and innovation, constantly scanning for opportunities to enhance our people processes and experiences.

· You break down complexity by visualizing and communicating project roadmaps and deliverables in ways that engage and align diverse teams.

· You build strong partnerships across HR, Legal, Compliance, IT and beyond, influencing without authority to achieve shared success.

· You embrace risk thoughtfully, mitigate barriers proactively, and adapt plans dynamically to keep projects on course.

· You lead change management efforts with empathy and precision, enabling smooth adoption and sustained impact.

· You challenge norms constructively, pushing back thoughtfully on ideas or decisions that don’t serve the organization’s best interests — regardless of hierarchy.

· You mentor and coach others in project management and leadership, fostering a culture of growth and excellence.

Responsibilities

· Lead and own large-scale, complex HR projects that align tightly with Infor’s strategic vision and evolving business needs.

· Develop and execute detailed project plans, success metrics, enablement and communication strategies.

· Collaborate globally to define project scope, gather requirements, and secure stakeholder buy-in.

· Identify risks and opportunities early, crafting contingency plans and innovative solutions.

· Drive decisions, consistent project updates, and transparent communication with senior leaders and key stakeholders.

· Use project management tools and methodologies to monitor progress and ensure accountability.

· Advocate for continuous improvement, leading initiatives that refine HR processes and elevate operational effectiveness.

Basic Qualifications

· Demonstrated success leading enterprise-wide, global HR projects with measurable impact.

· Exceptional project management expertise paired with a passion for HR and organizational development.

· Strong business acumen

· Proven ability to simplify complex problems and present actionable solutions.

· Strong skills in data analysis and using HR metrics to inform decision-making.

· Courage and confidence to challenge assumptions and influence senior stakeholders constructively.

Preferred Qualifications

· Prior experience in HR roles such as HR Business Partner, HR Advisor, or HR Manager.

· Experience leading change management and organizational transformation initiatives.

· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills that inspire collaboration and trust.

description_html:
Join Our Growing Sales Desk Team as a Senior Sales Desk Representative!

At Infor, you’ll be part of a collaborative, customer-focused team that values accountability, proactivity, and innovation.
As a Senior Sales Desk Representative, you will not only deliver operational excellence — you’ll help shape the way we work, share best practices, and influence the transformation of the Sales Desk into a more strategic, customer-facing function. You will act as a bridge between operations and sales, playing a vital role in campaign execution, lead qualification, and end-to-end deal management. Through proactive communication, collaboration, and process optimization, you will help strengthen our customer-focused culture and position the Sales Desk as a true growth engine for Services.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:
• Leading execution of Services campaigns, including email outreach, follow-ups, and customer engagement.
• Preparing and validating target lists, campaign materials, and operational pre-work to ensure readiness.
• Performing lead pre-qualification and discovery to assess customer needs, fit, and timeline.
• Managing proactive outbound activities to drive pipeline creation and customer engagement.
• Ensuring accurate data tracking and opportunity management in CRM (SFDC).
• Managing smaller deals end-to-end — from opportunity creation and data collection to contract preparation and closure.
• Cooperating with cross-functional stakeholders (Operations, Services Delivery, Sales, Legal, RMO, Finance) to ensure smooth process execution.
• Providing timely, high-quality responses to inbound requests and maintaining strong customer satisfaction.
• Monitoring lead-to-opportunity conversion rates and ensuring consistent feedback loops to Sales.
• Supporting process improvements by identifying inefficiencies and suggesting enhancements.
• Contributing to the development of best practices, documentation, and training materials.
• Participating in enablement programs to continuously improve sales techniques, CRM usage, and service excellence.
• Promoting collaboration, ownership, and accountability within the Sales Desk team.

Basic Qualifications:
• Fluency in both German and English is required.
• Additional languages is a plus.
• Experience in Sales Desk, Sales Operations, or Inside Sales role.
• Proven track record in campaign execution, lead generation, and qualification.
• Knowledge of CRM systems (Salesforce preferred) and outreach tools.
• Excellent organizational, analytical, and administrative skills.
• High attention to detail and ability to maintain clean and accurate CRM data.
• Effective communication and collaboration skills across departments.
• Ability to work independently and take initiative in fast-paced environments.
• Customer-oriented mindset with a focus on quality, responsiveness, and results.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience mentoring or training other team members.
• Strong understanding of B2B sales and campaign management processes.
• Proven ability to identify and lead process improvement initiatives.
• Advanced Excel or reporting skills for pipeline monitoring.
• Experience working in a global or regional sales environment.
• Demonstrated success in managing multiple priorities with limited supervision.

description_html:
The Senior Full Stack Software Engineer works closely with Business Analysts, Product Owner, Product Managers, QA and Support teams to develop new functionality and provide an excellent experience for our customers and partners. Every member of the team plays a key role in maintaining the team's culture and benefits from an environment of collaboration and support.

 The successful candidate participates in the development of new software features, establishes new integrations, solves issues, and supports mutiple modernizations of the product. At this level, it’s expected the engineer can provide mentorship to less experienced team members within our Agile Scrum teams, and collaborate on architecture and design efforts.

Essential Duties:

  • Working within our agile scrum teams, alongside product owner, business analyst, developers, QA, scrum master.
  • Our teams are globally located and you may be working in teams with individuals from different time zones.
  • Leading the development of new features spanning client, server, and cloud components of the application stack.
  • Integrating third party libraries and services into the existing application.
  • Investigating customer-reported software issues, security vulnerabilities and improvements to resolve in a timely and effective manner. 
  • Involvement in all aspects of our Agile process including requirements analysis, backlog grooming, estimating, planning, daily standups, and retrospectives.
  • Writing UML in the form of class, sequence, flow, and activity diagrams.
  • Mentoring and supporting less experienced developers, both directly with code review and indirectly with advice and guidance.
  • Supporting the product owner in understanding the complexity of work, identifying constraints and dependencies and in estimating delivery timescales.
  • Working with architects and principal engineers to design features and functionality and to help to articulate the future direction of JavaScript, Java, and Cloud based software development, design principles and architecture.
  • Writing unit and integration tests for both client and server features using the most appropriate testing frameworks such as JUnit, Jest, Selenium, and Cucumber.


Basic Qualifications:

  • Strong Java software development (Java 8, J2EE), with in-depth understanding of the language.
  • Knowledge of modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries, JQuery, HTML and CSS.
  •  Experience working with the Spring framework and its ecosystem which is used extensively in our teams.
  • Strong OOP with some UML/Design Pattern exposure.
  •  Experience working in an Agile (pref. Scrum) and iterative development approach.
  •  Strong written and verbal communication skills in English. 
  • Enthusiasm and ability to collaborate well with others, including remote teams
  • Professional pride, drive and curiosity, a diligent self-starter that keeps up to date with the best practices and keeps your skill set sharp.
  •  Strong problem resolution skills


Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Deep knowledge of AWS services including but not limited to EC2, ECR, ECS, RDS, S3, DynamoDB, Lambda, API Gateway, SNS, SQS, Pinpoint, Event Bridge
  • Experience with our toolchain: Docker, IntelliJ IDEA, JUnit, Selenium, Ant, Maven, Git, Jira, Vue.js, Hibernate, PostgreSQL
  • Familiarity with design tools and principals and a desire to work with customers to describe their ideal user interfaces and experiences.
  • Strong ability to think through large abstract systems and processes, comfortable problem-solving and working with data.
  • Exposure to data analytics and reporting technologies with an understanding of database optimization and performance tuning.
  •  Awareness of security related best practices and the process of identifying, triaging, and resolving vulnerabilities within an application stack.

description_html:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een Senior Software Engineer voor het LN Cloud Automation Team, dat hybride-remote werkt vanuit ons kantoor in Barneveld, Nederland. Dit team is verantwoordelijk voor het uitrollen en beheren van LN CE in de AWS Cloud. Als Senior Software Engineer ontwikkel je nieuwe functionaliteit voor de Infor LN Cloud Automation, samen met een getalenteerd team. In deze sleutelrol werk je nauw samen met andere teams, zoals Engineers, Architecten, Cloud-Ops Engineers en Support, om nieuwe en bestaande software succesvol te ontwikkelen, te onderhouden, en te testen. Infor LN biedt klanten in de discrete maakindustrie uitgebreide mogelijkheden om hun bedrijfsprocessen te optimaliseren en efficiënter te werken. Meer informatie over Infor LN vind je hier: https://www.infor.com/solutions/erp/ln

Een werkdag ziet er doorgaans zo uit:

  • Ontwikkelen van nieuwe functionaliteit voorde Infor LN Cloud Automation
  • Onderhouden van bestaande functionaliteit 
  • Testen van wijzigingen in AWS Cloud 
  • Opstellen van documentatie 
  • Intensief samenwerken met Software Engineers, Architecten, CloudOps Engineers en Support

Minimale vereisten:

  • Bachelor diploma of vergelijkbaar opleidingsniveau 
  • Besturingssystemen: Windows Server, Linux - SQL en databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL) 
  • Kennis en ervaring met AWS-infrastructuurdiensten en API’s 
  • Scripting (powershell, python) 
  • Samenwerkingsgericht binnen het team 
  • In staat om zelfstandig te werken binnen het team 
  • Goede beheersing van de Engelse én Nederlandse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk

Wat geeft je een voorsprong?

  • Pluspunten als je technische en/of ontwikkelkennis hebt van Infor LN 
  • Bereidheid om nieuwe programmeertalen te leren (zoals LN 4GL)

description_html:
Job location: DACH region – home or office based

As a Senior Solution Consultant, you will be a strategic advisor and trusted partner to prospective customers and internal stakeholders in the ERP Finance are. You will play a pivotal role in delivering compelling solution strategies, showcasing the value of Infor’s cloud-based offerings, and ensuring alignment with customers’ industry-specific business goals. This role demands advanced/expert level knowledge of Finance processes, a deep understanding of enterprise software solutions, industry best practices, and the ability to translate complex challenges into clear, achievable outcomes using Infor technology. You will lead the solution vision in strategic sales opportunities and provide mentorship to other consultants across the region. As a Senior Solution Consultant, you will often be working alongside colleagues from other functional disciplines including Industry Solutions, Value Engineering, Consulting Services in a multi-functional team. Therefore, being a team player is a key part of the role.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
  • Be the financial solution architect on sales opportunities, responsible for the overall financial solution and approach, whilst aligning with the sales team and supporting the value case.
  • Support sales cycle through deliver inspiring and engaging presentations covering all aspects of our capabilities. When needed contributing to RFx responses.
  • Provide relevant solution consulting support for marketing events/conferences.
  • Collaborate with account teams to plan account strategies and market approaches.
  • Participate in demo system design and planning and assist in configuration if needed. • Serve as a champion for assigned industry-based product functionality and share knowledge with colleagues.

What You Will Need:
  • The ideal candidate will possess a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in Finance, Accounting, Business Management or other relevant disciplines.
  • Experience in Cloud-based Enterprise Software applications/solutions. Knowledge of Infor LN is a distinct advantage.
  • Proven experience of solution consulting, although relevant product knowledge from an implementation or project related perspective will be considered.
  • Good understanding of typical operational and financial business processes and requirements, preferably in key industries such as Distribution and Food & Beverage.
  • Good leadership, collaboration and mentoring skills will be required to help contribute to account/opportunity strategies.
  • Open to learning new technologies and interested how to apply these in a business context.
  • Outstanding presentation and communication skills.
  • Fluency in English and German, both verbal and written

description_html:
Senior TPM Consultant (Trade Promotion Management)
Drive end-to-end TPM implementations for consumer goods clients as a Functional Consultant. Lead requirements and testing, translate business processes into configuration, and partner with technical teams for successful go-lives and adoption. Client-facing role across UK/EU with periodic travel; we value ownership, pragmatism, and a collaborative, customer‑centric approach.

A Day in the Life (Typically Includes)

  • Own delivery from initiation through go-live and hypercare in TPM projects.
  • Facilitate requirements workshops with commercial, finance and IT stakeholders.
  • Design/document end-to-end process maps aligned to TPM best practices.
  • Translate business needs into configuration, integration and data specifications.
  • Plan/manage testing: test plans, test cases, UAT, defect triage.
  • Collaborate on integrations, data models, analytics and backend structures.
  • Support data migration, validation, cutover and post go-live support.
  • Manage multiple concurrent implementations and stakeholder expectations.
  • Drive change management and capability building for confident adoption.
  • Act as trusted advisor; identify follow-on opportunities with Commercial.

Basic Qualifications

  • 5+ years in consulting, software implementation, or relevant consumer goods commercial/IT roles.
  • Enterprise/SaaS implementation experience.
  • Requirements-gathering facilitation and functional documentation.
  • Process design skills (mapping; translating processes into system design).
  • Testing experience (test plans, UAT, defect management).
  • Ability to engage in technical topics (integrations, data flows, analytics, backend structures).
  • Experience managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders.
  • Strong communication and influencing skills with senior client stakeholders.
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented; independent, proactive problem solver.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Direct TPM implementation experience.
  • TPM delivery for consumer goods/FMCG clients.
  • Client-side TPM exposure (sales, revenue management, finance, IT).
  • Understanding of trade pricing structures and promotional processes.

Title: Software Engineer (Java)

Experience: 4 - 5 Years.

Location: Hyderabad

Education: Bachelor’s/ master’s degree in CSE/IT.

Position Summary:

Infor is seeking a Java Software Engineer to join the Compass - IDF Common Components team, responsible for developing, enhancing, and supporting the IDF Framework, the primary transaction interface for Infor ERP-XA and a key inquiry tool for several other Infor ERP products. The engineer will focus on development projects, product enhancements, and warranty fixes within the IDF codebase. The role also supports ongoing modernization initiatives, including work on automation and CI/CD processes.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and debug frameworks that enable application developers to build and maintain software applications.
  • Take ownership of warranty defects, ensuring timely resolution in line with SLA targets, proactively raising blockers, and driving issues to closure until fully resolved.
  • Write and create design specifications and technical documentation.
  • Develop enhancements to existing Framework components to improve functionality and performance.
  • Conduct unit testing to validate defect fixes, enhancements, and new features.
  • Collaborate with Product Managers and Architects to understand requirements and technical designs, actively contributing to the implementation and delivery of new development projects.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement fixes and new requirements.
  • Provide technical expertise and work closely with QA, support, and infrastructure teams on defect resolution and enhancements.
  • Research product functionalities, new technologies, and third-party software to identify opportunities for product improvement.
  • Estimate, prioritize, and refine tasks during Sprint Planning to ensure smooth development execution.
  • Assist with automation and CI/CD improvements to support IDF development processes.
  • Support source control management, migrations, or repository updates as needed.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s/ master’s degree, preferably in computer science, or a related technical field.
  • 4–5 years of software development experience with strong proficiency in Core Java (Java 8 and above, including features from Java 11/17) and modern Java programming concepts.
  • Strong understanding of Core Java, including OOP principles, collections, multithreading, exception handling, and familiarity with modern Java features.
  • Strong Experience with one or more IDEs (Eclipse, Visual Studio Code, IntelliJ, etc.).
  • Good knowledge of SQL and comfortable integrating queries with Java using JDBC
  • Experience with one or more Version Control Systems (Git, SVN, etc.).
  • Proficient in writing clean, maintainable, and secure code, with knowledge of Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SSDLC) principles.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, build automation, and development tools
  • Effective time management and task prioritization, capability to handle simultaneous projects, to work independently and to deliver good quality products under strict deadlines.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with middleware/application servers such as Jetty, WebSphere, or Tomcat.
  • Familiarity with Jenkins, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML, and JSON.
  • Working knowledge of IBM i, Windows, and Unix/Linux environments
  • Experience with IBM i-based ERP or other ERP products is a plus.

Job Summary :

·       The requested role is critical to maintaining continuity and technical stability in our CRM product suite. 

·       The existing resource being replaced has been responsible for  .NET development and maintenance of core backend modules that directly support key product functionalities. 

·       This role also involves expertise in database and data warehouse design, schema or data modeling (like ERWIN), and ETL job management, which are essential for ensuring data integrity and performance across client implementations.

·       Replacing this position will ensure uninterrupted product support, ongoing enhancements, and sustained delivery of customer commitments in alignment with our overall business plan.

  • Collaborates closely with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, reliable, and maintainable CRM product solutions.
  • Ensures backend systems and data processes align with product roadmap and overall business objectives.

Software Engineer

Location: Hyderabad, India

About the Role

We are looking for a skilled Software Engineer to join the AIris engineering team. AIris is Infor’s GenAI-powered centralized knowledge hub designed to integrate, understand, and surface insights from diverse content sources. This role will focus on building scalable integrations, exploring GenAI capabilities, and contributing to the technical foundation of a strategic, high-impact platform.

You will work closely under the guidance of a team leader and collaborate across cross-functional engineering groups within Infor’s GenAI and Infor OS ecosystems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop scalable integration solutions leveraging Infor GenAI, Infor OS, and AWS technologies.
  • Research, design, and build proof-of-concepts (POCs) to enable GenAI capabilities on various enterprise content sources.
  • Write clear and comprehensive technical documentation, architectural notes, and design specifications.
  • Follow engineering best practices, including high-quality coding, testing, and deployment standards.
  • Actively collaborate as a team player, supporting peers across development, architecture, DevOps, and product teams.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement of processes, tools, and code quality.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Minimum 3 years of professional software development experience using Python.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) principles and software design patterns.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience working with AWS services (Lambda, S3, API Gateway, Step Functions, IAM, etc.) is a significant advantage.

Preferred Skills (Nice to Have)

  • Experience with GenAI, LLMs, RAG, or vector databases.
  • Background in building integration frameworks or developing platform-level services.
Knowledge of asynchronous processing, microservices, and API-driven architectures.

We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Software Engineer to join our innovative team developing the Infor Mongoose platform. Mongoose is Infor’s rapid application development platform, enabling our application teams to build business applications rapidly. As part of our highly energetic team, you will contribute to the design and development of this SaaS product, using an engineering approach to tackle challenging problems.

As a Software Engineer, you will work under the guidance of technical leads and senior team members to contribute to developing high-quality software solutions. This role offers an excellent opportunity to grow your skills and career in a collaborative and supportive environment.

description_html:
Job Summary

We are seeking a Generative AI / AI-ML Developer with 2–3 years of experience to support the development of AI-powered enterprise solutions using Large Language Models (LLMs) and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). The role focuses on building proof of concepts, AI-driven workflows, and delivering practical, business-focused GenAI solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze business requirements and identify suitable GenAI and RAG use cases.
  • Prepare and process structured and unstructured data for LLM-based applications.
  • Build and support RAG pipelines, including chunking, embeddings, and retrieval.
  • Design, test, and refine prompts and LLM workflows.
  • Apply basic ML, DL, and NLP concepts while developing AI solutions.
  • Validate GenAI outputs using sample test cases and simple evaluation techniques.
  • Develop proof of concepts (PoCs) to demonstrate technical feasibility.
  • Collaborate with backend and frontend teams to integrate GenAI features.
  • Continuously improve accuracy and reduce hallucinations through iteration.

Required Qualifications

  • 2–3 years of experience in AI/ML development or software engineering.
  • Strong understanding of:
    • Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and NLP fundamentals
    • Generative AI concepts, LLMs, and prompt engineering
    • RAG architectures, embeddings, and vector search
  • Proficiency in Python; basic familiarity with SQL.
  • Experience working with structured and unstructured data.
  • Basic exposure to frameworks like LangChain.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI/ML, Data Science, or a related field.

Value-Added / Nice to Have

  • Experience with LLM evaluation or observability tools (e.g., LangSmith).
  • Exposure to agent-based patterns (e.g., ReAct, DeepAgents).
  • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure).
  • Familiarity with PyTorch or TensorFlow.
  • Experience with enterprise AI use cases such as search and automation, with exposure to modern agent-based GenAI patterns, including MCP-based tool integrations.
  • Certifications or coursework in Generative AI, NLP, or Deep Learning.

description_html:
We are looking for an Deployment Engineer (Cloud Services & Solutions) who will work as part of our Velocity Ops (Velops) deployment team. The role focuses on software deployments, environment handling, and release management across multiple customer tenants. This is not a traditional DevOps role, but prior exposure to deployments is beneficial.

The ideal candidate is someone early in their career (1–2 years experience), preferably with exposure to In4 OS, RPA, or cloud deployment activities, and strong problem‑solving ability.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform software deployments across multiple cloud environments (In4 OS, multi‑tenant/single‑tenant cloud systems).
  • Analyze deployment issues, troubleshoot, and coordinate with solution owners and internal teams.
  • Manage release activities, environment readiness, and deployment documentation.
  • Work closely with PMO and Advanced Services teams for smooth deployment execution.
  • Maintain clear and accurate documentation for all deployment activities.
  • Collaborate with senior engineers and contribute to process improvements/innovations over time.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • 1–2 years (max 2–3 years) of experience in:
    • Software deployments
    • Release management
    • Environment handling
  • Strong problem‑solving and analytical skills.
  • Good understanding of:
    • CI/CD pipelines
    • Basic DevOps concepts
    • Scripting / basic programming for analysis
  • Exposure to RPA concepts (preferred, not mandatory).
  • Familiarity with SDLC processes.
  • Strong communication and documentation skills for internal stakeholder interaction.

Nice-to-Have Skills

  • Experience with In4 OS ecosystem.
  • Experience in deployment tools or cloud environments.
  • Exposure to automation or RPA tools.

Who Can Apply

  • External candidates with 1–2 years relevant deployment exposure.

Role Expectations

  • Hands‑on role involving multiple deployment activities daily.
  • Ability to learn quickly from senior engineers and transition into handling deployments independently.
  • Commitment to accuracy, quality, and readiness to work in a structured deployment environment.

Why Join This Team

  • Structured learning and growth with guidance from experienced deployment engineers.
  • Opportunity to eventually contribute to team innovations after mastering core deployment responsibilities.
  • Work environment focused on collaboration, process discipline, and continuous improvement.

description_html:
Infor is looking for an experienced Team Leader to join the Infor Data Fabric development team. The Infor Data Fabric is a cloud data storage and query platform which provides capabilities to store petabytes of data and subsequent rapid query and analytics capabilities. Infor Data Fabric platform is tightly integrated with Infor Data Lake, consuming big data from all of Infor’s business applications, especially ERP systems. Data Fabric stores, queries, extracts, and keeps cloud data secure for thousands of customers in real-time. You will be involved in all aspects of software development and have room to grow professionally.

Required skills:

Experience : 7-10 Years

Looking for candidate who has experience in leading a team.

· Extensive Java development experience and demonstrable understanding of Spring framework.

· Experience with Web Services development (RESTful APIs, SaaS).

· Considers and treats unit-testing as an intrinsic part of development.

· Experience with Java development tooling (Java 17+ SDK, Git, Maven, Gradle).

· Experience with contemporary SDLC – Git Flow, merge requests, code review, CICD.

Preferred Qualifications:

· AWS cloud services (DynamoDB, KMS, OpenSearch, Kinesis, S3, SQS, Aurora, and others)

· SQL, GraphQL, Kotlin, Scala, Python

· SOLID programming, pair programming

· Kubernetes deployment, Docker images, AWS CLI

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

As a team leader, you’re responsible for guiding your team in delivering high-quality software. You will work within a multidisciplinary agile development team, collaborating closely with other software engineers, QA engineers, architects, and business analysts. You will help define tasks and priorities, ensuring that your team has clear direction and support, rather than just waiting for tasks to be assigned.

In this role, you will be accountable for both your deliverables and the overall success of the team. You will foster collaboration and communication within the team, encouraging knowledge sharing and growth while also taking an active role in mentoring and supporting your colleagues.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Senior Software Engineer to join our growing Infor OS (Infor Operating Service) organization.  Infor OS is a foundational cloud platform that provides horizontal technology services across all of Infor’s Cloudsuites.

You would be joining a dynamic, fast-paced, cross-functional team composed of business analysts, developers, architects, product owners and quality assurance analysts delivering a portfolio of world-class products.  We offer an Agile environment in which you can work on challenging problems that that will keep you engaged and learning all the time. Title: Software Engineer, Senior (Java)

Experience: 6 - 8 Years.

Location: Hyderabad

Education: Bachelor’s/ master’s degree in CSE/IT.

Position Summary:

Infor is seeking a Java Software Engineer to join the Compass - IDF Common Components team, responsible for developing, enhancing, and supporting the IDF Framework, the primary transaction interface for Infor ERP-XA and a key inquiry tool for several other Infor ERP products. The engineer will focus on development projects, product enhancements, and warranty fixes within the IDF codebase. The role also supports ongoing modernization initiatives, including work on automation and CI/CD processes.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and debug frameworks that enable application developers to build and maintain software applications.
  • Take ownership of warranty defects, ensuring timely resolution in line with SLA targets, proactively raising blockers, and driving issues to closure until fully resolved.
  • Write and create design specifications and technical documentation.
  • Develop enhancements to existing Framework components to improve functionality and performance.
  • Conduct unit testing to validate defect fixes, enhancements, and new features.
  • Collaborate with Product Managers and Architects to understand requirements and technical designs, actively contributing to the implementation and delivery of new development projects.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement fixes and new requirements.
  • Provide technical expertise and work closely with QA, support, and infrastructure teams on defect resolution and enhancements.
  • Research product functionalities, new technologies, and third-party software to identify opportunities for product improvement.
  • Estimate, prioritize, and refine tasks during Sprint Planning to ensure smooth development execution.
  • Assist with automation and CI/CD improvements to support IDF development processes.
  • Support source control management, migrations, or repository updates as needed.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s/ master’s degree, preferably in computer science, or a related technical field.
  • 4–5 years of software development experience with strong proficiency in Core Java (Java 8 and above, including features from Java 11/17) and modern Java programming concepts.
  • Strong understanding of Core Java, including OOP principles, collections, multithreading, exception handling, and familiarity with modern Java features.
  • Strong Experience with one or more IDEs (Eclipse, Visual Studio Code, IntelliJ, etc.).
  • Good knowledge of SQL and comfortable integrating queries with Java using JDBC
  • Experience with one or more Version Control Systems (Git, SVN, etc.).
  • Proficient in writing clean, maintainable, and secure code, with knowledge of Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SSDLC) principles.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, build automation, and development tools
  • Effective time management and task prioritization, capability to handle simultaneous projects, to work independently and to deliver good quality products under strict deadlines.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with middleware/application servers such as Jetty, WebSphere, or Tomcat.
  • Familiarity with Jenkins, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML, and JSON.
  • Working knowledge of IBM i, Windows, and Unix/Linux environments
  • Experience with IBM i-based ERP or other ERP products is a plus.

Functieomschrijving

Infor LN is een van de belangrijkste applicaties van Infor en dé ERP-oplossing voor diverse complexe productiebedrijven. Door de aanhoudende groei van onze ontwikkelactiviteiten zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste

C/C++ Software Engineer

Samen met een multidisciplinair team van ervaren collega’s ontwikkel je het Runtime-platform van het Infor LN-product. Het Runtime-platform wordt wereldwijd door elke Infor LN-gebruiker gebruikt, zowel on-premise als in de Cloud. Het platform implementeert een virtuele runtime-laag waarmee de Infor LN-applicatie op meerdere besturingssystemen en databases kan draaien. Gebruiksvriendelijkheid en kwaliteit van het product staan altijd voorop. Je bent betrokken bij alle aspecten van het ontwikkelproces en krijgt ruimte om jezelf professioneel te ontwikkelen.

Een werkdag ziet er doorgaans zo uit:

  • Ontwikkelen van nieuwe functionaliteit in het Infor LN Runtime-platform 
  • Onderhouden van bestaande functionaliteit 
  • Afronden van softwarewijzigingen met het ontwikkelen van geautomatiseerde regressietests en documentatie 
  • Intensief samenwerken met Business Analisten, Product Architecten en andere Software Engineers 
  • Ondersteunen van Quality Assurance Engineers en Support Analisten

Minimale vereisten:

  • Bachelor diploma of vergelijkbaar opleidingsniveau 
  • Kennis van C en C++, inclusief systeemprogrammering (zoals signals, shared memory, netwerken) 
  • Besturingssystemen: Windows Server en diverse Unix/Linux-varianten 
  • SQL en databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL)

description_html:
We are seeking a skilled .NET Developer with a strong inclination towards DevOps practices to join our dynamic team. You will help define our next-generation CI/CD pipeline, providing application infrastructure fixes and improvements while working with key stakeholders throughout the enterprise to deliver multi-tenant applications to customers in the cloud. You will be part of a tight-knit team that moves fast and learns new skills daily.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with the Cloud-Ops team to improve the application deployment process.
  • Implement fixes related to application deployment in cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Architect, design, and support continuous integration and delivery pipelines.
  • Drive technical innovation and efficiency in cloud infrastructure operations via automation.
  • Provide technical support to development and QA teams.
  • Ensure smooth coordination and alignment across departments.
  • Maintain and optimize development environments to ensure stability and scalability.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure, application, and performance issues.
  • Implement alerting mechanisms to notify the team about critical issues in real-time.
  • Implement vulnerability scanning and security best practices across DevOps environments.
  • Ensure compliance with security standards and practices.

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
  •  years of relevant experience in .NET programming.
  • Working experience with .NET programming.
  • Knowledge of developing and consuming REST APIs.
  • Proficiency in Git for version control.
  • Proficiency in Linux and Windows operating systems for troubleshooting.
  • Experience with MSSQL and NoSQL databases like MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and Redis.
  • Familiarity with agile work management principles and tools.
  • Strong understanding of vulnerability management and security best practices.
  • Proficiency in Python, PowerShell, and shell scripting for automation.

Good-to-Have Skills:

  • Knowledge of AWS services (VPC, VPN, Security Groups, Subnets, EKS, EC2, ELB, RDS, Route53, GuardDuty, ECS, DynamoDB, S3, IAM, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, AWS CLI, API Gateway, ECR).
  • Proficiency with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools.
  • Proficiency in Jenkins/GitLab CI/CD pipelines.
  • Familiarity with monitoring tools like Grafana and Sumologic.

Preferred Skills:

  • Advanced job-related certifications preferred but not required.
  • Persistent desire to innovate, automate, and continually improve processes.
  • Capacity to take initiative and be a self-starter.
  • Effective time management and prioritization skills.
  • Ability to think and react positively and professionally when faced with obstacles.
  • Strong written, visual, and verbal communication skills.
  • Team player who can work effectively and collaborate on projects in a remote setup.
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills and attention to detail.
  • Willingness to join calls during late office hours to overlap with the US team.

description_html:
Senior iOS Engineer (6-7 year's experience)

 

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Senior iOS Engineer to join our Infor OS Platform Team. In this role, you will lead the development of a native iOS application that integrates with the Infor OS Notification Center, enhancing how users interact with alerts, tasks, and messages on iPhones and iPads. You will be responsible for designing and building intuitive, high-performance apps for iPhones and iPads.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and build advanced iOS applications using Swift, SwiftUI, and Objective-C.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and launch new features.
  • Identify and resolve performance issues and bottlenecks.
  • Ensure adherence to Apple’s design guidelines and best practices.
  • Integrate with backend services and RESTful APIs.
  • Handle app deployments to the App Store and enterprise distribution channels.
  • Implement push notifications, background services, and cloud messaging.
  • Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and agile ceremonies.
  • Set technical direction and choose appropriate tools, frameworks, and libraries.
  • Take end-to-end ownership of project delivery.
  • Identifying potential problems and resolving application bottlenecks.
  • Continuously improve application performance and user experience.
  • Stay current with the latest iOS development trends and practices.

Requirements:

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 6–7 years of experience in native iOS application development.
  • Proficiency in Swift, SwiftUI, and Objective-C.
  • Strong knowledge of iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
  • Experience integrating apps with backend services and APIs.
  • Understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines.
  • Familiarity with Git, SVN, and CI/CD tools.
  • Experience with push notifications and cloud messaging.
  • Hands-on experience in App Store deployment and internal distribution.
  • Android development knowledge is a plus.
  • Understanding of the mobile development life cycle.
  • Proficiency in design pattern like MVC and MVVM.

Preferred Qualifications

·       Experience with enterprise mobile applications or ERP systems.

·       Familiarity with Infor OS, Infor Go, or similar enterprise platforms.

·       Exposure to push notification frameworks and background services.

·      Understanding of Infor ION, IDM, and workflow/event monitoring systems.

description_html:
We are looking for a versatile and enthusiastic developer to join our team with a focus on web development and REST APIs. You'll be the architect of our future, focused on the tricky, rewarding work of building frameworks that our entire engineering team depends on. Naturally, this includes top-notch web development and designing rock-solid REST APIs.

Beyond that foundational work, where's the fun? Tell us! We are committed to tailoring the rest of the role to fit your skills and interests, whether it be in CI/CD, deployment automation, or observability engineering.

This is an opportunity to join the internationally distributed OS Portal team, collaborating daily with colleagues in India, Sweden, and the United States. Bring your expertise to a global environment where hard work is valued, and a collaborative, positive team culture is paramount.

 A Day in The Life Typically Includes

  • Designing and implementing scalable REST APIs using Java and Spring Boot.
  • Developing responsive web interfaces using Angular and TypeScript.
  • Building frameworks and reusable components for web client development.
  • Collaborating with global team members across Sweden, India, and the US to to deliver cloud-native solutions with high availability and performance.
  • Participating in code reviews and promoting best practices for maintainable and testable code.
  • Leveraging Amazon Q and other generative AI tools to accelerate development workflows, enhance code quality, and streamline decision-making across the SDLC.

What You Will Need

  • Proven experience in Java, Spring Boot, Angular, and TypeScript.
  • Strong understanding of RESTful API design, security and development.
  • Experience building and maintaining APIs consumed by other services in a microservice environment.
  • Hands-on experience with AWS services like ECS, S3, CloudFormation, and IAM.
  • Ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.

description_html:
Infor, a multinational cloud computing software company, is seeking a Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack) to build scalable, cloudnative solutions in support of our public health and healthcare customers. You will join a cross functional team responsible for the full software development lifecycle—from design and implementation through deployment and operations. 

You will work across the stack, effectively using modern frontend and backend technologies, frameworks, and third-party services to deliver secure, resilient, and maintainable applications. You should be a strong collaborator with a practical sense for usability and visual design, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, distributed environment. As part of a small, focused engineering team, you will have significant influence over architecture, feature scope, and design decisions.  

The Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack) will use technologies and languages such as Java, Python, and JavaScript/TypeScript to develop user-facing applications backed by secure, performant APIs and largescale data platforms. You will help evolve Infor Population Health Analytics (IPHA) solutions as cloudnative, observable, and easy to operate at scale in support of critical public health workloads. 

A Day In A Life Typically Looks Like:

  • Partner with product managers, architects, and business analysts to design secure, scalable, and cloudnative solutions that address real-world public health and healthcare use cases. 
  • Work independently on large and/or complex problems, using sound judgment and multifactor analysis to identify options and recommend approaches. 
  • Design and implement clean, testable code across the client and server, including professional quality technical documentation. 
  • Apply superior judgment when evaluating design tradeoffs, selecting tools and techniques, and balancing delivery speed with long-term maintainability. 
  • Build and maintain comprehensive automated tests; troubleshoot, optimize, and upgrade software to ensure responsiveness, reliability, and performance. 
  • Develop and operate well-structured services and applications that work with very large datasets on modern data platforms. 
  • Collaborate effectively with remote and cross-timezone teams, contributing to a culture of transparency, ownership, and continuous improvement. 
  • Contribute code reviews, technical design discussions, and shared engineering standards across the IPHA portfolio. 


What You Will Need:

  • Proven experience as a Full Stack Engineer in building and operating production web applications. 
  • 5+ years of professional software development experience. 

Strong proficiency in: 

  • Java and/or Python for backend services. 
  • Node.js and a modern frontend framework (e.g., Angular) with TypeScript. 
  • Shell scripting and development in a Linux environment. 
  • Superior organizational, communication, teamwork, and analytical skills, with the ability to break down complex problems and propose pragmatic solutions. 

What Will Put You Ahead: (nice-to-have)

  • Experience in healthcare or public health, including familiarity with healthcare messaging and interoperability standards (e.g., HL7, FHIR, X12) and their practical uses. 
  • Experience with multiple backend languages (e.g., C#, Java, C++) and modern frontend frameworks and tools (e.g., Angular, React, Node.js, Bootstrap, HTML, XSLT, CSS), as well as serverless or event driven architectures. 
  • Handson experience with Java/J2EE and the Spring Boot framework building RESTful APIs and microservices. 
  • Familiarity with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., Postgres, MySQL, MongoDB), application and web servers (e.g., Apache, Tomcat), and UI/UX best practices. 
  • Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, AWS Developer, or other Cloud platform equivalent. 
  • Proficiency with AWS services, such as EKS or ECS, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, CloudFormation (or similar IaC technologies), and related monitoring/observability tools. 
  • Strong understanding of cloud security best practices for identity and access management, monitoring and logging, networking, encryption, secure communication, and secure data storage—especially in regulated or sensitive data environments.

description_html:
Join Infor as a Principal Solution Architect for Infor Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), leading a team of consultants delivering implementations to manufacturing clients across diverse industries. You’ll bring knowledge of warehouse business processes and apply your expertise to configure and optimize the Infor WMS application to meet client needs. Your primary focus will be guiding customers through the implementation journey, helping them adopt and maximize the value of Infor’s WMS solution.


A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Act in a consulting role on assigned projects.
  • Provide in-depth application and business consultation in targeted processes.
  •  Analyze customers' business requirements objectives and develops business processes to meet customers' business needs. Model to-be business processes in the Infor application. Document and communicate the planned use of the Infor application.
  •  Apply Infor implementation methodology and assist customers in using available tools to deploy the Infor solution efficiently.
  •  Prepare weekly status reports for Infor and client project management.
  •  Work as an integral part of the project team – coordinating activities with Infor project manager and working effectively with customer and Infor team members of all levels.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience with WMS software applications.
  • Experience with warehouse activities: Receiving, Putaway, Order Selection, Replenishment, Inventory Control, Shipping and warehouse business processes.
  • Experience with the process of warehouse logistics.
  • Experience with process analysis, design, and documentation of warehouse business processes.
  • Experience in guiding clients through decision-making by presenting solution options based on system capabilities and business impact.
  • Willingness to travel throughout North America (US and Canada) 50% or more.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Infor WMS implementation experience (WM 4000, WM 9, SCE) or enterprise warehouse application knowledge.
  • Warehouse management experience.
  • Knowledge of WMS data structures, APIs, and integration patterns.
  • Experience with 3rd party logistics, manufacturing, CPG, or retail disciplines.

Location: US Remote (Dallas, TX and Atlanta, GA)

description_html:
Lead Consultant / Solution Architect ESG Solutions - EMEA region

Job location: Europe - office or home based 

Infor is a forward-thinking technology company dedicated to developing innovative software solutions that address the challenges businesses face in meeting managing their sustainability strategies and meeting environmental compliance requirements.

The ESG Lead Consultant is a newly created role dedicated to design and execute Infor’s Service Offering for ESG and sustainability solutions (https://www.infor.com/solutions/sustainability-esg)

You will play a pivotal role in driving the Service Team together with other Infor stakeholders for our future innovation and the success and adoption of our ESG solutions in the market.

As you have already experience in designing and implementing CPM (Corporate Performance Management) solutions, you will be able to transfer Infor new sustainable software application into CPM business processes and solutions.

The role includes designing and implementing such solutions but also supporting sales processes, designing architecture and providing estimates based on defined scope.

You will be engaged in all stages in the project life-cycle including hands-on application design and development. This is a client facing role and you will need excellent communication skills. In terms of development, you will be responsible for specifying, designing and implementing solutions within a team.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Design, implement and lead the implementation projects of Infor ESG solutions
  • Support sales process, work with customers on their requirements, define scope and provide estimates
  • Work with Infor stakeholders on new ESG service offering
  • Be the subject matter experts within the Infor EMEA Service Organisation and coach the team on the topic of ESG. Share and develop knowledge and expertise across the team to become more effective and deliver customer success.
Requirements:
  • Domain knowledge preferably gained as a Consultant or Solution Architect with knowledge in the areas of environmental & regulatory compliance
  • Knowledge of technology application solutions that address ESG/sustainability
  • Proven Professional Services experience designing and implementing performance management software for customers and knowledge of related business processes
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong decision making, judgment and analytical skills
  • Demonstrates ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional virtual teams

description_html:
Infor is seeking a Solution Consultant (Presales) with enthusiasm for the Discrete Manufacturing industry and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems to join our Japan team. This role offers hands-on experience in presales consulting, supporting sales opportunities by delivering value-driven demonstrations of Infor CloudSuite solutions, while collaborating with sales, consulting, and partner teams to drive customer success.
As a Solution Consultant, you will act as a supporting advisor, building your Discrete Manufacturing industry and ERP expertise to articulate business value and contribute to strategic engagements. This position is ideal for motivated individuals with positive energy, drive, and a passion for learning and the Discrete Manufacturing industry sector. Infor provides a comprehensive training program to develop necessary skills over time, fostering growth within the team.

Essential Duties
• Solution Demonstrations & Presentations:
o Support the delivery of compelling, tailored demonstrations of Infor CloudSuite solutions, focusing on automotive-specific processes such as supply chain, manufacturing, procurement, and quality management.
o Assist in presenting to diverse audiences, including end-users, management, and C-level executives, both remotely and in-person, showcasing standard industry capabilities and tailored POC scenarios as needed.
o Help differentiate Infor’s solutions from competitors by highlighting unique value propositions and business outcomes.
• Customer Engagement & Strategy:
o Participate in discovery sessions to uncover customer business needs, strategic objectives, and key metrics driving solution evaluations.
o Assist in translating customer requirements into detailed technical offerings, proposals, and strategic technology roadmaps aligned with Infor solutions.
o Collaborate with account executives to support account strategies, scope solutions, and prepare for prospect interactions.
• Team Collaboration:
o Work closely with senior solution consultants, sales, consulting, product marketing, and value engineering teams to develop and execute compelling presentations and demonstrations.
o Contribute to the transition from sales to implementation by assisting in creating high-level project blueprints and delivery roadmaps that align with customer goals.
• Value Selling & Configuration:
o Support value assessments to identify and quantify customer-specific business benefits, aligning these insights with tailored presentations and demonstrations to showcase Infor CloudSuite’s value.
o Configure demo instances for proof-of-concept (POC) scenarios to demonstrate the feasibility and business impact of Infor solutions.
o Stay updated on upcoming product functionality, enhance demonstration environments, and share configurations with the Solution Consulting team.
o Assist in providing technical, product, and non-functional responses for RFIs and RFPs, emphasizing value-driven solutions.
• Continuous Improvement & Knowledge Sharing:
o Contribute to the Solution Consulting community by helping maintain RFP response repositories, presentation collateral, and demo content.
o Participate in marketing events, trade shows, and value engineering engagements to promote Infor’s automotive solutions.
o Engage in continuous learning and improvement by sharing knowledge and best practices with the team.
• Travel & Flexibility:
o Travel as required within Japan and occasionally internationally for customer engagements, team collaboration, and professional development.

Basic qualifications
• Industry Exposure:
o Some exposure to the Discrete Manufacturing industry, across functions such as supply chain, manufacturing, procurement, or quality management (ideal but not required).
o Basic understanding of automotive-specific business processes and challenges.
• ERP & Technical Skills:
o 3-5 years of relevant experience, with some exposure to ERP systems (e.g., Infor CloudSuite, Oracle, SAP, or similar enterprise applications).
o Basic technical understanding of cloud concepts, software platforms, and technical architecture.
o Willingness to gain hands-on experience configuring demo instances for enterprise-level software applications.
• Presales Experience:
o Entry-level experience in presales, solution consulting, or related roles, supporting sales cycles for enterprise software.
o Positive energy, drive, and passion for the automotive industry and continuous learning.
o Ability to contribute to team efforts and grow into a trusted advisor role.
• Communication & Interpersonal Skills:
o Fluent in Japanese; proficiency in English is preferred for global collaboration.
o Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to connect with stakeholders at various levels (end-users to C-level).

Preferred Qualifications
o Experience with Infor CloudSuite (LN) is an advantage.
o Ability to manage tasks across customer engagements and internal priorities with guidance.
o Eagerness to learn new software solutions and understand interoperability between applications.
o Tertiary qualification in a business, technology, or related field is preferred.

description_html:
The successful Pre-Sales Solution Consultant (SC) provides expertise to Infor prospects and customers in support of Infor’s ERP license revenue and customer outcomes. The SC provides applicable industry and software knowledge to help share compelling solutions to customers. The successful SC possesses business acumen and an ability to understand our customers’ business needs and challenges through value-based discovery to deliver strategic, industry competitive solutions. In addition, the SC will work closely with the sales organization to provide compelling solutions and presentations while becoming the trusted advisor of our customers.

A Day in the Life Typically Includes:

  • Understands clients’ critical business issues and demonstrate compelling, value-based solutions using Infor’s software capabilities.
  • Work with individuals throughout the sales organization to develop overall account and opportunity strategy.
  • Apply product knowledge, presentation skills and technical understanding to effectively present Infor products to prospects and customers.
  • Mentor and assist in training junior SCs.
  • Maintain knowledge of industry trends and competitive products.
  • Provide feedback to sales management and product management on potential new capabilities.
  • Answer functional questions related to the product line in Requests for Proposals (RFP’s). 


Basic Qualifications:

  • Experience in solution consulting (pre-sales), selling, using and/or implementing ERP solutions. 
  • Experience in Manufacturing planning, scheduling and execution, project-based manufacturing and / or after sales service or finance and accounting.
  • Experience delivering presentations to all levels of an organization.
  • Legal authorization to work permanently in the United States for any employer without requiring a visa transfer or visa sponsorship.
  • Ability to travel 40% or more.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with Infor Syteline or other ERP products.

Job Location:  US Remote (Atlanta, GA; Dallas, TX)

description_html:
Looking to jump-start your career in Solution Engineering / Presales?

We create software experiences that simplify how people work. Our Presales team is chartered with the critical mission of showcasing how our software delivers benefits and solves customer business challenges.

Infor’s Presales Foundation team prepares you to be on the front line with Infor’s field presales organization. You will be learning on-the-job about Infor solutions, targeted verticals, and how to sell - while supporting our field Presales teams with customer proposals and remote presentations.

The Presales Foundation Team provides candidates with a high-visibility career path into presales and other areas of the company, such as sales and consulting.


Key Responsibilities

·       Deliver engaging and inspiring presentations and demos to customers and prospects

·       Learn the sales processes to support the Infor Solutions consulting organization

·       Answer functional questions related to Infor products 

·       High degree of customer interaction

·       Participate and lead customer/prospect web demos

·       Create/update standard product overview presentations

·       Educate other teams within the company

·       Assist industry solutions consulting teams with building demonstration content

·       Frequent travel expected during the training phase as well as throughout your employment, visiting customers and prospect


Key Requirements/Experience

·       Full working proficiency in English and German

·       Relevant experience in pre-sales, preferred in prospecting, inside sales, business development, high technology, direct sales within the technology industry or IT consulting

·       Comfortable with public speaking and addressing our customers (excellent presentation and communication skills)

·       Social, positive attitude, and inquisitive personality

·       Must be self-motivated and a good team player who loves learning and can work in a fast-paced, quick-changing environment.

·       Interest in software

description_html:
Position Summary

We are looking for a seasoned presales/solution consultant with 7 to 10 years experience in the role of presales. The position based in Thailand with occasional engagements across the South East Asia (ASEAN) region. Reporting to the head of Solution Consulting, this individual will bring his/her industry expertise to the role.

What you need to be successful

Personality

  • Confident in conducting conversations with different levels of stakeholders ranging from C-level executives to operational process owners within the customer’s organisation.
  • Open to change and able to quickly adapt to changes in technology or directions better yet embrace technologies to elevate your engagements with customers/prospects
  • Able to work independently but brave enough to ask for help when needed
  • Passionate not only in the role about technology and its role in changing the world as we know it but also how it brings success to our customers.
  • Keen eye for detail and a desire to seek improvement….ALWAYS
  • Learning is a part of what we do, thirst for knowledge is unquenchable
  • See beyond the obvious and can read situations well
  • Ability to work with cross regional teams and overcome obstacles using remote technologies
  • You view partnerships with both internal and external stakeholders as the means to achieve joint success
  • You are able to manage dynamic situations well and are able to handle situations with confidence.


Experience

  • You know the Thailand market and can identify industry nuances quickly to take the next course of action during customer engagements
  • You will have immaculate knowledge in discrete manufacturing principals and supply chain impacts. Ideally you will have experience managing customers who operate in automotive, industrial manufacturing and/or high tech industries.
  • To be successful your prior success as a Presales/Solution Consulting would be beneficial. However, if you do not have prior experience in a Presales/Solution consulting but have excellent working knowledge in the above-mentioned industries and see yourself excelling in a different role we would like to speak to you too!
  • An understanding of the sales and buying process is useful to have


Customer Engagement Skills

  • You are an excellent communicator and can use storytelling to articulate your ideas.
  • Identify benefits and values Infor’s solution bring to the customers
  • Customer Success: you won’t be satisfied until the job is done to the right quality for our customers, this is non-negotiable
  • Comfortable in delivering quality presentations in person and remotely.

description_html:
Infor is seeking a Senior Solution Consultant (Presales) with deep expertise in the Automotive industry (ideally Tier 1 and Tier 2 suppliers) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems to join our Japan team. This role combines hands-on solution consulting with leadership responsibilities as an Automotive industry team lead. The successful candidate will drive sales opportunities by delivering compelling, value-driven demonstrations of Infor CloudSuite solutions, while collaborating with sales, consulting, and partner teams to ensure customer success.

The Senior Solution Consultant will act as a trusted advisor, leveraging their automotive industry knowledge and ERP expertise to articulate business value, scope tailored solutions, and lead strategic engagements. This role requires strong business acumen, leadership capabilities, and the ability to manage complex sales cycles while fostering collaboration across teams.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Solution Demonstrations & Presentations:
    • Lead and deliver compelling, tailored demonstrations of Infor CloudSuite solutions, focusing on automotive-specific processes in supply chain, manufacturing, procurement, and quality management.
    • Present to diverse audiences, including end-users, management, and C-level executives, both remotely and in-person, showcasing standard industry capabilities and tailored POC scenarios as needed.
    • Differentiate Infor’s solutions from competitors by highlighting unique value propositions and business outcomes.
  • Customer Engagement & Strategy:
    • Conduct discovery sessions to uncover customer business needs, strategic objectives, and key metrics driving solution evaluations.
    • Translate customer requirements into detailed technical offerings, proposals, and strategic technology roadmaps aligned with Infor solutions.
    • Partner with account executives to define account strategies, scope solutions, and prepare for prospect interactions.
  • Team Leadership & Collaboration:
    • Serve as the Automotive industry team lead, mentoring and guiding junior solution consultants to build a high-performing presales team.
    • Collaborate with sales, consulting, product marketing, and value engineering teams to develop and execute compelling presentations and demonstrations.
    • Support the transition from sales to implementation by creating high-level success roadmaps that align with customer goals.
  • Value Selling & Configuration:
    • Conduct value assessments to identify and quantify customer-specific business benefits, aligning these insights with tailored presentations and demonstrations to showcase Infor CloudSuite’s value.
    • Configure demo instances for proof-of-concept (POC) scenarios to demonstrate the feasibility and business impact of Infor solutions.
    • Stay updated on upcoming product functionality, enhance demonstration environments, and share configurations with the broader Solution Consulting team.
    • Provide technical, product, and non-functional responses for RFIs and RFPs, emphasizing outcome-driven solutions.
  • Continuous Improvement & Knowledge Sharing:
    • Contribute to the Solution Consulting community by maintaining RFP response repositories, presentation collateral, and demo content.
    • Participate in marketing events, trade shows, and value engineering engagements to promote Infor’s automotive solutions.
    • Drive continuous improvement by sharing knowledge, configurations, and best practices with the team.
  • Travel & Flexibility:
    • Travel as required within Japan and occasionally internationally for customer engagements, team collaboration, and professional development.

Skills/Qualifications/Experience

  • Industry Expertise:
    • Extensive experience in the Automotive industry, particularly with Tier 1 and Tier 2 suppliers, across functions such as supply chain, manufacturing, procurement, or quality management.
    • Deep understanding of automotive-specific business processes and challenges.
  • ERP & Technical Skills:
    • Minimum 3-5 years of experience with ERP systems (e.g., Infor CloudSuite, Oracle, SAP, or similar enterprise applications).
    • Strong technical understanding of cloud concepts, software platforms, and technical architecture.
    • Hands-on experience configuring demo instances for enterprise-level software applications.
  • Presales & Leadership Experience:
    • Proven track record in presales / solution consulting roles, supporting complex sales cycles for enterprise software.
    • Experience leading teams or mentoring colleagues, with the ability to drive sales strategies and foster collaboration across departments.
    • Strong business acumen with the ability to conduct value assessments and articulate business value to diverse stakeholders.
  • Communication & Interpersonal Skills:
    • Fluent in Japanese; proficiency in English is preferred for global collaboration.
    • Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to connect with and influence stakeholders at all levels (end-users to C-level).
  • Preferred Qualifications:
    • Experience with Infor CloudSuite (LN) is an advantage.
    • Ability to manage multiple customer engagements and internal priorities without task-level supervision.
    • Eagerness to learn new software solutions and understand interoperability between applications.
    • Tertiary qualification in a business, technology, or related field is preferred.

description_html:
The Application Support Engineer is responsible for providing the complete operational environments for the Infor LN application and other integrated Infor applications to internal Infor users (mainly LN Development and Support) and partners. Examples are development, build, test, release, training and demo environments. The activities include installation, configuration, application management, troubleshooting, support, monitoring and performing the operational procedures specific to the products supported. A close cooperation with the IT organization and stakeholders is required to deliver a sustaining environment that meets the stakeholders’ needs.

Next to that, the Application Support Engineer is responsible for performing monthly activities for the Infor LN CE cloud releases, such as build and deploy of the software in the Development account of our (AWS) cloud solution.

Key Responsibilities

· Install, configure and maintain a variety of Infor applications to support the Development and Release process of Infor LN. These applications operate both on premises and in the Cloud (AWS).

· Support internal users in case of problems or requirements related to the different application environments

· Work closely with the Development and the IT organization to deliver the different environments.

Key Requirements/Experience

· A completed education (HBO/MBO level)

· Quickly learn new Infor applications and be able to maintain and configure them

· Cooperative with other team members

· Ability to work independently within the team

· Speaks advanced Dutch and English

Advantages

· Knowledge of the Infor LN application (preferably Technical knowledge)

· Knowledge of scripting languages, such as perl, python, powershell.

· Knowledge of databases, especially SQL Server and Oracle

· Knowledge of Linux/Unix

· Knowledge of IT infrastructure in Amazon Web Services (AWS)

· Experience with System Management (mostly Windows) and desiring to move into Application Management

The Services Business Development organization drives qualified pipeline by connecting customers with the right services offerings - from cloud modernization and adoption to optimization and value realization.

As a Services BDR Manager, you lead and develop a high-performing team of Business Development Representatives focused on services-led, value-based pipeline generation.   • Credible, value-driven customer conversations

  • Proven Business Development leadership experience
  • Strong understanding of services-led and consultative selling
  • Experience operating across regions and lines of business
  • Comfort working in a global, matrix organization
  • Advanced use of CRM and prospecting technology

description_html:
Position Overview

We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Team Lead, Quality Assurance to join our team. The ideal candidate will bring deep expertise in software testing and quality processes, proven leadership in mentoring and guiding QA professionals, and a passion for driving quality in enterprise-class products. This role combines hands-on functional and automation testing with leadership responsibilities to ensure product excellence and customer satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead, mentor, and manage a team of QA engineers, providing guidance, coaching, and performance feedback.
  • Define, implement, and maintain effective QA processes, test strategies, and best practices across functional, automation, and performance testing.
  • Collaborate with product managers, architects, and development teams to understand requirements and translate them into effective test coverage.
  • Drive test automation initiatives, contributing to the design and implementation of automation frameworks (preferably using Python or related technologies).
  • Review and enhance test plans, test cases, and automation scripts to ensure high standards of coverage, reusability, and maintainability.
  • Perform functional, regression, system integration, and exploratory testing of enterprise-class applications.
  • Ensure timely test execution, defect management, and reporting of QA metrics to stakeholders.
  • Promote continuous improvement in QA practices and foster a culture of quality across the team and organization.
  • Stay current with emerging trends, tools, and technologies in Quality Assurance and Automation.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).
  • 10+ years of hands-on experience in Software Quality Assurance with expertise in functional and automation testing.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in leading, mentoring, or managing QA team members.
  • Strong understanding of QA methodologies, SDLC, STLC, and defect lifecycle management.
  • Proficiency in automation testing tools and frameworks, with hands-on experience in at least one automation framework (Python-based frameworks preferred).
  • Experience working with enterprise-class products, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications (Added Advantage)

  • Experience working with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) products.
  • Proven experience in designing or contributing to automation frameworks based on Python.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
  • Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes).

Key Attributes

  • Strong leadership and people management skills.
  • Passion for quality, detail orientation, and continuous learning.
  • Ability to balance hands-on testing responsibilities with team leadership.
  • Effective communicator who can influence cross-functional teams.

We are looking for Software Engineer with 4-5 years of experience in Software Product development with following core attributes –

  • Strong product development experience and knowledge of product development  processes
  • Strong technical skills with ability to own different feature areas of the product
  • Ability to work in parallel release cycles
  • Should have good communication skills to interact with the stakeholders and clear understanding of requirements
  • Ability to work in collaboration with teams from different  geographical locations
  • Must worked on Microsoft .Net development platform and related technologies

·       Knowledge of Amazon cloud is preferred

·       Looking for full stack dotnet developer

  • Should have interest in system integrations, data exchange techniques
  • Knowledge of ERP systems and Business Processes is preferred
  • Excellent Communication Skills (Written, Verbal, team work and issue resolution)
  • Experience with microservices architecture, and event-driven design
  • Familiarity with security best practices in software development, such as OWASP guidelines, secure coding principles, and implementing authentication/authorization frameworks (e.g., OAuth, SAML, JWT).
  • Comfortable and experienced in agile development environments, demonstrating adaptability to evolving requirements and timelines while maintaining high productivity and focus on deliverables.
