  • Development of different product features
  • Write comprehensive unit test cases
  • Assist Lead in spec review, UI mockup review, translating High level design to low level design, impact analysis and task estimates
  • Ensure code documentation (Inline, function / module level)
  • Enhancement and maintenance support of existing components
  • Ensure updates to code documentation
  • Assist in CI/CD pipeline and ensure product build is successful
  • Performs code walkthrough to ensure all code paths are covered, dead code is removed

  • Escalates to lead, manager when implementation deviates from specs, UI mockup
  • Debug and fix bugs arising during development and testing
  • Help Support team with Issue Diagnostic and Resolution

  • Extensive experience in performance optimization and scalability, with a focus on designing high-performance systems and utilizing profiling tools and techniques to optimize both code and infrastructure for maximum efficiency

  • Minimum of 8 years’ experience in software development
  • Good team player
  • Good Communication skills and ability to work with multiple teams
  • Technology hands on - Microsoft .NET – C#, ASP.Net, dotnet core, XML/XSL standards, SQL Server, JQuery, WebAPI and Web services

  • Knowledge of design patterns is essential
  • Configuration management tools Git, Oxford
  • Good understanding of AWS Cloud technologies like AWS Lambda, Step function, SQS and other

Infor is seeking a Support Operations Team Lead to lead Product Support Analysts supporting Department of Defense (DoD) customers utilizing Infor’s Hospitality Management Solution (HMS). This role is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day activities and KPI’s of the Product Support team. The Support Operations Team Lead will work closely with management, keeping them informed of schedules, priorities, or team challenges.

  • Ability to work weekends and holidays as needed.
  • US Citizenship is required due to US Government contract requirements.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Degree in business, accounting, or related preferred.
  • Hospitality industry knowledge a plus.
  • Experience managing a product support or technical support team.
  • Experience using SQL.

description_html:
The Infor Technical Consultant is responsible for supporting the implementation, configuration, integration, and testing of Infor M3 and Infor OS solutions across customer environments. The role focuses on designing and delivering robust technical integrations, EDI connections, and IDM configurations that enable efficient data flows and stable system operations. Working both independently and in collaboration with different teams, the consultant applies foundational technical expertise to solve business problems, optimize processes, and contribute to successful project outcomes. This position plays a key role in ensuring continuity, maintaining solution quality, and supporting smooth cloud migrations, new implementations, and internal standardization initiatives. 

A Day in the Life Typically Includes

  • Designing and developing integrations within Infor OS and between external or non-ERP applications.
  • Implementing and maintaining EDI connections, mappings, and document exchanges.
  • Configuring and supporting Infor Document Management (IDM) document templates and workflows.
  • Troubleshooting technical issues and ensuring stable, scalable system integrations.
  • Providing technical documentation, guidance, and training to developers and end users.
  • Contributing to full project lifecycles, including solution design, estimation, implementation, and post-go-live support.
  • Deliver daily technical support to customers, resolving issues and ensuring system stability.

Required Skills

  •  Experience designing and supporting integrations in Infor OS (ION, ION API, MEC) or similar integration platforms.
  • Understanding of EDI standards, document flows, and connectivity methods.
  • Hands-on experience with Infor extensibility tools such as H5 Script, XtendM3, or equivalent technologies.
  • Ability to analyse technical requirements and translate them into maintainable, scalable solutions.
  • Proficiency in troubleshooting system and integration issues across multiple environments.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively with technical- and functional stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications

  • Familiarity with Infor M3 technical consulting, integrations, or extensibility frameworks.
  • Bonus points for experience configuring IDM document templates or workflows.
  • Familiarity with API management, data transformation, or cloud integration concepts.
  • Any combination of relevant certifications in Infor technologies or cloud integration platforms.
  • Familiar with the EDIFACT standards for Retail.
  • Familiarity with APIs (REST, SOAP) and database concepts.
  • Full professional proficiency in Dutch and English (Dutch strongly preferred).

description_html:
Job location: Germany, Austria - home or office based

The Infor Consulting Services Organization is looking for outstanding Technical Consultant (m/f/d) to work with Infor M3 clients across the DACH region.

The Technical Consultant can understand customer business drivers and current IT environment. The Technical Consultant ensures solution feasibility and proposes a roadmap to realize the solution.

The Technical Consultant is operating across multiple solution domains utilizing their broad knowledge of the Infor solution portfolio to identify the components required to construct the most appropriate solution for the customer. The Technical Consultant is typically engaged full time as part of the project delivery structure and has experience in one or more industry segments such as Retail, Distribution, Industrial Manufacturing, Food and Beverage or Enterprise Asset Management.

To ensure that you have the tools and resources to take your career to the next level, Infor Services provides an intense, on-going training program that is second to none in the industry.

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Acts as an expert and evangelist in Infor Applications and Technology
  • Provide technical consultative guidance and assistance directly to users in a professional and organized manner, using detailed technical knowledge in accordance with Infor’s implementation methodology
  • Ability to decompose large complex problems into manageable pieces allowing communication on both business and technical levels.
  • Skilled at presenting to C-level audiences focusing on demonstrating the business value of solutions rather than technical detail.
  • Knowledge and experience in the application of Infor architecture engagement processes and tools.
  • Knowledge of the important standards for business processes, information models and architectural models generally applied in an industry.
  • Maintains awareness of IT Industry architecture frameworks and approaches.
  • Maintains up to date knowledge of business drivers & typical customer needs within an industry.
  • Designs, develops, documents, and delivers solution architectures that meet client needs.
  • Builds and maintains effective relationships with customer throughout the sales lifecycle.
  • Actively ensures that design/development standards are upheld.

What You Will Need:

  • Implementation experience across all business process areas of Warehousing, Logistics, Procurement; or Manufacturing and Planning; or Customer Sales, Management; or Service and Rental.
  • Experience of Oracle or SQL Database Server and languages.
  • Integration Skills: EDI, Bank Standards, XML, Web Services, Workflow and Alerts.
  • Experience with web-based technologies and networking concepts.
  • Experience with XML-based messaging integration technologies.
  • Strong customer-facing consulting experience
  • Reliability and deadline-driven approach.
  • Strong organizational skills & time management skills. 
  • Strong oral and written communication that effectively articulates complex ideas. 
  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team but also self-motivated.
  • Team player with the ability to build strong peer and interpersonal relationships. 
  • Excellent problem solving and analytic skills.
  • Fluent in German language and English language is mandatory.
  • Willingness to travel.

description_html:
An Information Developer plans, organizes, writes and codes online help, user, installation, and release-related documentation for business software that is correct and written to standards within the timeline defined for a project. The information developer works closely with development teams. The scope of external communication is limited. Operates under general supervision; typically reports to a manager of Information Development.


A Day in The Life Typically Includes:
• Demonstrates technical writing expertise by writing and publishing help text, user manuals, installation instructions, and release notes.
• Researches and gathers information; interprets software business and technical designs and organizes and writes content for documentation projects.
• Provides key content that enables the user to understand functionality and perform processes effectively; avoids writing intuitive, repetitive and unnecessary content.
• Creates, tests, and troubleshoots online help for assigned software applications.
• Delivers quality documents with minimal errors; edits materials for clarity, organization, and adherence to standards. 
• Takes an active role in projects, presents ideas in a constructive manner, demonstrates openness and builds on the ideas of others.

What You Will Need:
Basic Qualifications:
• Holds a Bachelor’s degree in technical writing, information design, business, or computer science or the equivalent level of technical training and work experience.
• Requires 3 to 5 years of relevant experience.
• Demonstrates excellent English language usage and writing skills.
• Advanced problem solving and analytic skills.
• Familiarity with markup languages and proven experience with authoring tools such as DITA XML, CCMS.
• Good PC skills with knowledge of various operating systems, file management tools, graphic design tools, and common MS office applications.

What Will Put You Ahead?
Preferred Qualifications:
• Industry specific knowledge or experience
• Excellent interpersonal skills; works well with team members at all levels of the organization.
• Manages time effectively resulting in maximum overall efficiency.
• Resourceful and creative in devising processes and solutions.

description_html:
Job Description: Inside Partner Sales Manager – EMEA Emerging Markets

(Eastern Europe focus)

Position Summary

Infor is experiencing strong growth across Emerging Markets, especially Eastern Europe. We are seeking an Inside Partner Sales Manager to accelerate regional success by strengthening partner relationships and driving new business exclusively through our indirect sales ecosystem.

In this role, you will empower partners to expand their footprint, transition from installed-base activity to new logo acquisition, and support Infor’s CloudSuite ERP and EDGE product strategy. This is a great opportunity for a sales professional seeking growth in a dynamic international environment with a path toward management.

Key Responsibilities

Channel & Territory Development

  • Manage a portfolio of strategic existing partners across the region.
  • Drive partners to shift focus from installed-base maintenance to new customer acquisition.
  • Support partners with business plans, forecasting, pipeline development, and sales strategy.
  • Promote Infor’s CloudSuite ERP and Strategic products within the territory.

Sales Execution

  • Own an annual sales target via indirect sales.
  • Help partners identify, qualify, and progress sales opportunities.
  • Support partners through sales cycles, including customer meetings and deal strategy.
  • Ensure partners meet license quotas and maintain pipeline coverage.

Ecosystem Collaboration

  • Align with regional leadership on market priorities and verticals.
  • Collaborate with marketing on lead generation and partner enablement.

Operational & Strategic Contribution

  • Understand partner business models and identify growth opportunities.
  • Ensure smooth cooperation, respecting quota allocation and avoiding overlaps.
  • Provide strategic input for long-term channel development in the region.

Key Requirements / Experience

Essential

  • Proven experience in channel sales, partner management, or indirect go-to-market roles.
  • Strong understanding of enterprise software, ideally ERP and/or Supply Chain in the Cloud.
  • Consistent track record achieving revenue targets through partners.
  • Excellent communication skills; able to collaborate across partner ecosystem, sales, product, leadership, and marketing.
  • Skilled navigating multinational organizations and internal processes.
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken); Slavic language (Polish, Czech,...) is a plus but is not mandatory.
  • Office-based contract in our Barcelona hub (3 days a week)

Highly Desirable

  • Experience with inside sales and mid-sized deal cycles.
  • Familiarity with cloud-based enterprise solutions.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business or administration.
  • Ambition to progress in a fast-growing, international tech company

Benefits

  • Clear and motivating progression path to develop and grow
  • Flexibility to work between home and office (Hybrid: 3 days minimum working at the office)
  • Competitive and attainable compensation structure with extra incentives. Salary will be discussed on first interview.
  • Office situated in Barcelona (Saint Marti next to Glories)
  • Ticket restaurant – explore Barcelona´s best local cuisines.
  • Private medical insurance
  • Monthly team events: Sport club, social club and charity events.
  • And More…

description_html:
The UX Designer will play a critical role in maintaining and evolving the Infor Design System (IDS), ensuring consistency, usability, and scalability across our global suite of enterprise applications. This position focuses on auditing existing design components, implementing enhancements, and collaborating with development teams to deliver high-quality, user-centered designs. The designer must be detail-oriented, highly collaborative, and passionate about design systems and user experience within an Agile environment.

A day in the life of a UX/UI Designer typically includes:
• Start the day by reviewing JIRA tasks, prioritizing work, and sharing at the daily standup.
• Update design system components, patterns, guidelines, and other supporting documentation.
• Conduct audits of the design system to identify inconsistencies and log necessary tickets for fixes or updates.
• Consult with product teams on designing using IDS and recommended UX improvements.
• Collaborate with peers and escalate to lead designers for alignment on complex design decisions.
• Prepare detailed Figma handoff documentation and ensure developer tickets include all required assets.
• Share progress updates and escalate risks and blockers appropriately.

Responsibilities:
• Contribute to the evolution and governance of the Infor design system by introducing scalable solutions and maintaining component integrity across applications.
• Ensure design system consistency through proactive audits and implementation of improvements to align with UX standards.
• Partner with product teams to provide actionable UX recommendations that align with business objectives and user needs.
• Foster collaboration with global design and development teams to achieve cohesive, user-centric experiences.
• Deliver comprehensive design documentation and specifications to support efficient and accurate development handoff.
• Promote clear, timely communication of project status, potential risks, and blockers across distributed teams.

What You Will Need?
Basic Qualification:
• Minimum of 4–5 years of professional experience in a UX or UI design role within a software development environment.
• Demonstrated experience leveraging, contributing to, or maintaining design systems.
• Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
• Proficiency in Figma.
• Strong understanding of UX and design principles, user-centered design methodologies, and best practices in product design.
• Strong attention to detail combined with critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
• Amendable to report onsite 3x a week.

What Will Put You Ahead?
Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have):
• Working knowledge of agile processes and familiarity with tools such as JIRA for task management.
• Basic understanding of front-end development concepts (HTML5, CSS).
• Understanding of UX research, including preparing and conducting interviews, creating personas, and mapping customer journeys.
• Experience working in global teams and with distributed team members across various time zones.
• Familiarity with documenting design patterns and contributing to design system governance.

As a Senior Solution Consultant for Workforce Management, you’ll be the trusted advisor and technical expert for WMF solutions. Working closely with our sales and consulting teams, you’ll guide strategic customers through complex challenges, deliver solution designs, and demonstrate the power of Infor technology. This is a unique opportunity to expand your skills, influence product strategy, and work on global, high-profile projects.

What You’ll Do

  • Partner with strategic customers and prospects to understand complex workforce management needs.
  • Lead solution design, implementation planning, and demonstrations of WMF solutions.
  • Support sales teams by responding to RFPs and creating tailored proposals.
  • Act as a subject-matter expert, providing guidance and mentoring within the team.
  • Collaborate across functions to ensure seamless solution delivery and customer success.
  • Engage with executives and stakeholders, translating technical solutions into business impact.

Who You Are

You’re a problem solver, creative thinker, and trusted advisor who thrives in a collaborative, international environment. You enjoy exploring new technologies, tackling complex challenges, and helping customers achieve their goals. You value continuous learning and have a flexible mindset, ready to grow into HCM and other related areas.

Key Attributes:

  • English & Spanish fluency (any additional language such as German, Italian, French, Nordic languages highly valued)
  • Technical and functional expertise in Workforce Management solutions (WMF or equivalent).
  • Comfortable with backend systems, scheduling engines, time & attendance, and workforce planning tools.
  • Confident interacting with executives and presenting complex solutions.
  • Team-oriented, culturally open, and driven to find innovative solutions.
  • Eager to expand your skillset and take on diverse, international projects.

What Makes This Role Special
